Story of My Book

My name is Ron Cohen and I am the author of Working With Robots.

As artificial intelligence invades more and more aspects of our lives, the big questions on everyone’s mind is how it will affect our jobs. Will we eventually enjoy the luxury of working just a few hours a week while bots handle all the most disagreeable chores for us? Or will AI systems take all the good jobs, leaving us in a permanent underclass? and how do we prepare ourselves to an unpredictable future?

We need to prepare students of today for the jobs of tomorrow while also helping today’s workforce reskill and upskill to meet changing requirements. As it turns out, the future of work conversation is inherently a future of education conversation.

A lot of people who are concerned about the future of work have no idea what skills to study or master. Nobody wants to waste time and money acquiring skills that won’t be of use in the future. We will gradually reach a period where some human skills will not be needed.  This book will have the greatest impact on students, but regardless where you are in your career—this book is relevant, a must-read, and timely.
In this book, you'll learn about the following:
<ul>
• As artificial intelligence invades more and more aspects of our lives, one of the big questions on everyone’s mind is how it will affect our jobs?
• Should you trust universities to prepare you for the future of work? Will your college diploma still have any value 15, 10 or even 5 years from now?
• How you can leverage your human advantage to put yourself in a better position to Work with Robots?

My hope is that, reading this book, you’ll understand the impact that AI is going to have on the future work, and by knowing that you’ll understand the actions you need to take to leverage your skills will help you understand the transformation in the world of work and education and help you create a process for more personal accountability.
The Book - Working With Robots

The book is written in 3 Parts:

Part 1, Chapters 1-4. Contains the introduction + additional chapters. Exploring the Future of Work, and the trends that will shape the way we work and transform our workplace

Part 2, Chapters 5-7. Contains what changes our education system needs to make to meet the rapidly changing requirements of the industry.

Part 3, Chapters 8-9. Contains what students today can do to prepare for an unpredictable future.

And more...
About the Author
Ron Cohen is a certified AI &
column2: Business strategy from MIT Sloan Executive Education, and hold an MBA from Georgetown McDonough School of Business. He is passionate about innovative technology, and enjoy talking about the Impact of Disruptive Technologies on Jobs, Skills and education. He’s a future enthusiast, a world-class ping-pong player, and a mediocre karaoke singer.

column1: <h3><strong>Risks &amp

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

• Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #WWR and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
• You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
• Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Ron Cohen

(* The initial goal was reached -- however please read the ""Stretch Goal,"" information below.)

The genesis of this project came out of my
experience during the Viet Nam War as a combat medic and conscientious objector
(Charlie Company, Company C 1/52 198 LIB, Americal Division), when I witnessed
a number of deeply disturbing incidents and ended up being shot several times
during an ambush. The soldiers in my company helped save my life. In the years
following the war, I struggled with severe PTSD and flashbacks, which were
always in the background as I trained to become a fine art photographer, but
never addressed in my images. Finally, between 2000 and 2005, with the support
of a VA granting program for disabled veterans, I took a series of extended
trips to Vietnam in order to revisit the battle site where I was wounded, take
portraits of Vietnamese war veterans, and document the beauties and
complexities of post-war Vietnam. This was an attempt to reconcile my traumatic
memories through art. I left Vietnam with a small body of work that I plan to
develop into a book-length photo essay (“Bearing Witness:  A Combat
Medic’s Photographic Journey Back to the Present.”)
While working on this project, I unexpectedly
uncovered another facet of my journey:  the stories and recollections of
the men who were in my company. Over the past year, in researching my own project,
I’ve been able to reconnect with a number of my fellow vets through phone
calls, get-togethers, and email. In the process of helping me to put together
the sequence of events on the day of the ambush, they ended up sharing with me
details that I had not known before.
And, as they helped fill in the blanks in my
memory, their own stories began to emerge as well. In Vietnam, most of us were
in our teens or twenties and had never even been outside the US. In the ensuing
years, many found they, like me, had troubling or mysterious gaps in their
recollections. Many of my brothers in Charlie Company went through horrific
experiences that they have never spoken about. Since the Vietnam War itself was
at the center of protests and demonstrations during the 1960’s, many of us were
given a less than warm welcome when we returned. We retreated into silence.
Elements of shame and secrecy have continued to
linger through the ensuing four decades, to the present day. To a man, none of
us have ever forgotten our experiences of that war, but for most those memories
had remained in a locked box of the past.
But, in trying to help me reconstruct my own
experiences, with a bit of gentle persuasion some of my brothers began to open
up about their own. Poetry
long been committed to memory have been shared.
Importantly, because we served together and
there is complete unquestioned trust, as well as genuine love for one other, we
are able to share openly some our most traumatic memories. As I heard or read
their amazing and touching recollections, I knew that this material needed to
be recorded and documented. Together, we have been able to stitch together a
more complete picture of many of the incidents – some horrific, others strange
and even funny – that we went through. This project will not only help us to
remember together
column2: the stories will also vividly convey to a new audience the

column1: chaos and complexity of incidents that happen on the battlefield. These
accounts are all too often never heard beyond their immediate families – if
even. And, while my view is undeniably biased, I also truly believe that the
collection of characters and personalities in Charlie Company is exceptionally
interesting, and their individual accounts together convey aspects of the war
that I have not seen recounted elsewhere in quite the same way.
There is also the real issue of time passing.
Rather than letting Vietnam fade into the distant past, the voices of these
combat veterans need to be preserved, because we are all getting older now –
many of us are in our sixties. This brings an additional sense of urgency to
this project.
My goal is to interview up to 10 veterans at
this year's Charlie Company reunion, which will be held over a 3-day period,
this July in St. Louis. I plan on other interviews (up to 10 or 15) by phone or
Skype and hope to personally visit those within driving distance of me here in
Arizona. The edited audio, email exchanges, and other materials gathered will
be contributed to our company's website (http://www.angelfire.com/mo2/CharlieCoScarf/
website), circulated as widely as possible via email and word of mouth, and
available as a downloads to vets and their families. If possible, I hope to
have the accounts featured on a dedicated website.
We should, of course never ever forget the
incredible sacrifice that these men, women, and their families have made. But
it is in hearing their personal, authentic accounts that their sacrifices
become more real.  I count myself as one of the lucky ones – one of the
fortunate ones that came home. Tragically for the families whose sons and
daughters weren’t as fortunate – their pain is never ending. That sacrifice needs
to be honored and never stricken from our collective memory
is a small contribution to this end.
I've spent significant funds out of my own
pocket in helping give this project form, from the photographic aspect to the
oral history component, and am now turning to friends, family and their
networks to continue this journey. The funds raised through INDIEGOGO will
help support travel expenses and basic recording equipment needed to make
high-quality recordings of these stories.
The working title of this project is “Cascading
Voices,” which reflects the overlapping voices of soldiers from my company and
their various perspectives and backgrounds, brought together by our experiences
in Vietnam. I envision the impact of these stories – cascading over and with
each other– will be like a waterfall that tumbles over itself and into a single
pool.
I’ve had many years to reflect, suffer, and get to the other side of
my fears regarding this war. I feel that I'm finally able to articulate that
experience with more openness and with a sense of humility, and would like to
share the process with my brothers, by providing a vehicle and outlet for them
to do the same. Instead of remaining a dark and painful mystery, this project
hopes to bring clarity by allowing us to speak to each other, witness to

witness.

Stretch Goal: $5,000

I deeply appreciate and am touched by the support this project has received so far. Based on the enthusiastic feedback and suggestions I've received, I was encouraged to set out the full vision and needs of the project. The additional funds raised by reaching the ""stretch goal"" would enable me to greatly enhance the impact of the project by supporting video and personnel needs. This would include:

- Having a production assistant to work with me at the Charlie Company reunion in July. Rather than having to deal with all the logistics and technical details by myself at this large event, a locally based, experienced assistant could help with set-ups, organizing, overseeing equipment, and countless other details.

- Incorporate videotaping, which would greatly add to the power of the interviews and dialogues. Video was something I considered when this idea came about, but it seemed out of reach. I have some equipment for recording HD video, but having someone to help with filming and sound would be essential.

- Working with experienced video and sound editors to organize the raw footage and distill the interviews that I collect. (I expect it will be many hours of audio and/or video material.) The additional funds could cover honoraria for AV professionals willing to contribute much of their time pro bono. It would be ideal to locate Vietnam-era veterans who are experienced in these areas.

I never anticipated that I could actually raise enough funds to realize my full vision for this project, but with additional funding that is now within reach. Thank you for any support you can give.

pocket in helping give this project form, from the photographic aspect to the
oral history component, and am now turning to friends, family and their
networks to continue this journey. The funds raised through INDIEGOGO will
help support travel expenses and basic recording equipment needed to make
high-quality recordings of these stories.
The working title of this project is “Cascading
Voices,” which reflects the overlapping voices of soldiers from my company and
their various perspectives and backgrounds, brought together by our experiences
in Vietnam. I envision the impact of these stories – cascading over and with
each other– will be like a waterfall that tumbles over itself and into a single
pool.
I’ve had many years to reflect, suffer, and get to the other side of
my fears regarding this war. I feel that I'm finally able to articulate that
experience with more openness and with a sense of humility, and would like to
share the process with my brothers, by providing a vehicle and outlet for them
to do the same. Instead of remaining a dark and painful mystery, this project
hopes to bring clarity by allowing us to speak to each other, witness to

witness.Stretch Goal: $5,000I deeply appreciate and am touched by the support this project has received so far. Based on the enthusiastic feedback and suggestions I've received, I was encouraged to set out the full vision and needs of the project. The additional funds raised by reaching the ""stretch goal"" would enable me to greatly enhance the impact of the project by supporting video and personnel needs. This would include:- Having a production assistant to work with me at the Charlie Company reunion in July. Rather than having to deal with all the logistics and technical details by myself at this large event, a locally based, experienced assistant could help with set-ups, organizing, overseeing equipment, and countless other details.- Incorporate videotaping, which would greatly add to the power of the interviews and dialogues. Video was something I considered when this idea came about, but it seemed out of reach. I have some equipment for recording HD video, but having someone to help with filming and sound would be essential.- Working with experienced video and sound editors to organize the raw footage and distill the interviews that I collect. (I expect it will be many hours of audio and/or video material.) The additional funds could cover honoraria for AV professionals willing to contribute much of their time pro bono. It would be ideal to locate Vietnam-era veterans who are experienced in these areas.I never anticipated that I could actually raise enough funds to realize my full vision for this project, but with additional funding that is now within reach. Thank you for any support you can give.",0.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","Gilbert, United States",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/witness-to-witness-cascading-voices-from-vietnam/pica

Breve reseña
surgimiento de este proyecto se remonta a 25 años atrás cuando el Ing. Omar
Betancourt Buil estaba trabajando en la idea en un proyecto de desarrollo de un
aparato demostrativo para clases a alumnos de mecanización agropecuaria y tuvo
la necesidad que seleccionar un sistema de transporte capaz de retornar a su
sitio y origen un volumen de tierra que era movido por debajo de maquetas de
máquinas agrícolas. De esta experiencia sacó como conclusión que este medio tenía
la posibilidad de ser aplicado al transporte de personas y que sería un tipo de
transportación mucho más eficaz que los actuales y además no antes conocido,
este objetivo se trabajó en el desarrollo de este sistema que permite que las
personas aborden un mecanismo de transportación por sus propios pies, a partir
de ser aceleradas hasta alcanzar una velocidad exactamente igual a la que
tienen una banda transportadora que se mueve por uno de sus lado de forma
ininterrumpida, para que de esta forma la pudiera abordar como si estuviera

detenida.


Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes

De no cumplirse la meta en la proyección de los fondos recaudados se ajustaran al desarrollo de un prototipo más pequeño.
El impacto
el momento no existe una proyección concreta, sobre cómo eliminar las
situaciones problemicas referentes a la transportación masiva de las ciudades,
a partir de la proyección de un sistema de transporte urbano público efectivo, la
mayoría de las propuestas de los gobiernos, instituciones gubernamentales y
organismos mundiales están basadas en opciones “no tecnológicas”, lo cual ha
generado mundialmente un retraso tecnológico de éste tema y convirtiéndose en
un freno para el desarrollo de casi la totalidad de la actividad humana
productiva y de servicios, además de no hacerle frente de manera rápida y
concreta a los problemas que genera el transporte actual y que comprometen la supervivencia
de todos los ser humanos, como son: la alta contaminación ambiental, la
accidentalidad, los embotellamientos, los altos costos energéticos y la
reducción de los espacios vitales, entre otros aspectos.

column2: >La importancia de crear las bases para la

column1: aplicación de este sistema de transporte es que el mismo permitiría transportar
a millones de pasajeros, el gasto energético seria de alrededor del 10 % menos
que el actual, no contaminaría el ambiente, seria seguro, disminuiría los
accidentes, disminuiría los embotellamientos del tránsito, aumentaría el
espacio vital en las ciudades y disminuiría el precio del pasaje.

column3: >El desarrollo de este proyecto es en escencia un reto que contribuiria a  la supervivencia del planeta y además favoreciaria a crear todo un sistema de industrias vinculadas a este sistema, que permitiría

column1: el fomento económico y la posibilidad de empleo de miles de personas. Las
economías se beneficiarían grandemente y pondría al sistema de transporte a un
nivel competitivo de sostenibilidad mundial.

column5: >re-imagines narratives of the African Diaspora, incorporating themes of identity, folklore, and the supernatural.
column7:

In addition to writing fiction, Dianca London is a music blogger, book reviewer, secret poet, and
column19: > journalist. Her work has been featured in Hyphen, APIARY Magazine, New Wave Vomit, The Big Takeover, The Literary Review, and xoJane.

column3:
>
She is an accepted participant for VONA / Voices 2014 workshop for Speculative Fiction at UC Berkeley. The workshop will take place June 22-28.
column4: >All donations will help support the cost of attendance (including tuition,
column5:
>travel, room, and board). Your donations will help give Dianca London the opportunity to revise, expand, and workshop her manuscript ""The Sharecropper's Daughter"" and further cultivate her skills as a fiction writer. 

How can you help?
column9: >$2000.00 to cover tuition ($1380), airfare/travel, room, and board
column10: >If the the entire goal is not reached, all funds raised will help cover the cost of Dianca London's attendance at Vona Voices 2014.
column11:

Why does this matter?
column13: >Dianca London, as a writer of color, will greatly benefit from the VONA Voices experience. By supporting her, you are supporting the

> of her voice as a writer, and the subsequent expansion and diversification of the literary canon.

How else can you help?

Help support Dianca London's goals by sharing this campaign with friends!

","Dianca London is currently earning her MFA at the New School for Fiction. She holds a MA in English and an MA in Humanities from Arcadia University. Her fiction re-imagines narratives of the African Diaspora, incorporating themes of identity, folklore, and the supernatural. In addition to writing fiction, Dianca London is a music blogger, book reviewer, secret poet, and an occasional journalist. Her work has been featured in Hyphen, APIARY Magazine, New Wave Vomit, The Big Takeover, The Literary Review, and xoJane.

column1: She is an accepted participant for VONA / Voices 2014 workshop for Speculative Fiction at UC Berkeley. The workshop will take place June 22-28. All donations will help support the cost of attendance (including tuition, travel, room, and board). Your donations will help give Dianca London the opportunity to revise, expand, and workshop her manuscript ""The Sharecropper's Daughter"" and further cultivate her skills as a fiction writer. How can you help?$2000.00 to cover tuition ($1380), airfare/travel, room, and boardIf the the entire goal is not reached, all funds raised will help cover the cost of Dianca London's attendance at Vona Voices 2014.  Those willing to support this goal will receive original works of fiction, personalized letters of thanks, and more!Why does this matter?Dianca London, as a writer of color, will greatly benefit from the VONA Voices experience. By supporting her, you are supporting the cultivation of her voice as a writer, and the subsequent expansion and diversification of the literary canon.How else can you help?Help support Dianca London's goals by sharing this campaign with friends!",0.0,0,"1 Campaign

Useless Idiots: The Proper Care and Feeding of Liberals

by Todd Kincannon

It's no secret that I'm presently writing ""Useless Idiots: The Proper Care and Feeding of Liberals."" I've gotten a number of requests to place further pre-orders after the initial round of pre-orders. Use this to pre-order an e-book for $15, an inscribed paperback for $20, or two inscribed paperbacks and an autographed Noodle picture for $40.

The book will be a comprehensive guide for fighting the Left designed for conservative activists at all levels. If you care about defeating liberals and taking our country back, pre-order this book and use it to fight the bad guys during the 2014 elections and beyond. I promise it'll be worth every penny.

Me
I
am a Genuine Initiated Hindu Vaishnava Priest (GIHVP.) No, seriously! Not only
that, I have written a book. Yes, seriously! How many people do you know who
are Genuine Initiated Hindu Vaishnava Priests Who Have Written a Book
(GIHVPWHWAB)? I’m betting none!
My
writing: I worked as Editor for a regional newspaper in Colorado for thirteen years,
as Business Page editor (not that it helped my finances!) for a publication in
Canada, and have been published in newspapers and magazines including the
Denver Post and the Himalayan News. I wrote a play that was presented at the Brooks Center Arts Play Showcase Festival, in Denver, Colorado.
I
have organized several conferences on Science and Spirituality, have spoken at
churches, Interfaith meetings and diversity conferences. I also published an
electronic newsletter on Science and Spirituality for several years.
I’m
also a genuine, self-realized yogi (GSRY.) Actually not! I have to admit, that
despite attempts at yoga sadhana (practice,) I still breathe like a horse,
can’t get my joints to bend and can’t sing a note of kirtan!
The
Novel
A)  The
Background:
In
1933 James Hilton, in his novel <i>Lost
Horizon, wrote about the legend
<span>of Shangri-La (a variant of the original Shambala,) a valley
hidden deep in the Himalayas, whose inhabitants lead extremely long lives. The
book was instrumental in introducing the mysticism of the East to Western
readers
column2: yet Hilton had knowledge of only a small part of the entire narrative.

column1: The
story of this hidden place, a
narrative sacred to both Buddhists and Hindus, is in fact <span>well known in
India, China and
<span>other Oriental countries. In my studies as a Hindu Vaishnava
priest, I learnt of
this narrative in a scripture named the Srimad Bhagavatam (also known as the
Bhagavat purana,) which mentions Shambala in connection with a much larger
story: that of the degradation of humanity at the end of time, the appearance
of the tenth Avatar of Vishnu named Kalki and his role in defeating the forces of evil at that time.
The
idea of presenting this engaging story to the everyday reader, especially to
those in the yoga community, immediately came to mind. The key was not just to
recite the ancient legend, but to let it be seen through the eyes of modern
protagonists who would not only have their own engaging stories to tell, but

also act as guides for the western audience.

The Story:
The Yoga Zapper is the tale of two young
American brothers, who, thrust into strange worlds, find within themselves the
courage and faith to grow, change and discover their unimagined destinies.
While trekking in the Himalayas,
Steve and Jack encounter a dying priest who thrusts into their hands a Sanskrit
scripture which Jack names the Yoga Zapper.
“You do not understand,” cries
the old man. “Your lives, no, the future of the entire world depends on it!”
Little do the brothers know that
the text is a prescription for time-travel. In the midst of a deep conflict
with each other, they discover its powers. Steve, who has an intellectual
approach to life, is transported to a peaceful village at the beginning of
time. He falls in love with the beautiful Shanti and finally connects with his
heart. In search of his brother, Steve and Shanti join a group of yogis in a
pilgrimage to Shambala. There, they learn how to live in an ethereal state for
thousands of years.
Jack, irresponsible and immature,
finds himself in a society ruled by an evil despot. Sucked into the intrigue
and treachery of a civilization unravelling at the end of time, he is at last
forced to become accountable for his actions. He is imprisoned, but escapes to
Shambala. When the dictator attacks this valley, Kalki Avatar descends and a
world-consuming battle between good and evil erupts. The dictator who
orchestrates the destruction is killed and the earth, abused for so long,

blooms anew, the wheel of time turns again, and the brothers reunite.

C) The Science Fiction:

What would the world look like at the end of time? The Srimad Bhagavatam describes it as a cannibalistic society with a wicked world ruler, environmental degradation and oppressive taxation. It addition, I imagined it to be a place where society is divided into three classes: a genetically pure Elite, a larger group called the Functionals who perform many societal tasks and finally, a vast underclass of inherently deformed humans called Rakshshas (Raks.)

D)
The Genre:
The
Yoga Zapper  is ""Little Buddha"" meets ""Lord of the Rings"" with a bit of ""Gulliver’s
Travels"" thrown in for good measure.
It contains a strong environmental theme as well as darkly humorous
social commentary. A complete, full-length novel, it is written in a clear style,
making it available to all readers, including young adults. While Norse and Old
English mythologies are staples of the fantasy genre, ancient Buddhist and
Hindu mythologies are yet to be truly explored.
Based on the authentic narratives
of these traditions, which I studied for many years, The Yoga Zapper  features yogis meditating for thousands of years,
Avatars descending from spiritual realms, ancient flying craft known as vimanas and a world-consuming battle
between good and evil at the end of time.
3)  Why should you support this
campaign:
I will become your best friend!

Be the first on your block to be friends with a GIHVPWHWAB!

most yoga books are about technique, it’s philosophy or sometimes the personal
memoirs of its practitioners, this novel is an important new way to look at the yoga tradition<span style=""color: rgb(106, 106, 106)

more support, the better!


5) Some Important things

- Shipping is free to America and Canada. Contributors from other countries please add $10 US or Euro 7.50 to your order (for actual books only.)
column7:
>- My company ""Blue and Gold Books, LTD."" based in Calgary, Canada, owns all rights to ""The Yoga Zapper - A Novel."" Charges to your account may be in the name of the company.

- At this time, the book will not ship to certain countries in South Asia such as India, Nepal, Sri Lanka, Indonesia, etc. I am hoping to have this rectified at a later date. If you need more information please contact me.

- I love getting comments, suggestions and of course, compliments!! Please use the Contact button to communicate with me!

understand that!!

","1)
About
Me
I
am a Genuine Initiated Hindu Vaishnava Priest (GIHVP.) No, seriously! Not only
that, I have written a book. Yes, seriously! How many people do you know who
are Genuine Initiated Hindu Vaishnava Priests Who Have Written a Book
(GIHVPWHWAB)? I’m betting none!
My
writing: I worked as Editor for a regional newspaper in Colorado for thirteen years,
as Business Page editor (not that it helped my finances!) for a publication in
Canada, and have been published in newspapers and magazines including the
Denver Post and the Himalayan News. I wrote a play that was presented at the Brooks Center Arts Play Showcase Festival, in Denver, Colorado.
I
have organized several conferences on Science and Spirituality, have spoken at
churches, Interfaith meetings and diversity conferences. I also published an
electronic newsletter on Science and Spirituality for several years.
I’m
also a genuine, self-realized yogi (GSRY.) Actually not! I have to admit, that
despite attempts at yoga sadhana (practice,) I still breathe like a horse,
can’t get my joints to bend and can’t sing a note of kirtan!
The
Novel
A)  The
Background:
In
1933 James Hilton, in his novel Lost
Horizon, wrote about the legend
of Shangri-La (a variant of the original Shambala,) a valley
hidden deep in the Himalayas, whose inhabitants lead extremely long lives. The
book was instrumental in introducing the mysticism of the East to Western
readers
column2: yet Hilton had knowledge of only a small part of the entire narrative.

column1: The
story of this hidden place, a
narrative sacred to both Buddhists and Hindus, is in fact well known in
India, China and
other Oriental countries. In my studies as a Hindu Vaishnava
priest, I learnt of
this narrative in a scripture named the Srimad Bhagavatam (also known as the
Bhagavat purana,) which mentions Shambala in connection with a much larger
story: that of the degradation of humanity at the end of time, the appearance
of the tenth Avatar of Vishnu named Kalki and his role in defeating the forces of evil at that time.
The
idea of presenting this engaging story to the everyday reader, especially to
those in the yoga community, immediately came to mind. The key was not just to
recite the ancient legend, but to let it be seen through the eyes of modern
protagonists who would not only have their own engaging stories to tell, but
also act as guides for the western audience.The Story:
The Yoga Zapper is the tale of two young
American brothers, who, thrust into strange worlds, find within themselves the
courage and faith to grow, change and discover their unimagined destinies.
While trekking in the Himalayas,
Steve and Jack encounter a dying priest who thrusts into their hands a Sanskrit
scripture which Jack names the Yoga Zapper.
“You do not understand,” cries
the old man. “Your lives, no, the future of the entire world depends on it!”
Little do the brothers know that
the text is a prescription for time-travel. In the midst of a deep conflict
with each other, they discover its powers. Steve, who has an intellectual
approach to life, is transported to a peaceful village at the beginning of
time. He falls in love with the beautiful Shanti and finally connects with his
heart. In search of his brother, Steve and Shanti join a group of yogis in a
pilgrimage to Shambala. There, they learn how to live in an ethereal state for
thousands of years.
Jack, irresponsible and immature,
finds himself in a society ruled by an evil despot. Sucked into the intrigue
and treachery of a civilization unravelling at the end of time, he is at last
forced to become accountable for his actions. He is imprisoned, but escapes to
Shambala. When the dictator attacks this valley, Kalki Avatar descends and a
world-consuming battle between good and evil erupts. The dictator who
orchestrates the destruction is killed and the earth, abused for so long,

blooms anew, the wheel of time turns again, and the brothers reunite.C) The Science Fiction:What would the world look like at the end of time? The Srimad Bhagavatam describes it as a cannibalistic society with a wicked world ruler, environmental degradation and oppressive taxation. It addition, I imagined it to be a place where society is divided into three classes: a genetically pure Elite, a larger group called the Functionals who perform many societal tasks and finally, a vast underclass of inherently deformed humans called Rakshshas (Raks.)D)

My name is Connie Pheiff and I help people get unstuck.  My life is a modern day Cinderella story.  But instead of getting a Prince, I got an education, a career and the confidence to embrace change and achieve success.  Now, I'm giving back.  My newest project is a book series chock-full of valuable advice and real-life stories geared to educate non-profits how to think out of the box and raise a lot of money for their causes.  The next book in the series ""The Art of the 'Ask'"" … Think Beyond Traditional Fundraising with the Use of Social Networking"" is scheduled to be published in March 2014.  This book is a unique, stylistic look at leveraging social networking in nonprofit organizations.  

Since my passion is helping women overcome challenges and getting them unstuck, a very important part of this book series is to give back ... depending on your contribution level, a portion of the proceeds from your donations to this campaign as well as 100% of the sales from the book series will directly benefit an organization near and dear to my hear, Dress For Success.  The mission of Dress for Success is to promote the economic independence of disadvantaged women by providing professional attire, a network of support and the career development tools to help women thrive in work and in life.  It's a Perfect Fit!

Help me raise $5000 and get this book series published!  No amount is too small.  And, even if you aren't in a position to make a monetary donation, I would really appreciate it if you could help me spread the word by sharing this page with your Facebook fans/friends and Twitter followers.

Short Summary

My name is Geoff Dale, a writer/author/theatre critic based in Woodstock, Ontario, Canada. I've been in the business for close to 40 years, largely in newspapers, magazines, radio and various online sites.

Earlier this year I began research on Shemp Howard largely known to most folks as the Forgotten Stooge. I realized from the onset that he was more than just one of The Three Stooges. A talented comic actor (with some dramatic roles to his credit), he enjoyed a highly successful solo career from about 1930 to the late 1940s. He was part of the original trio in the mid 1920s and rejoined after his younger brother Curly fell ill in 1947.

Sadly he is often recalled with that tag The Forgotten Stooge. I want my biography to put that to rest. With so very information out there, I'm finding the task both compelling and quite exhausting at times. It has taken me to LA to interview one of his granddaughters and to visit the motion pictures library in Beverly Hills.

With the Internet both a source of information and misinformation, there will be more travel, more phone calls and a lot of work outside of the e-world. I look forward to it and to the end result.

I would deeply appreciate your help so I have re-launched my initial campaign. My goal is to complete both the research and hopefully my writing by the spring of 2015. A tad soon - perhaps? But everyone needs a goal and a timeline to work toward and that it is.

The book will provide both an invaluable look at the entertainment world at the turn of the 20th century and a closer view of one of the performers who played an integral role in the transformation of that world from the stages of vaudeville to the burgeoning world of film.
In addition to my regular day-to-day writing (including two commissioned local history books), I recently self-publishing an alternative history on the early life of Larry Fine (yes, another one of those Stooges). The work focused on his boxing and musical skills. It was fun but a lot of work and quite costly (my own funds) and, to my delight, through the hard work of self-promotion, it is selling on both sides of the US-Canada border.
This week I will be interviewing (from Los Angeles) Shemp's daughter-in-law to get a more personal insight into his life and his career. In the coming weeks, between my regular writing duties, I will continue contacting as many libraries and educational/entertainment institutions, along with individuals, that have useful information about him.
For those willing to contribute to my campaign, I will offer my book at a cost reduction of up to 50 per cent and various DVDs focusing on Shemp's work both as a Stooge and solo performer.
There will be challenges along the way ferreting out this seemingly elusive material but as a trained researcher, I will find the information that I hope will make this book an interesting and 'fun' work to read for both Shemp fans and perhaps some new converts to his unique talents.
If you can't contribute in a fiscal manner, then perhaps you can spread the word (online and outside of the e-world) about my project to those who may be interested.
I thank you in advance for your time and consideration.

Haven’t you ever traveled somewhere and only wished you knew some real locals who could give you the lowdown on what life there is really like?

This is a rare chance for you to share in the creation of a local crowd sourced guide by sharing your recommendations, memories, and experiences. 

We want to crowd source a guide from Baltimoreans that is packed with the city's soul, local lore, stories, favorite haunts, and watering holes.  Equal parts tribute and travel guide, this guidebook will be 100% your voices. 

Help us tell the world about all the amazing places in Baltimore. 

What We Need &
column2:
What You Get

In order to make this happen, we need YOU!
column4:
>This guide relies on your cultural knowledge to comprise the book and of course we need the capital to make it happen. We know you want to share your stories and we hope that you will donate your urban insight and chip in a little to get this guide made.

The guidebook will be composed of several sections:

column1: • Dedication page
• Shoutout page
• Favorites page
• And the following sections for user contributed pages: Restaurants, Bars, Arts/Entertainment, Shopping, Nightlife, Hotels and Other.

column3: >Once the campaign is funded, we will reach out with a template for you to fill out. The format is included below
column4: you choose your favorite spot in Charm City and fill in the page with your own taglines, descriptions, stories, highlights and photos. As soon as we are able to compile everyone's submissions and print the book you'll have the guide in your hands!
column6:
/>

We know you want to share your story, help us make this happen!

The Impact

We will be donating a portion of the proceeds to Habitat for Humanity of the Chesapeake. If our campaign does not tip and we are not able to compile the guide, all proceeds will be donated to Habitat for Humanity of the Chesapeake. 

Other Ways to Help

Even if you can’t contribute, please share with your friends and spread the word!

Who on earth are Yes Clacks?

Clackmannanshire (The Wee County) is Scotland's smallest county, but we're no less committed towards delivering a Yes vote.  Everyone loves an underdog!  Yes Clackmannanshire (Yes Clacks) is the official Yes Community group for the area, headquartered in Alloa, but committed to campaigning in all of the towns and villages dotted around the Wee County.  
 
As we arrive at the critical time for the campaign, the final month, we are working flat out towards a Yes.  Every night, we have canvassing teams on the ground in at least one of the towns and villages dotted around the county.  We have leafleting teams out and about, spreading the word, we have street stalls and a presence in any local events that come up, and we organise public meetings to inform and educate.
 
In addition to this, we have our local Yes Hub, located at 1 Coalgate, Alloa, that is staffed by volunteers and is open seven days a week.  We give out merchandise, information, and provide a venue for other community events and meetings, such as Women for Indy.  Essentially, we are keen, organised, and have a well oiled machine, working hard to deliver the result that Scotland needs!  

So why do we need your precious money?

We know money is tight, and we know times are tough, but the battle for Scotland's future is only going to happen once.  We have so many volunteers who have given hours of their time up to leaflet, canvas, staff the shop, write fundraising appeals, organise events, and a million and one little things.  But sadly, all of this campaigning costs.
 
We funded the opening of the Yes Hub ourselves, which not only serves as a shop to cater to the undecided and the curious, but is also the headquarters for our whole organisation.  We keep our merchandise there, arrange leafleting, accommodate meetings and events, and it has been vital to making our campaign as effective as it has been.  But we have to pay for running costs and rent.
 
We are also desperate to plaster the area in Yes advertising.  We want to see the people of Clackmannanshire with YesWindaes, with Yes badges, with wristbands, car stickers, and showing the undecided and the wavering that yes, we have the numbers to win this thing.  We want to be able to afford to give the people of Clackmannanshire all the merchandise they ask for, to give our canvassing teams plenty of things to be able to hand out, because with the referendum so close, its vital to show people that Yes is not only possible, but is natural!
 

Why is Yes Clacks looking to raise funding this close to the referendum?

 This is the final push.  We've got so far by ourselves, and we just want a little bit of help to get over the line in style.  We've really appreciated all the help that everyone has given our campaign so far in terms of time and ad hoc donations, so we hope that we can have one quick fundraiser just to let us focus on spreading the word.  The Wee County doesn't always get its share of attention from the nation, so every little bit of help is absolutely vital!
 

What will we use your money for?

 
As we've said, we will be able to keep our shop open, pay campaigning expenses, be able to give away much more merchandise, pay for the cost of additional leaflets and canvassing expenses, and it will let us cover the unglamorous and unsexy costs that get in the way of delivering our message.  It gives us a clear run to the finish line.

What's in it for you?

We will thank every funder personally through twitter or Facebook for their help, and we hope that having the chance to say ""I was there, I did my bit when it was needed"" to your children, when they ask you about the story of when Scotland became a nation, will provide you a warm glow of satisfaction.  We hope you appreciate that it is difficult to offer rewards and perks, when we want to use our funding to spread the word to everyone, but for extra special funders, we have prepared some extra special perks that you simply won't find anywhere else...
 

What else can you do to help us?

Of course, it isn't all about money and funding, we always welcome helpers on the ground.  Our Yes Hub in Alloa is open every day, and every single day, somewhere in Clackmannanshire, we have teams on the ground, working towards a Yes vote in towns like Alva, Sauchie, Dollar, Tullibody, and Menstrie.  We always have something for people to do, so why not join us if you live in the area?  Sign up at:
http://www.yesclacks.net
 
 or join our Facebook page:
 https://www.facebook.com/YesClackmannanshireAndDunblane

We hope you can share our appeal amongst your friends and family, spread the word, so that we too can spread the word.  Thank you everyone!

We will thank every funder personally through twitter or Facebook for their help, and we hope that having the chance to say ""I was there, I did my bit when it was needed"" to your children, when they ask you about the story of when Scotland became a nation, will provide you a warm glow of satisfaction.  We hope you appreciate that it is difficult to offer rewards and perks, when we want to use our funding to spread the word to everyone, but for extra special funders, we have prepared some extra special perks that you simply won't find anywhere else... What else can you do to help us?

Of course, it isn't all about money and funding, we always welcome helpers on the ground.  Our Yes Hub in Alloa is open every day, and every single day, somewhere in Clackmannanshire, we have teams on the ground, working towards a Yes vote in towns like Alva, Sauchie, Dollar, Tullibody, and Menstrie.  We always have something for people to do, so why not join us if you live in the area?  Sign up at:http://www.yesclacks.net  or join our Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/YesClackmannanshireAndDunblaneWe hope you can share our appeal amongst your friends and family, spread the word, so that we too can spread the word.  Thank you everyone!",0.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","Alloa, United Kingdom",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/yes-clacks/pica
0,"<div class=""routerContentStory-storyBody"" data-v-1df7bf5a=""""><span class=""notranlsate""><div>
The Last Hurrah

You'd be amazed at how many World War 2 veterans are still with us, and still spry in their early nineties. Don Knapp, a veteran of the 712th Tank Battalion who you may have seen on ""Patton 360,"" recently scored a hole-in-one on his 94th birthday. You'd also be amazed at how many of their stories still haven't been preserved. I've been interviewing World War 2 veterans for 25 years. I still have many to interview, and could use some help before it's too late.

I first attended a reunion of the 712th in 1987 looking for veterans who remembered my dad, who died of a heart attack seven years earlier. I found three, and all the stories he told when I was young came back to life. At the same time, I realized that the stories I heard in the hospitality room, the hotel lobby, the parking lot, were an important part of history that needed to be preserved. Since then I've recorded 600 hours of interviews, written six books, launched a popular web site, and produced a series of oral history audiobooks. In 2008 I became a part of history myself, joining more than 600,000 Americans who were laid off from their jobs that month in the early stages of the Great Recession.

I defied the odds and found a job after two years and five months, but now I've voluntarily cut back to part time work so I can continue my passion for oral history. Your donation, however small, will not only help record and preserve the stories of more members of the fading Greatest Generation, but will assist in putting those stories in front of the public as I exhibit at air shows and other military and history-related events.
The stories of our fathers and grandfathers (and great-grandfathers)

""These are the stories of our fathers and grandfathers."" A reviewer wrote that at Amazon for my first book. ""These guys are a hoot!"" This was the reaction of a listener who left eBay feedback for one of my audiobooks.
What I need is: a) office space b) travel expenses c) blank CDs
So please check out my perks. I think you'll find them attractive, while at the same time helping to preserve a small but important piece of American history.
<div>
Reality

The veterans I've interviewed, the stories they've told, these are real people and real events. I once posted a story on my web site that was sent to me by a woman who helped her father-in-law write down his experiences. I then received an e-mail from a person in Tennessee who was named after an officer mentioned in the story. This officer was going from foxhole to foxhole checking on his men. The woman's father-in-law said he was cold. The officer removed his trenchcoat and gave it to the two men to keep them warm. The officer was later killed. I thought what an amazing thing it must be to learn that you were named after so compassionate a person. This is just one of many stories that have been generated by my work.
<div>
No Retweet, No Surrender

There are many ways to help without donating money. You can share my campaign with your Facebook friends or tweet about the campaign. Every push of a button increases the campaign's visibility and just could be the spark that puts it over the top. You can also help by suggesting veterans for me to interview as time and travel permit. And you can help by joining the campaign's ""team"" and increasing its visibility in a heavily crowded crowdfunding field.

Thanks for visiting my campaign page, towards funding my soon to be released novel ""Midas: The Scrolls"".

MIDAS: THE SCROLLS  is book#1 of a 6 book sci- fi/suspense/drama series. ""The Scrolls"" pulls you right into Cyrus Baker emotional core, leading up to his transformation as Midas, the most powerful man on Earth.

REASON FOR FUNDS: I put some of my savings into this book so far for completion. With a bit more funds needed to finish the publishing process on the cover 's graphics and other details, I recently decided to go out on the limb and try raising those funds here.

Écrivains, musiciens, slameurs, conteurs, chanteurs, humoristes, comédiens… Pour une quatrième année consécutive, nous vous convions au Camp artistique de l’Estrie, un événement estival ayant pour but de regrouper et de faire connaître les artistes de la relève et professionnels de l’Estrie.

Cette année, le camp se déroulera les 25, 26 et 27 juillet à l’Auberge de jeunesse de la Grande Ligne à Racine (318, Chemin De La Grande Ligne, Racine,
column4:
s=1"" rel=""noopener nofollow"">http://www.aubergegrandeligne.ca/). 

Plusieurs activités sont au menu : un micro ouvert, une édition spéciale des Cabarets Well-King, des ateliers d’écriture et de performances, des activités de réseautage entre artistes et d’autres surprises. 

Notes: 

- Ce socio-financement ne sert qu'à compiler vos réservations pour l'Auberge et s'assurer du nombre de personnes nécessaires à la tenue de l'événement.
column8:
> Le spectacle sera payable sur place. (10$)

Ça vous intéresse? Voici l'horaire préliminaire.
L'horaire plus détaillé est à venir.

Vendredi le 25 juillet 
Écriture libre pendant la journée
Micro-ouvert autour du feu, animé par Alexandre Demers

Samedi le 26 juillet
10h - Accueil et Brunch réseautage entre artistes
13h à 16h - Ateliers
17h - Souper potluck
18h à 19h - Atelier
20h30 - Cabaret Well-King (édition estivale), 8 artistes invités (10$)

Dimanche 27 juillet
column11:
>
12h - Dîner snack bar
13h à 16h - Ateliers
column14:
>Fin du camp à 17h

Veuillez noter qu’il n’est pas nécessaire de participer à toutes les activités. Vous pouvez venir le nombre de journées qu’il vous plaît. La journée comptant le plus d’activités est le samedi 26 juillet.

Nous encourageons tous ceux qui désirent participer à payer d’avance par Internet au Centre de diffusion ArtFocus ou directement à l’un des membres du comité organisateur : Jean-François Vachon, Catherine Migneault, Alexandre Demers, Memmy Roger et Gabriel Gemme. 

Pour que l’événement soit assuré d’avoir lieu, nous devons minimalement récolter 20 inscriptions d’avance. 

Cet événement est entièrement organisé par des bénévoles qui ont à cœur la diffusion et le réseautage des artistes de la relève et professionnels de l’Estrie. Il bénéficie de l’appui des partenaires suivants : La Cuvée artistique de l’Estrie, Le Centre de diffusion ArtFocus, Les Cabarets Well-King, Les Écritures du Dimanche, de l’organisme En Verve (Slam du Tremplin).

Venez en grand nombre! Pour encore embellir et renforcer la solidarité culturelle qui caractérise de plus en plus notre région.

Le comité organisateur
Myriam Benoît, Alexandre Demers, Gabriel Gemme, Catherine Migneault et Jean-François Vachon

Pour nous rejoindre: 
catherinedambre@gmail.com
819-346-0615

Événement Facebook:
https://www.facebook.com/events/1419855891635189/?fref=ts

column1:
Écritures du dimanche
Louis B.Daignault, technicien de son
Crédit Photos : Anthony Lacroix

Good Day,My name is Edward Zawadzki and I'm an author and broadcaster based ot of Toronto,Canada. I have written several very successful books and enjoy it very much. I'm also of Polish heritage and am very proud of the fact. My next writing project is called ""Poles in the New World""""The Next Generation"". Two Years ago I published ""Poles in the New World"" and it has done quite well but I need a little financial help to get this project done. the book will celebrate the lives of 50 successful young Polish Americans from all walks of life and their great contributions to our society. please you can google my name  and the books name and get literally hundreds of results. I am a very honest person who wants to help educate young Polish Americans and Canadians on their rich history and heritage. The book is close to completion and the first 1000 copies will be available on May 15th of 2013. It will be a very professional product,well researched,written and designed. please feel free to contact me at ezbroadcaster@yahoo.com and go to my website at www.polesworld.com    The money raised from here is going strictly for printing costs. the rest marketing,writing,editing has already been covered by myself,. I hope that you plan on getting involved.
Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:
<ul>
• Introduce yourself and your background.
• Briefly describe your campaign and why it’s important to you.
• Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.
Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?
<div>
<h3>What We Need &amp
Break it down for folks in more detail:
<ul>
• Explain how much funding you need and where it’s going. Be transparent and specific—people need to trust you to want to fund you.
• Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
• Describe where the funds go if you don’t reach your entire goal.
<div>
The Impact
Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:
<ul>
• Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
• Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
• Make it real for people and build trust.
<div>
Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:
<ul>
• Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
• Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.

Summary...
Hi, we're Jemmell'z Washington &
column2: Jess McPherson. We've recently produced our first children's ebook,  Enzi and the Broken Bandage, for families with preschoolers ages 3-7 years old.

column1: Enzi --whose name means “power” in Swahili--enables parents, grandparents and teachers to share the joy of reading while enhancing their future global citizens' libraries. Inspired by countless service projects uniting and benefiting friends and neighbors of diverse perspectives, I decided to create the character of a little boy named Enzi. He’s a nod to my socially responsible feature stories for The Philadelphia Tribune, the nation’s oldest African-American newspaper.

Award-winning fine artist and former YorkArts gallery director Jess McPherson's charcoal interpretation of Enzi pays homage to our combined Diaspora, tribal Creek, Irish, French, Pennsylvania Dutch and American Indian ancestry, while mirroring children’s’ realities on the school bus, at the playground, in the doctor’s office, and perhaps even at home.
Our shared interest in building a stronger community through the arts is also what compels us to get Enzi and the Broken Bandage into print and e-book formats. Watch the video to see us in action!
What We Need…
Our goal of $17,500 covers:
• $2500: initial print run of 500 copies of Enzi and the Broken Bandage (soft cover)
• $7500: graphic design services for bookmarks and other promotional items, plus illustrator services for Enzi and the Broken Bandage and Enzi book #2
• $1000: travel/food expenses for Jemmell’z &
column2: Jess to co-present 4 free workshops (up to 15 children per workshop) within a day’s drive of Philadelphia

column1: • $1400: vendor/exhibitor fees, plus travel expenses for 1-2 family-and educator-friendly conferences, conventions or festivals with at least 5,000+ attendees (as projected by organizers) within a day’s drive of Philadelphia. Any surplus in this category will be invested in advertising channels.
• $2500: secondary print run 250-300 copies of Enzi and the Broken Bandage, or initial print run of 250-500 copies of Enzi book #2**
• $2600: percentage due to Indiegogo in support of their role in making our venture a reality
Perks that will help create tender memories of time spent with the special people in your life:
• Pass travel time by drawing together in the activity pages of an advance copy of Enzi and the Broken Bandage!
• Bake &
column2: savor my great-great-grandmother’s recipe for Wet Coconut Cake!

column1: • Frame an autographed illustration from Enzi and the Broken Bandage as a birthday or shower gift! Or double-laminate it for a personal placemat at the dinner table!
• Rejuvenate your family’s bedtime routine with a personal storytime phone call!
&

Plus, you can take added pleasure in supporting the revival of the U.S. economy with your contribution. We’re proud to award our business to a printer whose facilities are located in the contiguous 48 states.
The Impact

You're enabling more children and families to enjoy Enzi, and encouraging them to discover more about the world we all share, and how their talents and interests impact us all. The discussion questions in Enzi and the Broken Bandage nurture a curiosity about other languages and geography while speaking to the intrinsic values of helping others and seeking help ourselves.
While this is our first children’s book, it isn’t Jess’ or my first time working with children:
<ul>

• I’ve created and led such workshops as “Writing from the Sole” and “Postcards from Space” for Spells Writing Lab, the Philadelphia children’s creative writing program based on the acclaimed 826 Valencia model.
<ul>
<li>Jess is a Culture Class Arts Instructor &amp
column2: Community Mentor at Native American Lifelines of Baltimore. She’s also teaching grass, leather and roundbraided cable cordage workshops in conjunction with her featured works in lowercase gallery’s “Apocalypse Island” exhibition. (closes 8/18/12)

column1: Other Ways You Can Help
• Pin us on your shower/birthday gift registry or back-to-school Pinterest boards!
• Like our YouTube video!
• Post us on your Facebook &
• Text, tweet &
column2: talk us up to aunts, uncles, godparents, last year’s teachers, this year’s teachers, your PTO board members, and your faith-based school leaders!

column1: • Add our campaign link to your email signature!
• Post your comments &

And that’s all there is to it!

The discussion questions in Enzi and the Broken Bandage nurture a curiosity about other languages and geography while speaking to the intrinsic values of helping others and seeking help ourselves.
While this is our first children’s book, it isn’t Jess’ or my first time working with children:

I’ve created and led such workshops as “Writing from the Sole” and “Postcards from Space” for Spells Writing Lab, the Philadelphia children’s creative writing program based on the acclaimed 826 Valencia model.

Jess is a Culture Class Arts Instructor & Community Mentor at Native American Lifelines of Baltimore. She’s also teaching grass, leather and roundbraided cable cordage workshops in conjunction with her featured works in lowercase gallery’s “Apocalypse Island” exhibition. (closes 8/18/12)
Other Ways You Can Help
• Pin us on your shower/birthday gift registry or back-to-school Pinterest boards!
• Like our YouTube video!
• Post us on your Facebook & LinkedIn!
• Text, tweet & talk us up to aunts, uncles, godparents, last year’s teachers, this year’s teachers, your PTO board members, and your faith-based school leaders!
• Add our campaign link to your email signature!
• Post your comments & watch for updates from us!
And that’s all there is to it!",0.0,0,"1 Campaign

About me

My name is Crystal Carter and I am a journalist residing in the Bay Area.  I graduated with a Bachelor’s of Arts degree in Journalism from San Francisco State University in 2008.  Since then I have interned at Colorlines.com, the North County Times and New America Media.  Before I graduated my work was featured on the front page of the Oakland Tribune, which highlighted a protest that took place around the Jena 6.  I found myself covering a lot of protests focusing on public affairs. I like protests because they project human emotion at its highest state in an organized fashion.  Since then I have been very interested in politics and social justice issues.  I was also awarded a fellowship from The Center for Crime, Media and Justice where I wrote an investigative report on California’s Three Strikes Law.  I am currently a Media Relations Fellow at The Commonwealth Club.
How it all started...

I began Pops Campaign in 2008 during the presidential campaign for Barack Obama. I was definitely inspired by the way that people my age were the deciding factor in Obama becoming president.  I knew that Obama was going to need a lot of input and I felt that the millennial generation’s voice was very important.  Pops Campaign began as a blog in the form of a letter to the president.  After a lot of motivation and encouragement from friends and family I have decided to make Pops Campaign a full-fledged magazine.  It amplifies the voices of young professionals my age who are doing great things in their community.  In respect to the blog there will be a section called Letters to the President where Pops Campaign readers will get to voice their concerns to the president in an attempt to interact with the president and the white house to let them know about our concerns.
Where the funding goes

The people that contribute to this campaign will help Pops Campaign compensate its very talented writers, producers and photographers.  It will also help make Pops Campaign a print magazine that can be distributed to an international audience.  The magazine will be a beautiful showcase of the millennial generation’s talent through art, music, and political and cultural commentary.  Contributors will also help fund a documentary called “Superfund City” that survey’s Bayview Hunter’s Point District’s plight of environmental racism.
More about Pops Campaign
Pops Campaign News Magazine is a platform for the millennial generation to tell our story and voice our concerns about current affairs and popular trends.

Pops Campaign produces “news with a cause.” Our work focuses on the wholesome development of the civicly engaged citizen. We do this with in-depth reporting and critical analysis on society's most pertinent issues including: education, social justice, public affairs and urban policy. Each and every story that we publish has a strong campaign behind it, whether its getting on the bus to protest in front of the state capital or organizing to provide a place to strategize, educate and inform.

Our plan is to merge technology with new media to take full advantage of the social media landscape that has provided journalists with a new avenue of inclusive, participant-oriented communication.

We are the host of progressive art gatherings and social justice conferences and a platform for all types of artists and social justice advocates. We are objective when we write but subjective in what we choose to write about. We write for the people and the betterment of our society and global communities. 

Pops Campaign is a proud collaborative of journalism and activism.

column2: >Pops Campaign is the Revolutionary News Magazine on Pop Culture Phenomena and Politics.  It amplifies the voices of the millennial generation (people ages 18-30) because I feel that those voices do not get heard enough.  We were the deciding factor in electing the first black president and I would like to keep that momentum going by finding out the issues that my generation wants addressed.  We will focus on entrepreneurship, civic engagement and how this digital era is affecting our generation.

column1: The magazine deals with politics and also includes articles regarding fashion and music.  The edge that it has on all of the other magazines is that is entirely run by the Millennial generation and it will have a section called Letters to the President that will voice our concerns.  There will also be a comic book included that will bring light to social issues that are not addressed.  It will also highlight non-profits and individuals that are doing good work in their communities.

Hello!
Oscar Wilde once said: ""My advice to aspiring writers? Marry money.""
As practical and funny as this advice may be, I'm sure many of you know what it's like to try and find a long-term artistic project and live as an artist in New York City.

As you may already be aware, I have been working on a book proposal and manuscript for a work of creative non-fiction, largely centered around my experience as a person with an ""invisible disability.""
I was born with mild cerebral palsy which mainly affects my gait and balance. I have had multiple corrective surgeries in my life and have developed a consistent yoga practice.
Moving to NYC has been one of the great formative decisions of my life. I ride the NYC subway every day and navigate around without injury, largely invisible as a disabled person.

My project will also focus on my experience as a member of the LGBT community as a feminine-presenting individual. Stereotypes are a reality and so I am largely ""invisible"" as a member of this community as well.

We all have rich, multi-faceted stories that are not always visible at first glance. My goal is to compile an edited book proposal by Winter 2012. I believe that this work has the power to be greatly inspirational both as a tool for raising awareness to these issues, and helping all of us feel a little less alone.
Thank you so much for any and all support.

0,"<div class=""routerContentStory-storyBody"" data-v-1df7bf5a=""""><div>
A Summary

My name is Jennifer Derilo. I’m a writer who has been given a second opportunity to participate in the Voices of Our Nations Art (VONA) workshop, held on the UC Berkeley campus (June 24 to June 30), to work on a piece of memoir that I’ve struggled to write for almost a year now—ironically, since my first (last) attendance at VONA in June 2011.

The total cost of the workshop is $800, and I anticipate public transportation to be $100. Fortunately, I have friends in the Bay to help with housing, and I had a travel voucher from Southwest to cover airfare. At this point, I hope to offset any part of the trip.
<div>
About VONA

Founded in 1999 by Elmaz Abinader, Junot Díaz, Victor Diaz and Diem Jones, it is “only multi-genre workshop for writers of color in the nation,” providing support, community, and guidance to its participants by way of craft-focused classes taught by esteemed faculty. It is competitive to get in, and the workshops are small. (Mine has 11 participants.) But once a writer is accepted, the VONA environment is anything but competitive—it’s intensively supportive and heart-wrenchingly inspiring.
About the Writing Project

In 2008, during my second year at the MFA program at Mills College, I began writing about my paternal grandfather, who was a survivor of the Bataan Death March, which took place in the Philippines during WWII. However, my advisor thought that the story was too big for me at the time.

Fast forward to April 2010. I experienced 21 days of low-grade fevers and night sweats. Months prior, I lost a lot of weight, my appetite, and energy. The lymph nodes in my neck and clavicle area were so enlarged.

At the end of April, I was officially diagnosed with Stage 2b Hodgkin’s lymphoma, and my grandfather’s ghost slipped back into my life. The start of the Bataan Death March was April 9, 1942. I started to see convergences. How could I map our traumas? How did he survive? How could I tap into that strength?
I started writing about him again. I tried writing about my experience with cancer, even though I kept very few written records. Really, I had to write about us.

This is an experimental creative nonfiction project tentatively titled, ""and to calm the waves of mismapping"". The project attempts to address living with and writing about historical and personal traumas, which accounts for its experimental structure, form, and content. The selection is non-traditional, making links among poetry, photos, imagined episodes, shifting points of view, and family stories.
Why this Matters
I haven't written seriously since 2008 when I finished my Master's thesis. I certainly didn't write seriously when I became sick in 2009 and was diagnosed in 2010.
I was afraid.
This is the first real writing project that I’ve undertaken since getting sick and finishing treatments in January 2011.
I'm no longer afraid but excited. I want to share and finish this story at VONA. I want to make my second chance there count.
You Get Stuff, Too!
<div>
In exchange for your support, I will give you an artifact from this project: never-before-seen pieces! (I'm actually a very shy writer. :)
You can choose from the following ""perks"":
<ul>
<li>
Portacath Soundtrath, a mix CD--with original art made by my sister--that was played during my entire portacath placement operation. A poem from this writing project is also included.
<ul>
• Two poems + four epigraphs from this writing project housed in an empty pill bottle from my ol’ chemo days. (Note: Only 10 are available.)
<ul>
• A copy of the letter I wrote to my grandfather, which started this project.
<ul>
• A random excerpt from this experimental memoir.
<div>
A Fun Fact about Indiegogo
Even if I don't meet my goal, I get to keep what I raise, and you still get your perks! That sounds like a win-win situation.
If you're unable to contribute at this time, you can also help by sharing this campaign with anyone you think might be interested.
Thank you so much for reading.
