column3: >The Story: We are raising funds for Brenda to visit Ethiopia this spring. Brenda intends on spending up to 30 days as a volunteer law professor and researcher in Ethiopia. For background, last spring Brenda and Matt lived and taught law in rural Ethiopia among large birds, insects, feral cats and dogs, hyenas, and camels. Among many things Brenda learned, she discovered one of her passions is being an educator. Now she would like to return in a volunteer capacity, following up on teaching and research/writing. Her work is intended to help strengthen the culture of reading and writing in Ethiopia. (More detail below.)

column1: <div>
<div style=""border-color: initial !important

column4: What You Get: All of the funds will go directly to travel costs, volunteer work, and research for up to one month in Ethiopia. Any excess money will assist with living expenses during the time Brenda takes off work to write her paper.

column1: The rough budget:
<ul>
<li>Round-trip travel &amp
• Accommodation (while in transit) $100
• Food (cooking, not eating out) $80
• Health Insurance (through IMG) $65
• Immunizations/anti-malaria medication $75
• Visa $70
• Travel supplies and incidentals $150
• Subtotaled travel expenses = $2,090
• Estimated cost of creating the perks $200
• IndieGoGo's 4% fee $91.60
• Third party 3% payment processing fee $68.70
<li>
Subtotaled costs of the campaign $360.30
• Total = $2,450
We plan to use our airline miles and pre-booked tickets however possible.
By contributing, you will receive some neat perks! Brenda will send you a postcard of one of her Ethiopia photos and/or with some spices and special salt.

column3: >The Impact: This travel, teaching, learning, research, and essay will not only impact Brenda on a professional and personal level, but it will also help at least 69 students and 5 faculty members. The impact will likely reach beyond those numbers because Brenda hopes to work with additional students (such as the first year legal research methods class) and with other faculty and staff. The students will benefit from continuity and further expertise. The faculty will gain additional writing and leadership skills.

column1: Brenda hopes to pursue a teaching and research career in higher education, so this project will help her realize that goal. (Both Brenda and Matthew have been searching for employment since Nov. 2011, and Brenda started consulting in late Feb. 2012. They are currently unable to fund this trip on their own accord, although they will contribute to this campaign from their own funds.)

column3: >Other Ways You Can Help: Please share this campaign with friends, colleagues, anybody interested in education, research, writing, Ethiopia, and/or Africa. Also, we would appreciate receiving any feedback, information or tips on this campaign and/or useful resources.

column1: MORE INFO: The volunteer work is proposed to center on Brenda teaching her first year legal research students who are now in their second year of law school. She will help them with further research and polish the papers they wrote for her course last year. Brenda's desire to volunteer stems from observations that the university's resources are limited. Also, she's received requests from students to return. Local teaching staff receive a small salary, and often must take second jobs. Ex-pat staff have recently tended to teach on a short-term basis. So, it is challenging for the College of Law to recruit and retain qualified teachers. The students, consequently, have a revolving door of instructors who may or may not be invested in the students' education.

Brenda hopes to also train the local editors of the nascent Haramaya Law Review, which she helped get off the ground last year. The culture of publication within the Ethiopian academic community is slowly growing. The current Editor of the HLR, Brooke Glass-O'Shea, has asked Brenda to train the local editors on topics such as clear academic writing. This will hopefully assist the local editors in taking over and ownership of the HLR.

Brenda's other purpose is to conduct independent research. The goal is to examine legal education and produce an introspective paper. She intends on comparing her experiences. She will ask and write about questions like: How do the students interact with me? How do I engage them and teach differently? What is the change in my perception of Ethiopian culture and education? Brenda hopes to make the essay personal and creative, appealing to a general audience. The paper will be available online at no cost once she has finished it. We are currently looking for publishers.
Thank you and cheers!
Brenda (""B.""), Matthew, and Brooke

","The Story: We are raising funds for Brenda to visit Ethiopia this spring. Brenda intends on spending up to 30 days as a volunteer law professor and researcher in Ethiopia. For background, last spring Brenda and Matt lived and taught law in rural Ethiopia among large birds, insects, feral cats and dogs, hyenas, and camels. Among many things Brenda learned, she discovered one of her passions is being an educator. Now she would like to return in a volunteer capacity, following up on teaching and research/writing. Her work is intended to help strengthen the culture of reading and writing in Ethiopia. (More detail below.)

The Need & What You Get: All of the funds will go directly to travel costs, volunteer work, and research for up to one month in Ethiopia. Any excess money will assist with living expenses during the time Brenda takes off work to write her paper.
The rough budget:
Round-trip travel & transportation $1,550
Accommodation (while in transit) $100
Food (cooking, not eating out) $80
Health Insurance (through IMG) $65
Immunizations/anti-malaria medication $75
Visa $70
Travel supplies and incidentals $150
Subtotaled travel expenses = $2,090
Estimated cost of creating the perks $200
IndieGoGo's 4% fee $91.60
Third party 3% payment processing fee $68.70
Subtotaled costs of the campaign $360.30
Total = $2,450
We plan to use our airline miles and pre-booked tickets however possible.
By contributing, you will receive some neat perks! Brenda will send you a postcard of one of her Ethiopia photos and/or with some spices and special salt.

The Impact: This travel, teaching, learning, research, and essay will not only impact Brenda on a professional and personal level, but it will also help at least 69 students and 5 faculty members. The impact will likely reach beyond those numbers because Brenda hopes to work with additional students (such as the first year legal research methods class) and with other faculty and staff. The students will benefit from continuity and further expertise. The faculty will gain additional writing and leadership skills.

Brenda hopes to pursue a teaching and research career in higher education, so this project will help her realize that goal. (Both Brenda and Matthew have been searching for employment since Nov. 2011, and Brenda started consulting in late Feb. 2012. They are currently unable to fund this trip on their own accord, although they will contribute to this campaign from their own funds.)

Other Ways You Can Help: Please share this campaign with friends, colleagues, anybody interested in education, research, writing, Ethiopia, and/or Africa. Also, we would appreciate receiving any feedback, information or tips on this campaign and/or useful resources.

MORE INFO: The volunteer work is proposed to center on Brenda teaching her first year legal research students who are now in their second year of law school. She will help them with further research and polish the papers they wrote for her course last year. Brenda's desire to volunteer stems from observations that the university's resources are limited. Also, she's received requests from students to return. Local teaching staff receive a small salary, and often must take second jobs. Ex-pat staff have recently tended to teach on a short-term basis. So, it is challenging for the College of Law to recruit and retain qualified teachers. The students, consequently, have a revolving door of instructors who may or may not be invested in the students' education.

Brenda hopes to also train the local editors of the nascent Haramaya Law Review, which she helped get off the ground last year. The culture of publication within the Ethiopian academic community is slowly growing. The current Editor of the HLR, Brooke Glass-O'Shea, has asked Brenda to train the local editors on topics such as clear academic writing. This will hopefully assist the local editors in taking over and ownership of the HLR.

Brenda's other purpose is to conduct independent research. The goal is to examine legal education and produce an introspective paper. She intends on comparing her experiences. She will ask and write about questions like: How do the students interact with me? How do I engage them and teach differently? What is the change in my perception of Ethiopian culture and education? Brenda hopes to make the essay personal and creative, appealing to a general audience. The paper will be available online at no cost once she has finished it. We are currently looking for publishers.
Thank you and cheers!

0,"<div class=""routerContentStory-storyBody"" data-v-1df7bf5a=""""><div>
Short Summary

I have landed a coveted contributor’s spot in this summer's Bread Loaf Writers’ Conference, located in Ripton, Vermont. This year’s conference is from August 15 through August 25. The opportunity allows me to study with celebrated authors and the chance to speak with agents, editors, and publishers.  I now must find a way to fund my tuition, room, and board, which is $2,725. Of course, this is not including travel. I have some money, but not all. Any amount--small or large--will help! I would have the needed amount if 250 people gave $10 each.

I am a recent graduate of the creative writing program at the University of Nebraska-Lincoln. For my dissertation, I completed a novel which many established writers believe is promising. I also hold an MFA from Southampton College.
I lecture in the English Program and the Women’s Studies Program at the University of Wisconsin-Platteville.  I have published some short fiction and poetry in small journals.
Bread Loaf is a wonderful opportunity for me! I believe that it will enhance my education as a writer and as a teacher of writing.
<div>
<h3>What We Need &amp

Tuition for Bread Loaf this year is $1,790. The room and board is $935. I have some money, but I need more for the conference cost and travel (about $400 for travel). The total overall cost is $3,125.
If I don't reach my goal, I will still use the money to go to Bread Loaf. I will beg everyone I know, and everyone I don't know (hence, this campaign), in order to go. I will get to Bread Loaf!
<div>
The Impact

As a student in Nebraska and in Southampton, NY, I have had my share of workshops, but I excel in workshops. My work in classes have turned into polished, published pieces. My attendance in a master class at the Nebraska Summer Writers’ Conference in 2011 has helped me produce a novel draft that impressed not only the other attendees, but the workshop teacher who encouraged me to apply to Bread Loaf!
I really believe that I will come out of Bread Loaf with the means to revise my novel into a publishable manuscript.
<div>
Other Ways You Can Help
• Please share this campaign on Twitter, Facebook, Tumblr, or anywhere you can! Tell others!
• Feel free to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Bread Loaf is a wonderful opportunity for me! I believe that it will enhance my education as a writer and as a teacher of writing.
What We Need & What You Get

Tuition for Bread Loaf this year is $1,790. The room and board is $935. I have some money, but I need more for the conference cost and travel (about $400 for travel). The total overall cost is $3,125.
If I don't reach my goal, I will still use the money to go to Bread Loaf. I will beg everyone I know, and everyone I don't know (hence, this campaign), in order to go. I will get to Bread Loaf!
The Impact

As a student in Nebraska and in Southampton, NY, I have had my share of workshops, but I excel in workshops. My work in classes have turned into polished, published pieces. My attendance in a master class at the Nebraska Summer Writers’ Conference in 2011 has helped me produce a novel draft that impressed not only the other attendees, but the workshop teacher who encouraged me to apply to Bread Loaf!
I really believe that I will come out of Bread Loaf with the means to revise my novel into a publishable manuscript.
Other Ways You Can Help
Please share this campaign on Twitter, Facebook, Tumblr, or anywhere you can! Tell others!
Feel free to use the Indiegogo share tools!",0.0,0,"1 Campaign

I’ve written two books that I want to get into your hands
This project will fund the first two books in The 52 Series, a collection of six books that helps you understand, grow, and practice the Christian faith. The first two books are
52 Ways to Grow Your Faith      52 Reasons to Believe
<div>

""If faith is supposed to be exciting and life changing . . .
. . . why does mine feel dull and insignificant?"" Many ask that question, but few get an answer. The 52 Series responds in a bold, practical, and strategic way. Since God loves us and is for us, faith can be a fun adventure, one we’re free to enjoy, not one requiring us to perform. This series interacts with common questions, offers next steps, and simplifies complex ideas.
<div>

Who are these books for?
Many want a rich, active faith, but feel ill-equipped to achieve that goal. The 52 Series is the perfect resource for new Christians, spiritual seekers, or seasoned believers. Whether you’re taking your first steps, gaining a big-picture overview of Christianity,  or looking to refresh your faith, this series will help. They’re great books to read on your own, but they're even better when read and discussed in a group.

About 52 Ways to Grow Your Faith (Connect With God in a Busy, Noisy World)
52 Ways to Grow Your Faith will liberate you from thinking the only way to grow spiritually requires reading and praying. Instead, learn to grow spiritually while walking, driving, or working out. 52 Ways to Grow Your Faith will jump-start a stalled faith, provide a road map for a new faith, and energize an active faith. Use this resource with friends in a weekly study group or on your own--but get ready to try new ways to grow your faith.

About 52 Reasons to Believe (Concise thoughts on the Christian faith)
52 Reasons to Believe is a devotional theology book, offering biblical teaching on foundational truths of the Christian faith. Not only will you learn what the Bible says about itself and God, but you’ll discover how they relate to contemporary life. Learn on your own or with a group, but expect to develop a stronger faith with 52 Reasons to Believe.

Why self publish?
As the changing economy forces the publishing industry to morph, first-time authors face a growing challenge. If you’re not already well-known (i.e., have a significant ‘platform’), publishers are less likely to invest in you. It’s more economically feasible for them to publish a known commodity than the little guy. Well this little guy refuses to give up. That’s where you come in.

How are you using the money?
All funds will pay for professional editing, proofreading, layout, design, and printing for
column2: >both books. Any money raised over the goal amount will be seed money to publish books 3 &
column3: 4 in the series and fund some marketing.

column1:
Anything else we should know?
I believe in these books! I love the series and am excited to present the first two books, but I need your help. I can write the books, and I’ve got people ready to edit, design, and print the books. But none of this happens without your financial support and your willingness to spread the word about this project. You’re free to support at any dollar amount, but don’t miss the fun incentives for specific dollar amounts.
Want to see some SAMPLES?

column3: >Ciick HERE to sample 52 Reasons to Believe. Wondering if there are questions for small group leaders? Yes! In fact, Click HERE to see ideas on how to use as curriculum or for a class.

<ul>
<li>
52 Reasons to Question Your Faith (Questions that Need Answers)
• 52 Bible Verses That’ll Change Your Life (If You Only Remember ONE Verse, Remember This One...)
• 52 MORE Ways to Grow Your Faith (MORE Practical Ideas to Connect with God in a Busy, Noisy World)
• 52 Big Ideas That’ll Change Your Life (If You Only Remember ONE Thing, Remember This...)

The Project

My name is Isabel Lederman and I am a recent graduate from the University of California Santa Cruz. My studies of creative writing have lead me to my passion of bookarts and self-publishing.I received my B.A in creative writing with a concentration in poetry. I also graduated with Univeristy Honors and Department Honors. In order to graduate with my major I had to create a handmade book with my own poetry as my final thesis project. My passion is bookarts and typography.A year ago I was accepted to study at Trinity College in Dublin through an exchange program. While abroad my poetry was published in Icarus and Wordlegs.

Although I had been living in Santa Cruz before my departure to study at Trinity College in Dublin, Ireland, I was born and grew up in Los Angeles, California. Coming from a post-pedestrian culture, where the means of transportation is the automobile, arriving in Dublin became a sensation of a freedom I had never before experienced. I experienced what it felt like to enter newness, and my mind began to break down my new surroundings into plans, determined excursions of how to traverse the city streets. At first I paid no attention to my surroundings, for I was more invested in how to get from place to place. Eventually moving through the city became more challenging, certain streets were not listed, and the struggle to find my way around the city exploded a wave of nostalgia and homesickness within me. Yet these thoughts of home were forced to pass because I had to keep re-entering the world by getting around on foot.

Traversing the streets activated a movement of empowerment and liberation. When I stopped thinking of Los Angeles and nostalgic aspects of home, my walking throughout the city became my way to read Dublin’s history and observe the culture and current political affairs. Walking the city streets as a way to experience the city, as well as encountering a double consciousness, attained through a tactile and psychic knowing of urban identity extends itself to the notion of what it means to be a woman in a country such as Ireland. My creative project re-claims the streets by re-envisioning the woman flâneur, highlighting important streets such as Moore Street. The situationist psychogeography recognizes the emotional and behavioural effects of the physical environment on the people that interact with it, thus further complicating the definition of geography by stating that geographical environment is constructed beyond the natural environment as geography is gendered and produces genders. The best way for me to re-claim the streets of Dublin is to return and continue my research so I can self-publish this story.

The book I am working on titled ""My Only Love, My City Street"" is a mixed genres project called “Walking Through Dublin: Urban Poetics and Psychogeography” that creatively assembles nonlinear narratives in Dublin, Ireland by rewriting the nation’s historical and urban identity. Each particular narrative explores a specific city street within Dublin, allowing the characters to reveal the urban expansion as well as the sociological and cultural exchanges that shape Ireland’s traditions. The narratives walk through time, outlining the wanderings of marginalized migrants, and revealing issues of religion, philosophy, landscape, and urban planning.

City streets become palimpsests: repositories of history as well as the sites of self-understanding. The result of public contexts delivers the broad cultural and historical information of Dublin, Ireland through different time periods. The private context can hopefully address the reader directly through the thoughts of the multiple narrators, and my own personal attitude on the subject. Through a blending of these contexts, this project encourages travel and understandings of worldwide cultural and economic policies.
<div>
What I Need

I want to make this self-publishing venture a success and I need your help! My goal is to raise $12,000 in order to contribute to my travel, research and living expenses for the next twelve months in Dublin, Ireland. My goal to raise the money will also help me fund the first edition of 50 handbound, self illustrated and designed books.
Basic self publishing costs include editing, various website registration costs and legal fees. Other costs will go for materials, campaign fees and printing fees.
If I don't reach my goal I will continue to work on the project and supplement required funds in other ways such as part-time work.
<div>
The Impact

My intention with this project is to contribute and connect with other campaigns such as Save Moore Street, going on currently to protect and preserve a historic street in Dublin. My hopes with focusing on cities and reclaiming the situationist mentality will inspire other authors and activists to create similar campaigns and projects. My book ""My Only Love, My City Street"" invites pedestrians to reconnect with their cultural and historical surroundings.
<div>
Other Ways You Can Help
Please help by sharing and spreading the word about my campaign. Send a link to everyone you know!

A whole group of authors and bloggers have got together to bring this fundraiser to life!
We will be giving away a whole heap of goodies and here is a very important reason why:

Over Christmas and New Year, My friend had to rush her daughter to the ER. After tests and observation she was diagnosed with RSV. The RSV turned into pneumonia and then Jemma developed a staph infection in her blood (MRSA) But the little fighter, just keeps going! With her mom by her side she is fighting hard to beat the illness.

But recently she developed a moderately collapsed lung. After much deliberation, doctors ordered a scan to be done on little Jemma but there was a complication. She was incubated for the scan but her blood pressure dropped, they inserted a line for continuous epi because she needed several doses to stabilize her. She is now in the Pediatric Intensive Care Unit on a ventilator. Her hospital stay got substantially longer in a matter of minutes. And the pain and stress for the family also increased.

Unfortunately, and rather harshly, this pain has been worsened. Jemma's mom was told that her job may be in jeopardy due to her time off to be with her daughter. As you can understand, she is not willing to leave her child for the sake of her employer but to lose her income at this time, would be awful.
A reprieve came, when she was told that if she returned to work within 90 days, her job would be secure. Putting a deadline on someone to leave their sick child is not only cruel but also very stressful.

To add insult to injury, she is now officially without health insurance unless she is able to pay half of what her now-nonexistent paycheck would be. At this point though, her daughter's care is very expensive and her priority is to protect and care for her sick child. The bills are piling up.

 
Anything we raise goes straight to the family and to a sick little girl.

It may only be enough to help with travel costs, food costs, things to add some comfort to their hospital stays and maybe a nice gift for Jemma, but either way, every little bit helps!

 
By Donating, you are AUTOMATICALLY entered into the raffle to win one of the amazing prizes kindly donated by authors, bloggers and readers! Your donation will be cross checked with the rafflecopter to ensure your entry and donation are matched. If you are a winner you will be notified by email. So please remember to leave your name with your donation!!

About Luminosity

A few months ago, I had this idea to create a cleanse business (www.luminositycleanse.com). It was based loosely on a cleanse I had been making for myself periodically over the past few years. I didn't have a concrete plan, but it felt like a good idea. So I contacted a bunch of local friends and asked if they'd be willing to let me test out my idea on them. To my surprise, 10 of them said yes! And, they LOVED it! About 1/2 way through the ""test"" week, other people started contacting me, wondering when the next cleanse would be. So I planned another one and 10 more people signed up! About 1/2 way through that week, more people were contacting me... and that's pretty much the way it's been these last few months.

I started this business out of my home, with my trusty Vitamix and a borrowed juicer. Within a week, I had my own juicer and within a month, I began sub-leasing commercial kitchen space to accommodate the demand for this growing business.

Luminosity Cleanse blossomed out of my passion for helping and encouraging people to live a healthier, more full life. Nothing is more rewarding to me than seeing and hearing from people who feel alive and vibrant after a week of nurturing themselves on a cleanse. I am ready to share this cleanse on a much larger scale!
What I Need in Order to Grow

I have reached a point where my business will not be able to keep up with the momemtum it has generated until I open my own kitchen. I have outgrown the shared kitchen space, and I am in the process of putting a team in place to help me keep up with the local demand, and also to reach a broader audience.
<div>
These are my immediate needs:
<ul>
• Large capacity refrigerator for storing produce ($3-5k)
• Commerical dishwasher ($2k)
• additional blender ($500)
• Stainless steel prep tables ($1200)
• Stainless steel 3 compartment sink ($700)
• Commercial kitchen - rental and opening costs (unknown)
<li>Licensing &amp
All money raised will go directly towards the items listed above. I am beyond grateful for your support, and I'm so excited to expand and help more people experience vibrant health!
<div>
Other Ways You Can Help
Some people are unable to contribute monetarily, but you can still help by spreading the word about Luminosity and this Indiegogo campaign.
Special Thanks
Thank you to Chris Nelson Photography for the images used in this campaign.

Credit for the jaunty tune included in the above video goes to Mike Hatch, from the album Pentimento. The title of the song is ""Chet"", and I selected it in honor of my late Grandfather, Chester (Chet) Wolski.
","About Luminosity

A few months ago, I had this idea to create a cleanse business (www.luminositycleanse.com). It was based loosely on a cleanse I had been making for myself periodically over the past few years. I didn't have a concrete plan, but it felt like a good idea. So I contacted a bunch of local friends and asked if they'd be willing to let me test out my idea on them. To my surprise, 10 of them said yes! And, they LOVED it! About 1/2 way through the ""test"" week, other people started contacting me, wondering when the next cleanse would be. So I planned another one and 10 more people signed up! About 1/2 way through that week, more people were contacting me... and that's pretty much the way it's been these last few months.

I started this business out of my home, with my trusty Vitamix and a borrowed juicer. Within a week, I had my own juicer and within a month, I began sub-leasing commercial kitchen space to accommodate the demand for this growing business.

Luminosity Cleanse blossomed out of my passion for helping and encouraging people to live a healthier, more full life. Nothing is more rewarding to me than seeing and hearing from people who feel alive and vibrant after a week of nurturing themselves on a cleanse. I am ready to share this cleanse on a much larger scale!
What I Need in Order to Grow

I have reached a point where my business will not be able to keep up with the momemtum it has generated until I open my own kitchen. I have outgrown the shared kitchen space, and I am in the process of putting a team in place to help me keep up with the local demand, and also to reach a broader audience.
These are my immediate needs:
Large capacity refrigerator for storing produce ($3-5k)
Commerical dishwasher ($2k)
additional blender ($500)
Stainless steel prep tables ($1200)
Stainless steel 3 compartment sink ($700)
Commercial kitchen - rental and opening costs (unknown)
Licensing & inspection fees ($1k)
All money raised will go directly towards the items listed above. I am beyond grateful for your support, and I'm so excited to expand and help more people experience vibrant health!
Other Ways You Can Help
Some people are unable to contribute monetarily, but you can still help by spreading the word about Luminosity and this Indiegogo campaign.
Special Thanks
Thank you to Chris Nelson Photography for the images used in this campaign.

Credit for the jaunty tune included in the above video goes to Mike Hatch, from the album Pentimento. The title of the song is ""Chet"", and I selected it in honor of my late Grandfather, Chester (Chet) Wolski.",1.0,0,"1 Campaign

Please support our exciting NEW &
column2: FORTHCOMING book project, Unlikely Conditions, by Hillary Gravendyk &
column3:
Cynthia Arrieu-King.

A collaborative text by two beloved poets, Cynthia Arrieu-King and the late Hillary Gravendyk, Unlikely Conditions, ""was written as a way to embellish and perpetuate a friendship.""

Of her process working with Gravendyk, Arrieu-King says: 

""We

column1: created this book through conversation about what remains important as
we get older, jokes, inferences about existence, shared experience,
separate experiences melded together, and a hilarious engagement with
detail. We had a lot of fun together. This was the experience with all
of Hillary's collaborators including her sister Megan Estrella, Maureen
Alsop, Colleen Rosenfeld, Brenda Hillman, etc. I'm
putting it out in the world because my friend and I had always talked
about that as a given and also because I feel Hillary's family and other
readers would want to see the beautiful work she did with me, and see a

bit more of her intelligent heart and her love for life.""

1913 is proud to have been one of the very first publishers of Hillary Gravendyk's poetry in 1913 a journal of forms,
Issue 2 (as Hillary Gravendyk Burrill). We continue to mourn the early
loss of this wonderful poet and person, and celebrate her life and work

with this publication.

""Heart-shaped or

serrated,

departure

re-thinks what is meant.""

---

With the PRE-SALE purchase of Unlikely Conditions there are some really great perks to compliment your new book! (Please see Perks for details.)

---

Thank you to the Hamiltonians who helped us raise $1,855 in our initial campaign! We need 1,000 citizens to contribute $5.00 to help with legal costs.

Bill 52, Protection of Public Participation Act, 2015 is being implemented by the Ontario Provincial Government to amend the Courts of Justice Act, the Libel and Slander Act and the Statutory Powers Procedure Act in order to protect expression on matters of public interest. It is our opinion that recent events that have transpired are an attempt to stifle freedom of expression and detract from the pertinent election issues identified in the appeal.
<b style=""font-size: 24px
column4: >We believe that the Municipal Elections Act should be applied equally to all candidates in Hamilton: accountability should not be optional.

column1: Complaints were filed by Viv Saunders on eight individual candidates who ran in the 2014 Hamilton Election. Although the Hamilton Election Compliance Committee acknowledged that five of the candidates contravened the Municipal Elections Act they decided in all cases DOING NOTHING was appropriate.

column2: >DOING NOTHING means that the information available to the public is still incomplete, inaccurate, and unverifiable.
column3: >DOING NOTHING means that payment of honorariums to volunteers, purchases of televisions, home theatre systems, wine baskets, $500 gift cards, Santa Carousels, chocolate truffles, etc. etc., is acceptable to us as the electorate.
column4: >DOING NOTHING  means that the same individuals will continue to abuse the same rules without any fear of any repercussion or oversight and we silently condone the behaviour.

column2: >In our opinion, Doing Nothing was Not Acceptable: an Appeal has been filed with the Ontario Court of Justice naming five candidates.

Why We Care

","Thank you to the Hamiltonians who helped us raise $1,855 in our initial campaign! We need 1,000 citizens to contribute $5.00 to help with legal costs.

column1: Bill 52, Protection of Public Participation Act, 2015 is being implemented by the Ontario Provincial Government to amend the Courts of Justice Act, the Libel and Slander Act and the Statutory Powers Procedure Act in order to protect expression on matters of public interest. It is our opinion that recent events that have transpired are an attempt to stifle freedom of expression and detract from the pertinent election issues identified in the appeal.
We believe that the Municipal Elections Act should be applied equally to all candidates in Hamilton: accountability should not be optional.

Complaints were filed by Viv Saunders on eight individual candidates who ran in the 2014 Hamilton Election. Although the Hamilton Election Compliance Committee acknowledged that five of the candidates contravened the Municipal Elections Act they decided in all cases DOING NOTHING was appropriate.

DOING NOTHING means that the information available to the public is still incomplete, inaccurate, and unverifiable.DOING NOTHING means that payment of honorariums to volunteers, purchases of televisions, home theatre systems, wine baskets, $500 gift cards, Santa Carousels, chocolate truffles, etc. etc.,  is acceptable to us as the electorate.DOING NOTHING  means that the same individuals will continue to abuse the same rules without any fear of any repercussion or oversight and we silently condone the behaviour.
In our opinion, Doing Nothing was Not Acceptable: an Appeal has been filed with the Ontario Court of Justice naming five candidates.

As reported in the media, Eric Gillespie was retained as legal counsel in order to file the appropriate paperwork with the Ontario Court of Justice. 100% of funds raised will be used to cover the anticipated court costs for the following candidates:
1. Tom Jackson
2. Sam Merulla
3. Maria Pearson
4. Terry Whitehead
5. Lloyd Ferguson
The Ontario Court of Justice has the ability to order actual independent audits of each of the candidates filings. There is no other mechanism available to pursue an independent, non-biased review.

Why We CareWe are a group of volunteers who really do not get paid. We believe that elections are an important part of the democratic process and should not be taken lightly. Our position is supported by the Municipal Elections Act
column2: provincial legislation that contains the specific rules governing elections. Adherence to the rules in this situation should not be optional for anyone. Please contribute to our efforts!",0.0,0,"2 Campaigns

Querid@s amig@s,

Los integrantes del foro digital Todos contra la Mutilación Genital
Femenina, condenamos está terrible práctica que atenta contra los más
esenciales derechos de las mujeres y las niñas. Durante estos 5 años hemos
aprendido juntos y hemos apoyado acciones para vencer  <b>""las
cuchillas del terror y la muerte"". Más de
50.000 personas han expresado su condena respecto a esta milenaria
tradición. A todos los que conformamos esta comunidad nos horroriza que
persistan este tipo de costumbres que vulneran gravemente los derechos contra
la salud, la dignidad y la integridad de las mujeres.
Nos resulta inconcebible que la MGF siga siendo una práctica vigente, en
diversas formas, en unos cuarenta países. Veintiséis se encuentran en el
continente
africano. El resto se localizan en Oriente Medio y Asia. Sin embargo, debido a
los
flujos migratorios (tanto los actuales como los que se originan en la segunda
mitad
del siglo XX) se encuentra presente, asimismo, en países occidentales. Esta
constatación evidencia que estamos ante un problema global que para su
erradicación precisa análisis multidisciplinares e interdisciplinares con el
objetivo de definir, diseñar y adoptar estrategias consensuadas que provoquen
una profunda transformación social y cultural para apoyar su fin.
Necesitamos que nos ayuden:
<ul><li>El
terrible acto de la Mutilación Genital Femenina (MGF) se puede erradicar
si logramos concientizar a la población de las tremendas consecuencias que
conlleva practicarla. Creo firmemente que los rituales de paso constituyen
una opción real para vencer las ""cuchillas del terror y la
muerte"".
<ul><li>Por ese
motivo deseo ayudar a la ""FUNDACIÓN KIRIRA"" que nos ofrece
la posibilidad de comprar un regalo Anti-Ablación,  Consiste
en conseguir que NO se le practique la ablación a una niña de la etnia THARAKA.
Ellos se encargan de convencer a la familia para que se lleve a cabo todo
el ritual del paso a la edad adulta de la niña, con una fiesta, regalos
para la niña (vestido, zapatos, una caja para sus pertenencias, material
escolar) pero sin ""el corte"".
<ul><li>En el
pasado hemos ayudado económicamente a la ONGD ""AMAM""
recaudando fondos para que continúe nuestra lucha contra la MGF.
<ul><li>En caso
de no cumplir nuestro objetivo, los fondos que se recauden serán
destinados íntegramente a la ""FUNDACIÓN KIRIRA"" para que continúen
con su proyecto educativo, formativo y de sensibilización que vienen
desarrollando con las mujeres pertenecientes a la etnia
Salvar la vida de una niña de la Mutilación Genital es
una obra de amor,  todos sabemos las terribles consecuencias gravísimas
que tiene para la salud. Más allá del extremo dolor físico y psicológico que
origina, las niñas que han sufrido la mutilación de sus genitales están en
grave peligro de hemorragias, infección (también de VIH) infertilidad,
enfermedades debilitantes, e incluso de muerte. Esta tradición ancestral hace
añicos la infancia, pisotea los derechos de las niñas a la salud y a la supervivencia,
y compromete el bienestar en la vida adulta.
Nosotros vamos a regalar vida y una sonrisa que
perdure toda una vida. Existen muchos casos de niñas que sean salvado gracias a
los trabajos que desarrollan las ONGD sobre el terreno.  Entre todos
podemos conseguirlo, el mundo puede cambiar con la buena voluntad y disposición
de las personas. Seamos factor de cambio y hagámoslo por ellas que más lo
necesita.

De las aportaciones realizadas informaré a todos los miembros de nuestra comunidad virtual. Me comprometo a dar detalle de los ingresos recibidos.  Estoy convencido que podemos conseguir rescatar a una niña THARAKA de una vida de intensos dolores y sufrimiento, brindémosles la oportunidad de ser felices.

Otras formas en las que me puedes ayudar: 

  • Por favor, ayúdame a difundir mi acción  acción y que genere eco. Quizás si en estos momentos tu no puedes ayudarnos, otros amigos tuyos estén en disposición de hacerlo.
  • Mil gracias por todo!  Todos Unidos Contra la Mutilación Genital Femenina podemos conseguirlo!

Para Cezası İle Yıldırılmaya Çalışılan Devrimci Öğrencilerle Dayanışmaya! 

Amasya Suluova'da 2013 yılı 1 Mayıs'ı öncesinde gerçekleştirdiğimiz piknikte yoldaşlarımız, gençliğin devrimci heyecan ve coşkusundan nefrete kapılan, ilçede görevli astsubay ve ailesinin önce sözlü tacizine uğramış, sonra fiziksel saldırısıyla karşılaşmış
column2:
gerginliğin bitmesi sonrasında piknik alanından ilçeye dönerken jandarma tarafından gözaltına alınmışlardı. Gözaltı sırasında faşistleri kullanarak karakol önünde toplanmalar, konvoy halinde ilçede dolaşmalarla yoldaşlarımız üzerinde terör yaratılmaya çalışılmıştır. Bütün saldırganlığın kaynağı olan astsubay sonrasında mahkemeye başvurarak yalan tanıklarla yoldaşlarımızın bir kısmı aleyhinde, darp edildiği iddiasıyla şikayette bulunarak dava açılmasını sağlamıştır. 

Geçtiğimiz aylarda sonuçlanan davada yoldaşlarımıza para cezası çıkmış ve biri hariç diğerlerinin cezaları ertelenmiştir. Daha önce bir cezası bulunan yoldaşımıza ödenmediği takdirde hapis cezasına çevrilecek şekilde 4500 TL'lik (1500 $) para cezası çıkmıştır. 

Bu cezanın ödenmesini yoldaşça dayanışma çerçevesinde gerçekleştirmek için bu kampanyaya desteğinizi bekliyoruz.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Solidarity With The Revolutionary Students Tried To Dismay Through Penalty Fine!

 Our comrades faced with firstly the verbal harassment and then physical assault of a sergeant and his family who bristled with anger because of the revolutionary excitement and enthusiasm of the youth while having a picnic before May Day 2013 in Amasya Suluova. After the end of the tension our comrades were taken into custody by gendarmerie while going back to the town from the picnic place. During the custody, they tried to terrorize our comrades through the gathering of fascists in front of gendarmerie station and their convoys in the town. The source of all these attacks, the sergeant applied the court for prosecution and blamed our comrades for beating him and his family with the help of the fake perjurers. In the previous months, this case ended with penalty fine for our comrades and except one of them all these penalties were delayed. One comrade who was fined before, was in this case punished with the penalty fine of 4500 TL (1500 USD) which would convert to imprisonment if it was not paid. We are expecting your support to this campaign to pay this penalty fine with the help of revolutionary solidarity.

After the end of the tension our comrades were taken into custody by gendarmerie while going back to the town from the picnic place. During the custody, they tried to terrorize our comrades through the gathering of fascists in front of gendarmerie station and their convoys in the town. The source of all these attacks, the sergeant applied the court for prosecution and blamed our comrades for beating him and his family with the help of the fake perjurers. In the previous months, this case ended with penalty fine for our comrades and except one of them all these penalties were delayed. One comrade who was fined before, was in this case punished with the penalty fine of 4500 TL (1500 USD) which would convert to imprisonment if it was not paid. We are expecting your support to this campaign to pay this penalty fine with the help of revolutionary solidarity.",0.0,0,"1 Campaign

column1: |","Ankara, Turkey",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/devrimci-ogrencilerle-dayanisma-cagrisi/pica

0,"

This campaign has been fully funded and is complete. You can NOW purchase a copy of this board book at http://godiaperfree.com/tinypotty or here on indiegogo!
Thanks to all our backers!!!!
xx Andrea, author
What it is!
The potty training age is now an average of 3 years old in the US! Help
me reverse this trend back to the average of 18 months (what it was in
1957, before disposable diapers) by communicating to our kiddos that
they were BORN READY, are fully CAPABLE of using the potty, and that it
can be fun to have a potty routine in their home.
The world has been waiting for a potty training board book that actually helps solidify the process! (And one that spans ages as early as 6 months and up.)

I'm Andrea Olson and I've taught infant potty training (EC) and non-coercive potty training for the past 5 years at Go Diaper Free through my books and podcast...and throughout this and ECing two of my own babies from birth I have NEVER found a potty training board book that provides ALL of the following:
<ul>
• gives the message that children are capable of going to the potty, from an early age
• doesn't include pictures of diapers, or the question of ""should I pee in my diaper or not?""
• doesn't teach children it's okay to pee on the floor or in their pants

• doesn't give the message that children should ""wait til they're ready"" (a message created by a Pampers advocate and pediatrician just two years after disposable diapers hit the market - and has doubled our potty training age!)
• teaches the actual steps of going to the potty
• has humor appropriate for the ages of 6 month-3 years old
• makes pottying ""normal"" from 6 months to 3 years old (or older, gasp!).

This campaign will raise funds to get my board book (which is already *fully illustrated* by a professional artist, written by me, edited, and completely ready to print) printed, shipped, and distributed for sale in major bookstores, on Amazon, and on my own websites.

By supporting this campaign YOU will not only get a great potty training board book, but you will also help 1,000s of other moms and dads give their children a tool that is fun, engaging and educational about making potty a normal part of everyday life, whether they practice Elimination Communication or are potty training their toddler.

What I Need &
column2:
What You Get

I need a total of $8,000 to complete the production of this book. Again, it is already fully illustrated and written/edited (which has cost over $500 of my own money) and is fully ready to go to print.

column1: The $8,000 needed will pay for:
<ul>
• $5,000 printing costs, ISBN #, barcode, shipping, and duties
• $2,000 distribution, PR, and book events
• $1,000 marketing, advertising, and promotion.
If I surpass my goal, I will produce more books and use them to supply
our nation's libraries and low income parents with this resource as an outreach project.

What YOU will get!

The perks involved in this campaign are fun and practical. You will, at the very least, get a beautifully-illustrated, 20 page, 6""x6"" board book (or multiple books, depending on the perk), and some of you will get original artwork, bookmarks...and other exciting perks may be added toward the end of the campaign as well.
The impact this book will have on the WORLD...

I have successfully brought two books on infant and toddler potty training into the world, organically and over time, and have helped over 5,000 families reduce or elimination their dependence upon diapers.

With this book, I want to support our babies and children in reaching this core competency at appropriate ages (my goal is for children to feel confident finishing potty training at around 18-20 months, after knowing the potty since the child's first 6 months of life) with gentle, clear modeling through the character and the character's friend, Bear.

The impact on the WORLD is unlimited! Once we change the status quo, more babies and parents will avoid the struggles and medical issues associated with late or difficult potty training, and we can get on with what really matters, more quickly, such as instilling self-esteem, pride in oneself, and an increase in confidence, mobility, and self-care...all results of early potty training!
Risks &
column2:
ChallengesRisks are low here folks! You're working with a self-taught pro. :) Lessons I've learned with importing my line of Tiny Undies will absolutely help me curb the risks associated with importing these completed books. I have also experienced self-publishing my own 2 books and have learned a lot about getting a book to market...and feel there is no barrier to entry for authors with the right skills.

I am equipped for any challenge, but with the team I've selected and most of the work already done, I am certain this book will be a huge success!

column1: Other Ways You Can Help: JUST SHARE!!!
If you can't fund this campaign directly, no worries!

Please share the link to this campaign via email, Facebook, Twitter, and more (YOU CAN SHARE *EASILY* WITH THE LINKS AT THE TOP OF THIS CAMPAIGN PAGE) to help others find out about it so they can help make it happen. By doing this, you are helping 1,000s of babies and parents get out of diapers, for good.
Thanks a bunch!

xx Andrea Olson
Author of Go Diaper Free, The Tiny Potty Training Book, and The Tiny Potty Board Book
column3: Mother of (soon-to-be) 3 here in good ole Asheville, NC

The Story So Far...
Based in Ypsilanti, Toronto, and Brooklyn, The Cultural Gutter
was founded in May, 2003 by writer, filmmaker and game designer Jim Munroe and comics critic and artist Guy Leshinski to provide thoughtful and
provocative writing on disreputable art. Since then, we've had ten
editors in two countries and five cities write on comics, romance, genre
movies, tv, science fiction, fantasy, video games, and porn. And
in all that time we paid our writers, both editors and Guest Stars.
Then we lost our operations funding grant in 2013, but a small, rag-tag band of
donors joined forces with the Gutter to keep us online and help us keep our

commitment to paying writers for their work.

The Gutter offers something unusual. Thoughtful, well-written articles on topics like:  Duran Duran &
column3: True Detective, Mad Men and self-control
column9: the salvific power of Star Trek and friendship
column10: Punisher: War Zone and what it means to be ""good"" or ""bad""
column11: and Filipina superhero Darna. Our survival depends on the Gutterthon. So please click Contribute Now and keep the Gutter flowing with the writing you

column1: love. Even if you can only throw in a buck, we will thank you from the bottom

of our hearts.

What We Need &

UPDATE: WE HAVE REACHED OUR GOAL! Thanks to everyone who has contributed to and shared our campaign! We really appreciate it! For now, we're leaving the campaign up with a new stretch goal of $2250, so if you had planned on getting a particular perk. Any new funds we receive will go towards paying an artist to design the cover of the upcoming second collection of Cultural Gutter essays, Return To The Cultural Gutter.
Our $2000 goal breaks down to: $250/year/writer or about $20/article
column2: $250/year for the Evil Overlord for publishing, promoting,

column1: finding new writers, day-to-day site management and making sure all
the perks are shipped out
column2: $382/year for our fine webhost at No Media Kings. The remaining $368 will go towards printing and shipping perks, promotional

column1: materials, paying guest writers and paying Indiegogo and Paypal
fees. This year we also plan to launch a new Cultural Gutter book, redesign the site and add an index to our twelve-year archive of articles.
In return, along with thoughtful and provocative articles on subjects also get our undying and eternal thanks and your choice of some sweet perks.

Perks Include:

A Cultural Gutter Membership package including a numbered and
dated CG Membership Card and a decryption key for decoding the CG Secret
Messages posted at the top of the Sponsor's Page.

Two-time British Fantasy Award nominee for Best Small Press Fox Spirit Books has donated digital copies of their anthology, The Girl At The End Of The World, Vol. 1. ""Across two volumes, The Girl at the End of the World offers forty-one
striking visions of the apocalypse and the women and girls dealing with
it. From gods to zombies, from epic to deeply personal, from the moment
of impact to a future where life is long forgotten
and exciting new writers deliver tales you’ll still remember when holed
up in a fallout shelter with one remaining bullet and a best friend with
a suspicious bite mark on their neck."" And they've donated digital copies of Drag Noir. ""This is where glamour meets grit, where everyone’s wearing a disguise
(whether they know it or not) and knowing the players takes a lot more
than simply reading the score cards. Maybe everyone’s got something to
hide, but they’ve got something to reveal, too. Scratch the surface and
explore what secrets lie beneath — it’s bound to cost someone…a lot."" The Gutter's own Carol has a story in each collection.

Our sister site Pornokitsch donated books from their Jurassic London imprint, including a signed copy of limited edition hard copy of Robert Sharp's Shirley Jackson Award-nominated The Good Shabti. They've donated digital copies
of their anthology, Irregularity. ""Irregularity
depicts the tension between order and chaos in the 17th and 18th

centuries....From John Harrison to Ada Lovelace, Isaac Newton to Émilie du Châtelet, these stories showcase the Age of Reason in a very different light."" They've also provided digital copies of  The Book of the Dead. ""The Book of the Dead addresses the most fascinating of all the
undead: the mummy. The mummy can be a figure of imperial dignity or one
of shambling terror, at home in pulp adventure, contemporary drama, or

apocalyptic horror,"" featuring stories by Gail Carriger and Paul Cornell. The Book Of The Dead is also available in a hardcopy form paired with Unearthed, which ""resurrects eleven classic tales of the mummy, selected by John J. Johnston (Egypt Exploration Society)
and Jared Shurin. These stories date back to the middle of the 19th
century, and several have not been republished for almost two hundred
years.""
A pre-order of our second Cultural Gutter book, Return To The Cultural Gutter, collecting essays by Gutter Editors Carol Borden, Chris Szego, alex MacFadyen and Keith Allison.

A copy of the Naked Gutterthon poster designed by by Brian Kirby of Shelf Life Clothing Company (and Drive-In Mob)

A grab bag of My Pretty Zombie's best selling cosmetics for a sweet zombie makeover. Three eyeshadows: Anthrax Brisket
column2:
Everything Looks Better On A Meat Hook are paired with Benzodiazepine blush.

Our friends at Cinema Detroit, Detroit's premier movie house, have donated a swank Cinema Detroit t-shirt.

Private citizen Julie Lowry has donated three sets of cellphone accessories. Pack contents vary, but include a minimum of 2 usb cords, a wall charger, a car charger and a stylus. Choose from iPhone 4, 5/6 and choose your own color: white, black, pink, red, blue, yellow, green, orange, or purple.

The Gutter's own Carol Borden has donated handmade homunculi as well as starstones to prevent the Elder Gods from invading your dreams. She's also donated handprinted Cthulhu notebooks! UPDATE: Cthulhu Moleskines SOLD OUT!

NEW PERK: Spooky Mini-Altar: A shadowbox created by Michelle Marrero of Nacreous Alchemy. It depicts a bird-headed Victorian woman looking into the secrets of the future. A tarot card decorates the sides of the box.

NEW PERK: Sassy Diabolik Mug: Enjoy a hot beverage with this sassy mug decorated with an image of naked Diabolik and a puppy  created by Brian Kirby. The mug is 3.75"" / 9.5 cm high and 3"" / 7.6 cm in diameter. (It's also microwave and dishwasher safe, but I wouldn't try covering it in molten gold). See the image in our Gallery!

NEW PERK: Mantis Fist Diagrams: We have discovered a small cache of Mantis Fist diagrams bound in a small booklet and we are prepared to offer them as a perk. There is a rumor that there might be some Eastern Kaiju Mantis Fist diagrams mixed, we cannot confirm that at this time. (Thanks to Evan Munday and Carol Borden).

NEW PERK: Space Cat Super Pack: You will receive one 8 x 10"" of ""Space Cat on the Subway"" and one

column1:
11 x 14"" photo of Space Cat above graffiti declaring ""F*ck Love"" as well as several Space Cat pins and a coupon for the 2016 Space Cat Calendar. (Check out pictures in our gallery)

NEW PERK: Medieval Charm: Get a genuine medieval charm handwritten on parchment paper by the History Witch, Professor K. A. Laity. Choice of healing or agricultural, comes with translation and advice on use (for entertainment purposes only).

ETC Press has donated print copies of The Cultural Gutter (2011), a collection of pieces published on the Gutter from Jim Munroe, James Schellenberg, Carol Borden, Chris Szego and Ian Driscoll. This print version also has fantastic infographic illustrations by artist EJ Lee. UPDATE: SOLD OUT

And three lucky contributors can have a song written and performed on the disreputable art topic of their choice by Julie Beman of the Dress-Ups and Chica Non Grata, aka, the people who behind that sweet Dune song,
column2: feature=youtu.be"" rel=""noopener nofollow"">""Gom Jabbar."" Love Star Wars, Black Widow or robots? She will sing about them. UPDATE: SOLD OUT!

column1:
But even $1 gets our Undying Thanks.

If we don't reach
our goal, we'll use the funds to print and ship your perks, pay our

webhost and see how much we can pay each editor. If we exceed our goal, we would use the extra funds to print promotional materials, hire additional guest writers, or even hire an artist to illustrate Return To The Cultural Gutter.
The Impact
We like to think that the Gutter offers something that is unusual
online: Clear-eyed, thoughtful and thought-provoking writing on
disreputable art and media. If you donate or support the campaign by
sharing, you will help keep the Gutter online and running
particular take on disreputable art
column2: and help support paying writers for

column1:
their work.

We ran a successful fundraiser last summer, we sent
out all our perks, and, thanks to everyone's help, we kept going.  With
your help, we can do it again. The Cultural Gutter's survival does

depend on Gutterthon.

Risks &
column2:
Challenges

We recognize that it's a difficult time for creators of all kinds, that platforms are valued more than content. But we believe with your help, we can do our little part to keep the Gutter flowing with quality writing.

column1: Other Ways You Can Help
We know that times are hard for a lot of people and any little bit
helps, even a retweet or sharing our campaign on Facebook. Indiegogo has

tools that make it easy.

Thanks!

column1: <h2 style=""text-align: center
The book is almost 200 pages. I'm working with my designer, Nancy Wolinski, on the interior design so that every aspect of this project is beautiful, meaningful and sacred.
<span style=""font-weight: normal
column2: >The book is the training manual for Sacred Bodywork™.

column1: It is also a book for any one who has ever asked...
Is this it, or is there more to life?
and for any one who has ever felt...
Tired of old habits and patterns you can neither shake nor break.

A Dual Path is intended for anyone ready for transformation, including bodywork professionals who want to elevate their profession to a true art and their clients who want to experience massage as a feast for the soul.
<ul>
<h2 style=""text-align: center
<li>
Forward by Hugh Milne of the Milne Institute (milneinstitute.com)
• Part 1: A New Mindset
• Part 2: The Sacred Practices
• Part 3: Sacred Bodywork Revealed
• Part 4: The Client and Professional Guide
• Part 5: My Sacred Journey - A Retrospective
<li>
Resources, includes books, websites, films and documentaries.
<h2 style=""text-align: center

It is known that massage and bodywork is good for the body, that it can alleviate physical stress and tension, decrease physical discomforts, aches and pains. Many massage professionals use it to enhance athletic performance, to facilitate healing after a surgery or illness and towards a multitude of other goals.
However, it is also a powerful force of healing for the other aspects that make up the totality of the complicated and multi-dimensional beings we are: the energetic matrix.

The energetic matrix is made up of not only our physical body, but our emotional, spiritual, dream and energetic bodies. It is within this matrix that we hold our thoughts, memories, emotional and behavioral patterns, as well as the holding patterns in our physical body.

The more subtle levels of the energetic matrix encompass specific flows and patterns of energy such as chakras, meridians, etc. which will also manifest blockages, distortions or disruptions found in our energetic matrix.

A Dual Path is one that explores how distortions and blockages in our matrix have effected us. It then clears and shifts our energetic matrix so we can move forward into an awakened sense of ourselves. It encompasses two approaches: Sacred Practices and Bodywork.
While A Dual Path is geared towards bodywork professionals and their clients, it may be used by anyone who wishes to embark on a path of transformation and an awakened spirit.
<h2 style=""text-align: center

One path, the Sacred Practices, explores who we are at this moment in time, what we hold in our energetic matrix and facilitates their release to clear unhealthy emotional, behavioral and thought patterns and form a transformed and transcendent version of ourselves.
In the context of Massage &
column2: Bodywork, this clearing develops the professionals ability to hone in on their clients state of mind and body. It also allows the professional to be fully present and develop vital listening skills.

column1: <h2 style=""text-align: center

The other path, Sacred Bodywork™ allows us to experience ourselves without these patterns. Sacred Bodywork shifts ""tectonic plates"" both physical and energetic, allowing us to diffuse and shift our energetic matrix as we journey outside our patterns limitations.
<h2 style=""text-align: center

My journey has been one of rich and diverse life experiences. For example, I graduated from art school, trained as an Expressive Arts Therapist, was inducted into the World Martial Arts Hall of Fame, spent a summer working in a fish factor in Alaska, was in the Israeli Defense Forces, have travelled to 24 countries including Mongolia, I was married in Israel and divorced in America, but was born in England to parents who are Holocaust survivors, my mother French, my father Czechoslovakian while my two brothers were born in Australia. I currently live in Marblehead, MA where my husband, Blane and I own Hand in Hand Massage.

The legacy I was born into disrupted my energetic matrix in utero and created serious challenges, including unhealthy emotional and behavioral patters In my early teens, I was called to leave home and go on an odyssey to find my spirit, a spirit that I was completely unfamiliar with. Through this internal odyssey, I not only transformed my behavior, personal ethics, habits, thought and emotional patterns but I created a meaningful and sacred internal life.
I know from direct personal experience that change and deep transformation are possible, and in this book, I've laid out the steps for you to follow.

A Dual Path is a serious and challenging journey for those committed to self-transformation and an Awakened Spirit. It is also a practical textbook for those Massage Professionals who want to learn Sacred Bodywork™, and incorporate the sacred into their own sessions and into their clients experiences.
Feel free to visit our websites: www.adualpath.com and www.handinhandmassage.com
<h3 style=""text-align: center

column1: Any additional funds raised will go towards equipment for a teaching institute.

column1: ","Click on the video above
and see some more beautiful pages and content of my book
A Dual Path calls us to Awaken the Spirit, to experience life as both meaningful and sacred.

I've been writing my book for 3 years and I'm currently working on integrating a sense of the sacred into the design of the book. This challenge mirrors the challenge we are all faced with: the integration of the sacred into our life.
In both cases, it can be done:

What shapes us? What is it that creates our patterns of physical holding, and patterns of behavior, thought and emotion? We are shaped by our life experiences, our memories and our daily responsibilities. These give shape to, and create disturbances in, our energetic matrix, and those of us who move forward into life with disruptions in our energetic matrix often feel lost and as if our life lacks meaning.
This book is groundbreaking because it offers a means to clear our energetic matrix and in so doing, experience ourselves and our daily life as sacred.

My name is Monique Illona and I'm the developer of Sacred Bodywork™ and author of A Dual Path: Sacred Practices and Bodywork. I'm an award winning and Nationally Certified massage & bodywork professionals. Along with my husband, Blane, I have owned my business, Hand in Hand Massage, since 1991.
The Book
The book is almost 200 pages. I'm working with my designer, Nancy Wolinski, on the interior design so that every aspect of this project is beautiful, meaningful and sacred.
The book is the training manual for Sacred Bodywork™.
It is also a book for any one who has ever asked...
Is this it, or is there more to life?
and for any one who has ever felt...
Tired of old habits and patterns you can neither shake nor break.

A Dual Path is intended for anyone ready for transformation, including bodywork professionals who want to elevate their profession to a true art and their clients who want to experience massage as a feast for the soul.
Contents
Forward by Hugh Milne of the Milne Institute (milneinstitute.com)
Part 1: A New Mindset
Part 2: The Sacred Practices
Part 3: Sacred Bodywork Revealed
Part 4: The Client and Professional Guide
Part 5: My Sacred Journey - A Retrospective
Resources, includes books, websites, films and documentaries.
The Premise

It is known that massage and bodywork is good for the body, that it can alleviate physical stress and tension, decrease physical discomforts, aches and pains. Many massage professionals use it to enhance athletic performance, to facilitate healing after a surgery or illness and towards a multitude of other goals.
However, it is also a powerful force of healing for the other aspects that make up the totality of the complicated and multi-dimensional beings we are: the energetic matrix.

The energetic matrix is made up of not only our physical body, but our emotional, spiritual, dream and energetic bodies. It is within this matrix that we hold our thoughts, memories, emotional and behavioral patterns, as well as the holding patterns in our physical body.

The more subtle levels of the energetic matrix encompass specific flows and patterns of energy such as chakras, meridians, etc. which will also manifest blockages, distortions or disruptions found in our energetic matrix.

A Dual Path is one that explores how distortions and blockages in our matrix have effected us. It then clears and shifts our energetic matrix so we can move forward into an awakened sense of ourselves. It encompasses two approaches: Sacred Practices and Bodywork.
While A Dual Path is geared towards bodywork professionals and their clients, it may be used by anyone who wishes to embark on a path of transformation and an awakened spirit.
Sacred Practices

One path, the Sacred Practices, explores who we are at this moment in time, what we hold in our energetic matrix and facilitates their release to clear unhealthy emotional, behavioral and thought patterns and form a transformed and transcendent version of ourselves.

In the context of Massage & Bodywork, this clearing develops the professionals ability to hone in on their clients state of mind and body. It also allows the professional to be fully present and develop vital listening skills.
Sacred Bodywork

The other path, Sacred Bodywork™ allows us to experience ourselves without these patterns. Sacred Bodywork shifts ""tectonic plates"" both physical and energetic, allowing us to diffuse and shift our energetic matrix as we journey outside our patterns limitations.
Monique's Journey

My journey has been one of rich and diverse life experiences. For example, I graduated from art school, trained as an Expressive Arts Therapist, was inducted into the World Martial Arts Hall of Fame, spent a summer working in a fish factor in Alaska, was in the Israeli Defense Forces, have travelled to 24 countries including Mongolia, I was married in Israel and divorced in America, but was born in England to parents who are Holocaust survivors, my mother French, my father Czechoslovakian while my two brothers were born in Australia. I currently live in Marblehead, MA where my husband, Blane and I own Hand in Hand Massage.

The legacy I was born into disrupted my energetic matrix in utero and created serious challenges, including unhealthy emotional and behavioral patters In my early teens, I was called to leave home and go on an odyssey to find my spirit, a spirit that I was completely unfamiliar with. Through this internal odyssey, I not only transformed my behavior, personal ethics, habits, thought and emotional patterns but I created a meaningful and sacred internal life.
I know from direct personal experience that change and deep transformation are possible, and in this book, I've laid out the steps for you to follow.

A Dual Path is a serious and challenging journey for those committed to self-transformation and an Awakened Spirit. It is also a practical textbook for those Massage Professionals who want to learn Sacred Bodywork™, and incorporate the sacred into their own sessions and into their clients experiences.
Feel free to visit our websites: www.adualpath.com and www.handinhandmassage.com

Limina
is an online magazine of women writing about faith. The word Limina means 'she
who is standing on the threshold.' We hope to explore matters of faith,
culture, politics, and arts from that position. We are diverse and inclusive, representing many religions, spiritualities, and faith traditions, as well as atheists and agnostics. We take our voices
seriously, we take our position seriously, and we honor the work of
those who came before us and made what we do possible. But we can be
irreverent at times. We’re here to engage readers, and to make them
think, and occasionally, to prod them into action.
<h3>What We Need &amp

column4: >But we need your help to make this a reality. We'd like to pay our designers to make a functional, user-friendly website that can easily (and frequently) be updated with new content. We'd like to have a memorable logo design too. So we're asking you to contribute to making this magazine as visually interesting as the words we write.

column1: <h3><span class=""Apple-style-span"" style=""color: rgb(34, 34, 34)
<ul>

• For $500, we will custom craft a specific devotional text, prayer, or blessing for you, plus a thank you online. You'll also get an autographed book, Hildegard's cookies, a shout out on Facebook/Twitter and a thank you on our finished website.

• For $250, we'll offer a manuscript critique for book or academic projects up to 100 pages, plus an hour Skype chat with a published author about your writing, plus a thank you online. You'll also get an autographed book, Hildegard's cookies, a shout out on Facebook/Twitter and a thank you on our finished website.

• For $100, we'll offer resume/CV/short article/talk editing and revision help, plus a thank you online. You'll also get a choice of an autographed book or the Hildegard cookies, a shout out on Facebook/Twitter and a thank you on our finished website.
• For $50, we'll offer a signed copy of one of our books (your choice!), plus a thank you online, plus a hand-written thank you.
• For $25, we'll bake you a batch of Hildegard Von Bingen's cookies and send them to you, plus a thank you online, plus a hand-written thank you.
• For $10, you'll get a shout out of thanks on Facebook and Twitter and a thank you on our finished website.
• For $5, you'll get a shout out of thanks on Facebook and Twitter.
The Impact
<ul>

• While women play a huge part in religion and faith in America and abroad, no magazine specifically written by women about faith exists at this moment. And women have much to say and contribute to this important discussion.
• Our contributing editors and writers include award-winning writers, working journalists, theologians, scholars of comparative religion, believers, seekers, and those in between.
• We want to grow a community of women and men who are interested in talking about faith beyond yes or no questions.

• If we raise $2500, we'll have a fabulous website. If we raise $4000, we'll have a fabulous website plus a professionally designed logo we can use for social media. So please give what you can. Your help is much appreciated.
Other Ways You Can Help

• Give us a shout out on Facebook and Twitter. Tell your friends!

Short Summary
Hi Folks,

I'm reaching out to you so that I can get funds to hire an editor for my first debut novel - The Third Sign.  It is an apocalyptic techno-thriller with a Native American twist.  It's going to be a really cool book to read and also will open your eyes to the scary stuff out there that could happen to us in America and around the world, with great morals in the stories.
You are funding the ""Book 1: The Day of the Red Skies"" of what I intend to be a Trilogy for The Third Sign.
I am about 75% done with this book before editing, and my goal is to finish the book by the end of October and send it to an editor.

I will be publishing my book independently, and I am choosing to go the 'crowd-funding' route so that I can get more people involved and allow people to own a piece of my work.  So, my work gets published, and you as a contributor will have a sense of ownership of my work, and your name will be acknowledged in my book for as little as $10 in contribution (Please look at the perks).

column2: >Please contribute as generously as you can, and own a piece of a future bestselling novel!  Thank you!

column1: Sincerely,
Allistaire Myaing (Author)
<h3>What I Need &amp
Here is the breakdown of what I will need the money for:
<ul>

• A good editor costs anywhere between $2,500 to $5,000 for a novel of about 75,000 words or roughly about 250 pages long, and will also need to put in additional funds for publishing and advertising and marketing.  My goal is to raise $2,700 or more, which will translate to roughly $2,500 after paying fundraising fees to Indiegogo.  This will allow me to get a decent editor, and I will get a chance to publish it on time.  I feel that this book needs to be in people's hands so that they can get the lessons I am trying to point out in the book.

• All of the funds I collect will go towards getting this book published on time.

    What you will get (The Perks):

• You will get to read the first 8 chapters of my book (unedited version) in PDF eBook format for as little as $5 in contributions, and your name will get acknowledged in my book for as little as $10.  For $25, you will get a signed copy of my book in paperback as soon as it gets published (ETA is February 2014).

• You have my commitment to get the book out, even if I don't reach my goal.  I will get whatever level of editing I can get, and still get the book out by February 2014.  If I run into any delays, I will keep you posted.
The Impact

The main story of my book is that the world is in danger with an ever increasing frequency of natural disasters and man-made disasters and terrorist attacks, and that people need to take heed to the warning signs that are out there.

The most dangerous of all in my opinion is the Electro-magnetic Pulse (EMP) attack.  Rouge nations like North Korea and Iran are known to be developing nuclear weapons capable of creating EMP that could knock out large areas of electrical and electronic infrastructure.  Nuclear weapons with the capacity to knock out the entire electrical grid of the United States are now available, and in the hands of rival countries such as Russia and China, and politically ambiguous countries like India and Pakistan.  These weapons can become available to large well-funded terrorist organizations for a price.  To make matters worse, the United States is gaining many enemies through direct or indirect military or political involvement in countries like Libya, Egypt, Syria, and Yemen.

On the other hand, our way of high consumption lifestyle is not sustainable, in fact we are living this modern high consumption lifestyle on borrowed time, and we need to either change our habits or forsake our children's futures.
<ul>
• You will get a chance to understand how devastating an Electromagnetic Pulse attack will be on America, in an entertaining way, and learn how to protect yourself.
• You will get a chance to own a piece of my success if this book becomes a bestseller.  I fully expect it to be, but there's work to do, and I need your help.

• The alternative is that my work will not get published, and not enough people will hear my words.  I cannot let this happen, and you have my word that this book will get published, one way or another.  But I would prefer to get your help.
Other Ways You Can Help
I understand that some of you just don't have the means to contribute money, but that doesn't mean you can’t help:
<ul>
• You can get the good word out and make some noise about my book to your friends and family or like-minded folks, in person or on your blogs or forums.
• You can use the Indiegogo share tools to share on Facebook, Twitter, or email folks you know.
And, you can always send me a word of encouragement or valuable constructive feedback.  I could definitely use that.
Thank you for reading this, and thank you for your support!

Allistaire Myaing (Author)

KAREN LADSON DESERVES A F*CKING BREAK
column2:
>After enduring brutal knee surgery, months of rehabilitation (during one of the worst winters in Rochester, NY history where she had to navigate blizzards on crutches), lost housing, family crisis and general nationwide crud, Karen's laptop died. About an hour ago. And her 51st birthday is this Saturday (July Fourth.) I'm thinking we can toss a few bucks her way to lighten the load. It'll be a late gift, but I'm telling you - SHE WILL CRY. Don't you want to help make Karen Ladson cry*?  
 
 
 
 
 
*tears of joy
