Sobre Anastasia e o livro Petalassónia
 

Meu nome é Anastasia. Eu sou escritora e mãe de três.

O livro ""Petalassónia"" é inspirado pela história de uma verdadeira (já adulta) menina Sonia que continua a sua batalha pela vida, cuja história eu queria compartilhar com tantos corações corajosos em corpos frágeis. Todos os lucros desta campanha serão doados à ONG Operação Nariz Vermelho cuja missão é levar alegria às crianças hospitalizadas através da visita de palhaços profissionais.

O livro é ilustrado por Yana Fefelova com quem tenho vários projetos e livros feitos e que sem nunca se reunir ou conversar com a Sónia conseguiu capturar seu belo mundo interior e contribuir para a história com sua arte única.

Sobre a Sónia e o livro Petalassónia

Chamo-me Sónia, tenho 36 anos, sou Designer, adoro crianças, amo o meu marido, a minha família, os meus amigos… e o meu grande sonho… é ser feliz!
Seria uma menina igual a tantas outras não fosse uma pequena diferença… a minha doença.
Desde os meus 6 anos que vivo com uma insuficiência renal, ou seja os meus rins não funcionam bem.
Já passei por momentos em que estive muito doente e por outros em que me sentia uma menina normal… mas a verdade é que sempre adoeci muito facilmente
Passei muito tempo no hospital mas isso não me impediu de brincar ou de ir à escola.
Nem sempre a vida corre como gostaríamos e por vezes  parece mesmo que o mundo está contra nós. Parece, mas não está! Nessas alturas é importante pensarmos em tudo o que temos de bom  na nossa vida... como a nossa família e os nossos amigos.
Temos de aprender a viver com o que temos e a aceitar que temos algumas limitações…
O importante é nunca desistir e lutar sempre por aquilo que queremos!
Temos de acreditar que tudo é possível e que podemos, e devemos, ser felizes!

O que precisamos e o que você ganha
 

O livro Petalassónia está pronto para imprimir. A fim de cobrir os custos de produção e contribuir para a caridade que eu preciso para levantar €2.500 em pré-vendas. Criei vários pacotes para os meus apoiantes Indiegogo. Entre as vantagens:
• Cópia digital do livro
• Conjunto de cartões postais com ilustrações e frases do livro
• Um livro de capa dura (na língua de sua escolha) - Inglês, Português e Russo
• Um pacote que oferece um livro a uma criança que precisa dele
• Ilustrações originais do livro

Por cada livro comprado, é doado (1) um euro à ONG Nariz Vermelho, que ilumina os dias de crianças que estão a lutar as sua próprias batalhas em hospitais portugueses com a ajuda de médicos palhaços profissionais. Além disso, no final da campanha todos os lucros revertem para a ONG Nariz Vermelho.

Obrigada pelo seu apoio!

Estou tão grata pelo seu apoio ao livro Petalassónia! Por favor, se conhece alguém que beneficiaria desta história inspiradora ajude a divulgar a campanha .

Siga o progresso no Facebook. Vamos actualizando o nosso progresso!

Atenciosamente,

Anastasia

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

About Anastasia and The Petalled Sonia Book

My name is Anastasia. I am a writer and a homeschooling mother of three. 

The book ""Petalled Sonia"" is inspired by a story of a real (already adult) girl Sonia who carries on with her battle for life, whose story I wanted to share with so many other brave hearts in fragile bodies. All profits from this campaign will be donated to NGO Nariz Vermelho that brightens the days of children each fighting their own battle in Portuguese hospitals with the help of professional Clown doctors.

The book is illustrated by Yana Fefelova with whom I have multiple projects and books done and who without ever meeting or talking to Sonia managed to capture her beautiful inner world and contribute to the story with her unique artwork. 

About Sonia and The Petalled Sonia Book

My name is Sonia and I am a designer. I love children, my husband, my family, my friends….and my greatest dream…is to be happy!

I was a little girl just like so many others with one small exception….my illness. 

I have lived with kidney trouble since I was 6 years old and found out that my kidneys don’t work properly. There were moments when I was very ill and others when I felt like a normal little girl. 

The truth is that the illness came upon me very often and I spent a lot of time in the hospital but this didn’t stop me from playing or going to school. Life doesn’t always go the way you want it to and sometimes it even feels as if the world is against us.  It may feel that way but it isn’t the case!  

At those times it is important to think about everything good that we have in our lives, like our family and friends. We have to learn to live with what we have and to accept that we have some limitations… 

The important thing is to never give up and to always keep fighting for what we want!  We must believe that everything is possible and that we can, and we must, be happy!

What We Need &
column2:
What you Get

The book Petalled Sonia is ready to print. In order to cover production costs and contribute to the charity I need to raise €2,500 in pre-sales. I have created several packages for my Indiegogo supporters. Among the perks:

Digital copy of the book

Set of postcards with illustrations and phrases from the book

A hardcover book (in the language of your choice) - English, Portuguese and Russian

A book bundle that offers a book to a child who can benefit from it

Original illustrations from the book

1 euro from every book purchased on Indiegogo plus all the profits at the end of the campaign will go to NGO Nariz Vermelho that brightens the days of children each fighting their own battle in Portuguese hospitals with the help of professional Clown doctors.

Thank you for your support!

I am so grateful to you for supporting the Petalled Sonia book! Please help me get the word out about this campaign if you know someone who would enjoy and benefit from this inspiring story.

Connect with me on Facebook. I'll keep you updated on my progress!

Sincerely, 

Anastasia

About Me
<ul>
• My parents had both died by the time I was 20 years old. I had a lot of questions and doubts.

• I was a congregational rabbi in the United States before I made aliyah from North America in the year 2000, at a time when the promise of peace was still in the air. Shortly thereafter, a wave of terror began that lasted for many years - our lives were surrounded almost daily with suffering and tragedy.

• I have made it my life's passion to expose the multiple ways that Jewish tradition deals with tragedy, in an effort to bring solace and comfort to those who are seeking, who have not yet found it in the standard, better known teachings of Jewish tradition.

• Your assistance in translating this book into Hebrew will finally give millions of Israelis direct access to these teachings as they seek comfort and ways to cope personally in the face of a seemingly endless conflict.
<h3>What We Need &amp
<ul>
• I have raised half of what I need to translate, publish, distribute and advertise my book.  I am looking to raise at least another $5,000.
• For a pledge of $50 or more, I will be happy to include your name on a special donor's page.
• For a pledge of $180 or more I will be pleased to send you an autographed copy of the book (English or Hebrew, your choice),
The Impact
<ul>
• We all need to find a way to address this challenging issue.
• The English version of the book has already inspired and comforted many in their quest for new understanding.
• The ideas in this book are destined to change the lives of thousands of readers, and you can be a part of that transformative experience.
Other Ways You Can Help
• Please let others know about this opportunity.
<li>If you have not read it already, order your copy of <a href=""https://www.amazon.com/Miracle-Exploring-Traditions-Dealing-Tragedy/dp/9652294845/ref=sr_1_1?ie=UTF8&amp
column4: sr=1-1"" rel=""noopener nofollow"">""Where's My Miracle"" today!

**I have already raised $845.00 of a total $3700.00 I am trying to raise. I have $2855.00 to go, so I rounded up to 2900.00 for all the ""transfer over"" fees from one site to the next. Thank you for your contributions so far. If you are interested in why I switched sites - Please read this.

WHY

I’M ASKING FOR YOUR HELP:
I’m
honored to have been invited to attend the CALLALOO Literary Journal’s 2014
Writing Workshop hosted by the Black Cultural Archives, in collaboration with
The Equiano Centre at University College London, England. I have a chance to
work with esteemed poet Gregory Pardlo and be in residence with fiction writers Maaza Mengiste and Jackson Brown, as well as 20 other multi-genre writers selected from

an international pool!

CALLALOO is unable to provide
funding support for the writers who are attending, so we are asked to pay our
own transportation, room and board. Your individual support ensures my ability
to attend this workshop, to further my artistic development and to collaborate

with other artists from across the globe.

 WHAT I WILL BE WORKING ON:
While in residence at the week long workshop, I will continue the writing on
my current poetry manuscript, “Anchoring the Compass” as well as producing new
poems. This manuscript furthers the artistic exploration I began in my solo
performance play, “Ungrateful Daughter: One Black Girls Story of being Adopted
into a White Family . . . that aren’t Celebrities.” (awarded Zellerbach
Foundation, James Irvine Foundation grants).  This play examined my
relationship to my Black and Filipino ancestry and the many historical secrets
as a result of being adopted by white parents. “Anchoring the Compass”
manuscript extends many of the themes I began to explore in my play, including
the complexity of a hybrid, diasporic identity when one does not know one’s
birth family history nor has any visible, mirrored link to a particular
ancestral homeland. Many of the pieces in “Anchoring” explore how searching,
speculation, story-making, mythology and invention all play a part in the
development of the constantly moving, changing identities of adopted bodies.
Reproductive justice, family preservation and the resistance to human

trafficking are strong threads in this work.

Post workshop – I play to extend my
trip for one week:
2) to
continue my research on diasporic black adoptee communities. This research is a
major part of the work that is informing my new play in development, “Side
Effects”.  “Side Effects” is a theater/ dance / visual art project that
explores the personal and geopolitical impacts of inter-country and domestic
transracial adoption on Black, Asian and multi-racial bodies of color. This
multidisciplinary theater project speaks to the phenomenon of global adoption,
and adds to conversations around concepts of multiple diasporas and the
dispersal of bodies of color for white consumption, under the guise of
multiculturalism and philanthropy.
3) to
make connections to other adoptee artists working, writing and performing in London for potential

transnational artistic collaboration.

 WHY THIS MATTERS:
This
work is an act of resistance. The act of voicing back to the decades of having
our narratives written by other people is a critical step in these fields. This
manuscript adds to the short lineage of black diasporic women who have been
adopted across race and are producing poetic / theatrical / creative work. The
work of Adoptee poetics / adoptee pedagogy speak directly to the phenomenon of
global adoption, and the dispersal of bodies of color for white labor and
consumption, under the guise of multiculturalism and philanthropy.
In
addition – the chance to work with CALLALOO is an honor. CALLALOO has hosted
retreats, literary readings, symposia, performances, conferences, and other
gatherings that bring scholars and creative writers together in the communities
where the office of the journal is housed and at various institutions across the
United States, and in such
countries as Brazil, England, Cuba,
Mexico, and Ethiopia. Since
1997, Callaloo has also offered annual creative writing workshops that provide
rigorous sessions in poetry writing and fiction writing for new and emerging

writers in the African Diaspora.


WHERE DOES THE MONEY GO?
Your
contribution goes directly to assist with airfare, room and board for the
duration of the workshop and for the week of collaborative artistic meetings
post workshop. Your donations also go to the fees that Indiegogo and PayPal take out.
My
goal is to find as low cost housing as possible through using Airbnb, friend
connections, etc.
LET’S
DO THIS! I have 12 days to raise $2900.00. Please donate what you can and

please share with your communities far and wide.


================

ARTIST BIOGRAPHY
Lisa Marie is a Bay Area (Oakland) based, Black/Filipina
writer, playwright, solo performer, director, educator and one of the leading
voices in transracial/ international adoption education and advocacy. She is
currently touring her acclaimed solo show, <i>Ungrateful Daughter: One
Black Girls Story of being adopted by a White Family… that aren’t Celebrities,
a comedic look her experience of being adopted by a white family in the 1970′s.
She has performed Ungrateful Daughter in
the New York International Fringe Theater Festival, Los Angeles Women’s Theater
Festival, The Atlanta Black Theater Festival, San Francisco Solo Festival, San
Francisco Theater Festival, at StageWerx Theater, Off-Market Theatre, The Marsh
Theater at Berkeley &amp
Theatre, universities and academic conferences across the United States. <i>Ungrateful
Daughter has been awarded James Irvine New Works, Zellerbach
Family Foundation and City of Oakland Cultural Arts grants.Lisa Marie is the
original co-producer of the highly praised “W. Kamau Bell Curve: Ending Racism
in About an Hour”, the basis for FX television series, “Totally Biased w W.
Kamau Bell”. She directed “All Atheists are Muslim” by Zahra Noorbakhsh and
most recently co-produced “A History of the Body”, a new play by Filipina
playwright Aimee Suzara.
She has been teaching creative writing, poetry and
performance workshops for over ten years. She was the <b>2010-2011 Poet in
Residence at June Jordan’s Poetry for the People at U.C. Berkeley and
is an alumni in Poetry of VONA Writing Workshop working with Ruth
Foreman and Willie Perdomo. She was most recently published in <i>Eye to
the Telescope, in the anthology, Other Tongues: Mixed-Race Women
Speak Out, As/Us Literary Journal, Line/Break Special Issue on Asian American
Adoptee poetry, The Pacific Review and
others. She is currently focused in on her new manuscript of
poems, tentatively titled, “Anchoring the Compass” and obsessing about her new
play in development, “Side Effects”.
Lisa Marie has been featured as a commentator on CNN,
NPR, KPFA Berkeley, KPFK Los Angeles and was given the honor
of one of Colorlines Magazine’s “Innovators to Watch”for her
social justice work around black adoptees. As <b>Founder and Director of
AFAAD, Adopted and Fostered Adults of the African Diaspora, Lisa Marie has
helped build one of the first international organizations to focuses on the
needs of adoptees and foster care alumni of African descent. AFAAD provides
space for adoptees and foster care alumni to connect, heal from loss, create
support networks and advocate around domestic and international adoption
issues.
Lisa Marie holds an M.A. in Cultural Studies focusing in
African Diasporic Women’s Literature, and an M.A. in African American Studies
from UC Berkeley. She authored “A Birth Project”, a blog focusing on
transracial adoption and black diasporic identity 2006-2012. She is currently
an Adjunct Professor in Race and Resistance Studies at San Francisco State

University. lisamarierollins@gmail.com

poems, tentatively titled, “Anchoring the Compass” and obsessing about her new
play in development, “Side Effects”.
Lisa Marie has been featured as a commentator on CNN,
NPR, KPFA Berkeley, KPFK Los Angeles and was given the honor
of one of Colorlines Magazine’s “Innovators to Watch”for her
social justice work around black adoptees. As Founder and Director of
AFAAD, Adopted and Fostered Adults of the African Diaspora, Lisa Marie has
helped build one of the first international organizations to focuses on the
needs of adoptees and foster care alumni of African descent. AFAAD provides
space for adoptees and foster care alumni to connect, heal from loss, create
support networks and advocate around domestic and international adoption
issues.
Lisa Marie holds an M.A. in Cultural Studies focusing in
African Diasporic Women’s Literature, and an M.A. in African American Studies
from UC Berkeley. She authored “A Birth Project”, a blog focusing on
transracial adoption and black diasporic identity 2006-2012. She is currently
an Adjunct Professor in Race and Resistance Studies at San Francisco State
University. lisamarierollins@gmail.com",0.0,0,"2 Campaigns
|","Oakland, United States",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/london-calls-me-writing-callaloo/pica

Find One Reason To Smile is the first title in a series of motivating and inspiring coffee table books.

Author and entrepreneur, Anita Hawkins will share with you her very own, as well as  other moving stories from everyday individuals from all walks of life. Men, women and children, are welcome and encouraged to post stories where they managed to FIND ONE REASON TO SMILE through their unique storm or adversity.

Anita has launched this Indiegogo campaign to raise funds for an organization close to her heart.  100% of the donations will benefit Womencalledmoses.org.  Women Called Moses was created to be an underground railroad for victims of domestic violence. The organization seeks to prevent and end the cycle of violence against women.  They accomplish this through education and advocacy services provided to individuals, families, and community agencies throughout the United States of America.

Be one of the first twenty-five individuals to donate $500, and YOUR story and photo of your choice will be included in the book FIND ONE REASON TO SMILE due out June 2015. This series of coffee table books are being created to uplift, empower, inspire and raise funds and awareness for this very important cause.
Thank you for your support!

Run Amok Books: Our Story

Run Amok Books is a small independent press located in Princeton, New Jersey. We published our first book in the fall of 2016, and two more in 2017. In 2018 and 2019, we published 11 books in all. In a word, we are growing! And that is great news!

As we grow, so does our reputation. Each month, we find an increasing number of worthy submissions in our submissions in-box. True to our mandate, we strive to publish books that deserve to be published and that are routinely overlooked by the mainstream book industry.
Lying Bastard by Clint Margrave

For an acquisitions editor, there is nothing quite as exciting as opening an e-mail and reading an intriguing book pitch, that one-sentence elevator pitch which, ideally, hooks the reader immediately. Intrigued and hooked is exactly how we felt at the Run Amok office the morning we opened the e-mail from Clint Margrave and read his pitch for Lying Bastard. Admittedly, the title caught our eye right away. So we read on to the short paragraph summary that followed. Needless to say, we loved the idea of the book, and after reading the first few pages, we were hooked. We snapped it up. Now 13 months later, here we are preparing for a rapidly approaching publication day.
Our Challenge

The challenge for us at Run Amok Books is that while our publication list has expanded with great books like Stealing The Scream, our budget has not. This has left us to find new and innovative ways to find funding, ways like crowdfunding and Indiegogo. So why do we need more funds? The truth is making books in this day and age can be done quite inexpensively with the right software and a little bit of know-how. At Run Amok Books, all the editing, formatting, and much of the design is done in-house by dedicated Run Amok staff, who volunteer countless hours to projects they passionately believe in. So in a word, book production can be done relatively inexpensively (not to be confused with effortlessly) when the right folks are involved. Marketing the book, on the other hand, requires specialized skills and money to pull it off. Oh, we can and do send out countless emails to newspaper and magazine reviewers, and to bloggers and book lovers. But in the end, placing a print or a digital ad costs money. Having our books listed at places like Net Galley costs a lot of money, but it's money well spent, as a listing on Net Galley virtually guarantees that a book will be reviewed/discussed/buzzed by book bloggers, an essential part of the promotional equation. Just to give you a sense of the costs involved, below is a list of the fees involved in a book promotion campaign similar to the one we have planned for Lying Bastard.
- print ad in book review magazines like Foreword Reviews and Broken Pencil: $475 - $1000
- listing on Net Galley book review site: $400
- social media campaign (twitter, facebook): $100 - $150
How You Can Help

We are hoping to raise a portion of the marketing/promotional costs for Lying Bastard through crowdfunding. In order to give books like Clint's the exposure they deserve, we are asking for public support, for your help. Keep in mind that there are many deserving books, just like Clint's, out there, written by many talented people: it could be a friend, a family member, the girl that sits beside you in Lit Theory 101, or the guy clicking away on his laptop in your local coffee shop. We'd like to publish and promote as many of these books as possible. In order to do that, we're going to need additional funding. And that is where you come in. Please consider supporting this promotional campaign, and when you do, choose a perk, our way of saying ""Thank You"" for your support.

Well-being is available to all and integrating it in modern life is essential for humanity.

Most of us live in a fast-paced, constantly changing environment with a focus on surviving everyday stresses. The culture is largely one that often dismisses wellness when challenges arise and attaches guilt when it is prioritized.

The integrated nature of different dimensions of wellness is largely ignored so root causes of illness are not identified, often causing a life time of needless suffering for millions of people. Systems created with great intentions to support us, instead hold us prisoner. This is the real global pandemic of our time.

The Whole Human: Integrating wellness in modern life is here to illuminate how it is all connected at an individual and societal level, how to integrate meaningful changes easily into your own modern life, and how together we can enact meaningful changes
column2:
integrating well-being directly into society.

My name is Luna Gladman and I am the author of The Whole Human: Integrating Wellness in Modern Life.

column1:
I wrote this book following an awakening time studying and practicing the ancient Indian holistic wellness medicine Ayurveda. It began an exciting and scary journey exploring aspects of wellness often ignored in today’s society. Believing that one’s well-being is for all, not just hippies in the Himalayas, I examined the current perceptions of wellness in our modern life, especially in healthcare, business, and education. Seeing that there are many pioneers leading the way to integrate wellness into modern life yet few integrating it in a holistic sense, I set out to build an integrated vision, combining ancient wisdom, modern trends, expert insights and of course my own perspective.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will remember and recognize the importance of acknowledging all aspects of yourself
column2:
in an individual and collective sense. In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for shameless, intuitive, and natural well-being. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you experience for yourself what well-being means and reflect on what is really happening in today’s society that limits this potential we all already have.

In this book, you'll learn about all dimensions of well-being and the impact this has for you as an individual and also for us as a society. You'll hear stories on what holistic well-being really means through lived experiences from a range of well-being advocates. Such as...

column1: <ul>
<li>

Roslyn Snyder, a psychologist for 25 years who works directly with the, some of the most challenging cases in society, such as murderers, rapists and suicidal patients. I examine what accounts for her success and where society and systems are not working.
<li>

Ayu Puspita Dewi broke through from years of mental and physical ill health to reconnect with herself and resolve challenging conflicts in her relationships that could have torn apart her family for life. We look at her perspective on the real root causes of ill-health and its connection with conflicts, highlighting the connected nature of living.
<li>

Dr Sundara Raman, an experienced Ayurveda Doctor successfully treating patients from all over the world by applying ancient wisdom to some of the most complex and chronic diseases, challenging commonly held beliefs on what can and can not be treated.
<li>
Shikha Verma sharing some of her knowledge on what it is like to weave genuine wellness directly into workforces in global companies.

They and others are embracing different ways to bringing us back to our true nature, either in or outside current systems. You'll hear how this is impacting business and what we even think of as healthcare and education today.

You will love this book if you want to understand the connectivity of well-being within ourselves in a practical way and crucially with each other. We are not independent entities, our wellness is linked together as one collective wellness.

The Whole Human: Integrating Wellness in Modern Life is a nonfiction book that speaks to those ready to embrace well-being in their life and the visionaries in wellness who already know that wellness needs to be further integrated into our daily lives. I look at the way we do business, provide healthcare, and instill education in a new way

The book is written into 3 parts:

Part 1 encompasses chapters 1-4.

This section re-connects and goes inward in a simple way, exploring who we really are and what well-being is actually all about. We’ll discuss how it’s all connected, simplify well-being, and learn about coming back to our natural state of well-being through the opposite of what we’re used to: less doing and more listening.

Part 2 encompasses chapters 5-7.
You’ve got to breakdown to breakthrough! This section challenges beliefs, cultures and values at the societal level
column2:
to look at ourselves and connections with others from a radically altered perspective, allowing us to truly humanize globally.

Part 3 encompasses chapters 8-11.

column1: Re-align and get into flow! So we’re connected and humanized - what happens now? This section explores key areas of society impacted most by this altered perspective: healthcare, business and education. Finally, I bring it all together and establish next steps beyond reading this book.
What I Need &
This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
<ul>
• The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2021 (anticipated date)
• The Cover Design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
• The Layout Design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
• The Copyediting for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
<li>The Launch &amp
column2: Promotion Efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Winter 2021

column1: I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
<ul>
• You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish and a handwritten thank-you note (remember those?!)
• Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”).
• You will receive early access to the Introduction and some excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
• You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
• You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
• ...... And much more!
Campaign Goals

Tier 1: Hit $5,500 and the ebook/softcover editions get published (this is the minimum needed)
Tier 2: Hit $6,500 and the book will get a hardcover edition
Tier 3: Hit $8,500 and we’ll get an audiobook edition.
Who is Luna?

Luna is a globalised Wellness Catalyser experienced in full-scale change and transformation in both her career and personal life.

Luna wrote this book following eye-opening experiences that led to a deep understanding of why holistic wellness is so important to integrate in everyday life. It initiated a deep curiosity about wellbeing in a holistic sense at the individual and community levels. She wanted to bring wellbeing ideas often dismissed and show how they can be applied in a practical, global way in modern life.

In her spare time Luna is learning to pole dance, she also enjoys hiking, camping and travelling and visiting funky cafes with friends.

For more information you can connect with Luna at:
Email: lunagladman@gmail.com
LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/luna-gladman-cgma-4...
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/lunagladman/
Facebook https://www.facebook.com/lougladman

International Preorders (non-UK)

For international preorders, please do the following:

Identify the perk that interests you, e.g. 1 or 2 paperbacks
Select the pink ""Back it"" button to ""Make a contribution"" for the same amount (this choice bypasses the shipping address page)

Use this form to share your mailing address, so I can calculate the international shipping costs and invoice you for that amount via PayPal/Venmo

 

Risks &

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies are expected to ship.
Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone can support, but that doesn't mean you can't get something out of it!
I will reward the top 3 people who refer the most backers at the end of the campaign (30 days). Here's how:

At the top of the campaign page, you will see the ""share"" buttons. Click on the ""chain"" icon to get a custom link just for you. (Note: don't use the URL in the browser window as it won't work to track referrals and you won't get credit ?)
Copy that link and paste it on your social media, email it to a friend, or text a fellow book lover.
When someone clicks on that link and backs the book, you get 1 entry!

Please use #thewholehuman and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts!
Tag: #thewholehuman
Instragram - lunagladman / @newdegreepress
Facebook - lunagladman / @NewDegreePress


Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

With immense gratitude, love and oneness
Luna Gladman

Story of My Book

At 3 p.m. on June 17, 1997, my Dad was shot and killed outside of the Roadhouse Pub in Peabody, Massachusetts.

He was 30, and I was six.

This May, I will turn 30. Instead of letting the weight of that fact bring me down, I want to take the opportunity to do some good.

So, this year I introduce my debut book, 30.

30 is not necessarily about the age. It’s about this moment in time that has been precluded, motivated, and made possible by every bit of life. The good, bad, and ugly.

Though the murder of my Dad was traumatic, I am not broken, and I am also not alone. That is what this book is about—not my Dad’s life and death, though you will come to learn as you read just how much I want to honor both. It’s about post-traumatic growth, mine and others, and the extreme potential that I’ve found within humans who have gone through shit.

Maybe in sharing these experiences and stories with you—of loss, tragedy, missteps, and even better yet, growth—you’ll find resonance and a little inspiration. Maybe it will simply offer you some comfort as you navigate a life all your own. And maybe, if you’ve been as moved as I have by the need to end gun violence in this country, you’ll learn about some of the best and most immediate ways you can get involved.

In this book, you'll read stories of mine and others I interviewed—from our traumas and hardships, to our baby steps, leaps, and bounds. You'll hear stories such as:
• The three very different ways my mother, sister, and I have been affected by, and grown from, the death of my father.
• The moment that sparked one of America’s largest grassroots movement, led by Shannon Watts, founder of Moms Demand Action for Gun Sense in America.
• The devastatingly random knifepoint attack and robbery of a dear old friend, and her path through post-traumatic growth.

//

30 is a nonfiction book that speaks to those who have or continue to grow through something difficult in their life. It’s also for anyone who is or wants to get involved in gun sense efforts nationwide.

Following the successful funding of my presale campaign, I will make a personal donation to Everytown for Gun Safety and Moms Demand Action for Gun Sense in America.
<h3>What I Need &amp
column2: What You'll Get This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

• The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)

column1:
When I pre-sell 120 paperback copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
<ul>
• You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
• Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
• You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
• You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
• You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
• And much more!

About the Author

Brianna “Breezy” DiPietro is a communications professional by day, gun sense advocate and single mom by night.

She wrote this book not only to prove to herself that she could do it, and to cross it off her bucket list (check), but to also take a different approach to activism. Her burning desire to use her story to create change, combined with her affinity for writing, turned into this passion project focused on real human stories.

Years ago, Breezy was too often intimidated by the gun sense movement and its (very real and necessary) focus on political change and activism. Without the financial means to support fundraising and campaign efforts, and with a fear of phone banks and picketing, she was left wondering if and how she could get involved.

Then, she met Greg Gibson who used his book and the story of his son’s murder as his platform. For him, this opened up doors of opportunity and new ways for him to help support gun violence survivors, local organizations, gun sense education efforts, and more. Someday, Breezy hopes that she, too, can motivate others as Greg has unknowingly done for her.

For more information, you can connect with Breezy at bld.radicioni@gmail.com and on LinkedIn, Instagram, or Twitter.

International Preorders

For international preorders, please send me a private message.
 

Risks &
column2:
Challenges The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

column1: • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, and Instagram with your friends, family and network.
• Please use #BirthdaysOverBullets and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.
• You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
• Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!


Thanks again,
Breezy

","Story of My BookAt 3 p.m. on June 17, 1997, my Dad was shot and killed outside of the Roadhouse Pub in Peabody, Massachusetts.He was 30, and I was six.This May, I will turn 30. Instead of letting the weight of that fact bring me down, I want to take the opportunity to do some good.So, this year I introduce my debut book, 30.30 is not necessarily about the age. It’s about this moment in time that has been precluded, motivated, and made possible by every bit of life. The good, bad, and ugly.Though the murder of my Dad was traumatic, I am not broken, and I am also not alone. That is what this book is about—not my Dad’s life and death, though you will come to learn as you read just how much I want to honor both. It’s about post-traumatic growth, mine and others, and the extreme potential that I’ve found within humans who have gone through shit.Maybe in sharing these experiences and stories with you—of loss, tragedy, missteps, and even better yet, growth—you’ll find resonance and a little inspiration. Maybe it will simply offer you some comfort as you navigate a life all your own. And maybe, if you’ve been as moved as I have by the need to end gun violence in this country, you’ll learn about some of the best and most immediate ways you can get involved.In this book, you'll read stories of mine and others I interviewed—from our traumas and hardships, to our baby steps, leaps, and bounds. You'll hear stories such as:
The three very different ways my mother, sister, and I have been affected by, and grown from, the death of my father.
The moment that sparked one of America’s largest grassroots movement, led by Shannon Watts, founder of Moms Demand Action for Gun Sense in America.
The devastatingly random knifepoint attack and robbery of a dear old friend, and her path through post-traumatic growth.

//30 is a nonfiction book that speaks to those who have or continue to grow through something difficult in their life. It’s also for anyone who is or wants to get involved in gun sense efforts nationwide.Following the successful funding of my presale campaign, I will make a personal donation to Everytown for Gun Safety and Moms Demand Action for Gun Sense in America.

What I Need & What You'll Get This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August 2021.
The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)

The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this summer.

Hocking Hills Day Hikes

Some 2 million people visit southeast Ohio's Hocking Hills region every year, mostly to hike on the area's beautiful and varied trails. Yet no hiking guidebook exists -- until now. I'm proud to debut Hocking Hills Day Hikes (HHDH).
I'm Mary Reed
column2: I'm the author of Hiking Ohio and Hiking West Virginia, as well as other books and magazine articles about outdoor adventure in the region. I'm also the owner of a small Athens, Ohio-based publishing company, Get Out! Publishing. With your help, you can find yourself holding a copy of Hocking Hills Day Hikes in summer 2019. The book, both eBook and print book, will include:

column1: <ul>
• 25 trails in the Hocking Hills, from classics like Old Man's Cave, Rock House, and Cedar Falls, to some lesser-known trails on preserves like Christmas Rocks, Boch Hollow, and Butterfly Ridge.
• Basic info on each hike, including trailhead directions, trail length, facilities, and more.
• A brief description of what to expect from each hike.
• A descriptive photo for each hike.
• Easy-to-read trail maps for each trail, plus an overview map of trails in the region.
• Basic info about other nearby hikes.
How you can help

A professional-quality book requires more than paper and pen. HHDH will include professional design, professionally produced trail maps, and high-quality photographs. These are some of the costs that go into a book, even an eBook. Other costs including purchasing an ISBN, professional copy editing, and printing costs for the print version. Then there are fulfillment costs whether you buy the book on Amazon or at a local retailer.
Your support will help offset some of these costs until book sales begin. As you'll see, campaign perks include pre-ordering the eBook, print book, or both.
And please, help by sharing this campaign with everyone you know who loves the Hocking Hills.

Story of My Book

The Truth About Music is about how the music industry is evolving into a more artist-focused industry. With new music technology and ways to connect with people around the world, artists have more freedom than ever before and can build a successful career in music from the ground-up by staying ahead of new trends.

My name is Kaitlyn Fox and I am the author of The Truth About Music. I wrote this book because I love music and am excited about the ways the music industry is changing and putting artists at its center.

My hope is that, in reading The Truth About Music, you will discover the ways in which the music industry is becoming more artist-focused. In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for music, especially the 99 percent of artists who are working hard to build a career in music. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you break into the music industry and help the 99 percent of artists make their dreams come true.
In this book, you'll learn about what trends are in store for the music industry and how those trends are changing the industry. You'll hear stories such as...
<ul>
• How Steve Bogard helped pass the Music Modernization Act by performing a song in the courtroom.
• How the Music Fund is opening new opportunities for investment in artists.
• How Sarah Tudzin, a producer in LA, went from scrubbing toilets to producing the Hamilton musical soundtrack.

You will love this book if you want to break into the music industry and don’t know how, want to know how the music industry is changing for both artists and songwriters, or if you’re a music consumer who wants to know how to best support the artists you love.
The Truth About Music is a nonfiction book that speaks to small artists and music consumers who want to look at the music industry and the future of music in a new way.
The Book - The Truth About Music
The book is written in 3 parts.
<ul>
<li>
Part 1 contains the introduction + chapters 1-3. This section will walk readers through the history of the music industry as well as why this moment is setting up a major artist revolution.
<li>

Part 2 contains chapters 4-6. This section is all about what’s going on in the music industry today, including how artists are currently engaging with their audiences and what the gender climate looks like in the music industry on stage and behind the scenes.
<li>

Part 3 contains chapters 7-10. This section proposes new ways the music industry may evolve in the coming years by highlighting how artists can more effectively own their rights and what new strategies are being developed to better serve new, low-tier artists.
<h3>What We Need &amp
This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
<ul>
• The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April 2021.
• The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
• The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
• The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
<li>The <strong>launch &amp
column2: promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Spring.

column1: When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.
I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
<ul>
• You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
• Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
• You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
• You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
• You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
• And much more!
About the Author

Kaitlyn Fox is a student at the University of Michigan majoring in English and Spanish. She has published work online and in print as a music writer for The Michigan Daily and has published poetry with Lost Tower Publications in London.

As a singer/songwriter as well as an avid music listener, Kaitlyn hopes to pair her love for creating and listening to music by helping artists understand how to stay on top of upcoming trends in the music industry while simultaneously guiding music consumers in how to best navigate such a concentrated industry and support the artists they love.
Outside of book writing, Kaitlyn serves as an intern for the Hispanic/Latino ministry at her church in Ann Arbor and enjoys running and playing tennis.
For more information, you can connect with Kaitlyn at kjfox@umich.edu and at @kaitlyn_fox_author (Instagram).
<h3>Risks &amp

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
<ul>

• Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #TheTruthAboutMusic and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.
• You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
• Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.
Thank you so much for all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Kaitlyn Fox

column5: >We are lowering our stretch goal for printed books!  Originally our stretch goal was for 500 hardcover books and now we're aiming to print just 110!  I also found a cheaper printing alternative so we are able to save money!  We are also now no longer doing a Holiday e-book edition (you will still get an e-book but it will not be holiday themed) and placing the money towards printing the book instead, however your customized TJ art original will be holiday themed!

column1: My story

Hi, I'm Lori. I’ve been a storyteller all my life.  I began writing stories when I was 3 or 4, before I knew the alphabet by scribbling drawings in my journal.  Since then, I’ve been telling stories to millions of people to build iconic brands like Gap, Old Navy, and Google. Marketing is a form of storytelling that I fell in love with, but it’s always been a way to get closer to doing something that I’ve known I wanted to do - to write a book.  Stories have the power to bring together families and inspire others, which is what I hope my story does for you, a child, or your family in some way.
Why write this book?

Fear often leads people to live comfortable lives instead of pushing them to pursue what they really love.  Working a 9-5 job was comfortable and gave me everything I needed in life. Writing this book however, scared me, and that’s how I knew I had to do it.  If what you’re doing doesn’t scare you, this may be a good place to reevaluate whether you’re pushing yourself enough and if there is true passion there. And so I hope in the process of creating this book, I give the message that it’s okay to dream, to be scared, and to possibly fail.

Growing up, my parents had to work long hours to provide for the basic necessities.  Financial problems became the root of many hostile arguments, and slowly tore at the fabric of our lives.  My dad worked  twelve hour shifts during the night and would sleep throughout the day until he had to go back to work.  He missed out on my life to provide me with one.  Eventually, things collapsed and we lost the home we grew up in as my parents struggled to pay the bills.  Reading became a sort of refuge and way to learn about the world, and to understand what it looked like to have a family full of love and open communication.  I saw images on TV and in books of parents reading to their children, and secretly longed to have this kind of relationship with my own parents.  The image of a child curled up on his or her father or mother’s lap while hearing an exciting and inspiring story is a symbol of the kind of family life that wasn’t possible for me growing up.  Thinking that my book might not only inspire others but possibly bring together families is what motivates me to bring this idea to life.  And one day, when I have a child of my own, I can’t wait to curl up with them and read this story.

In a kingdom far away, lived people who use to be stars.  After hundreds of years, these people of the stars still have stardust in them which lights them up whenever they do something they love.  The story’s protagonist, a curious princess, discovers that in the process of doing what she loves, she not only lights up, but the world around her does too.

I’ve read this story to hundreds of kids ages 4-11 years old.  Although children as young as 4 can understand the story, I believe it has a timeless message that can be read by all ages.  When I read the Giving Tree as a very young child, I loved it.  When I read it as an adolescent, I loved it.  And when I read it again as an adult, I still loved it.  In fact, each time I read it, it meant something new to me.  I believe “Lighting up the World” will have the same effect.
<h2><span style=""color: rgb(0, 0, 0)
There are a few different reasons that explain why this book is unique including the inspirational nature, the illustrations, and the social aspect in the development process.
Inspirational

Ironically, in the process of making this book, I realized that doing something that lit me up helped reawaken old passions in others as well!  Artists who have been too busy with their day job started drawing again, others were inspired to quit their jobs to pursue something more meaningful, and hopefully the readers who read this will be inspired to do what they love throughout their lives.
Passionate Artist and Art

The illustrations and passion behind the art also make this book unique.  I knew I had found the right illustrator, not only when I saw her beautiful drawings but also when she told me her story.  TJ started her career in HR, but always had a love for art.  Eventually, she was worn down with her job to the point where she was getting sick.  TJ left her comfortable job to pursue a life she loves and has never looked back since.  Today she has garnered over 900 followers of her work and sold hundreds of her paintings some valued at over several hundred dollars!
Socially Created by Kids

This book was developed with the community of readers that I hope to inspire.  While doing the readings to children, I observed what worked and what didn’t (for you tech nerds who are many of my good friends, it’s similar to a product beta).  Unfortunately, many books don’t go through this process but like Guy Kawasaki, I wanted to involve the community that this was created for.  I also even engaged the kids further by having them choose the name of the princess and the color of the dress.  They even contributed illustrations of their own (a few that I will choose to publish)!  The kids that were involved in the making of this book were ages 4-6 and 7-11 and come from disadvantaged homes in San Francisco.  They belong to Family Connections, a non-profit that creates amazing programs for individual development and foster better connections between a parent and child. If you choose, you will be able to donate a book to a child at Family Connections, which I’ll personally deliver when I go back to read the published story to them.
More than just a book, Lighting up the World is about creating a community of people who are doing that - lighting up the world!
Why do we need $4,500?

While writing a book is free, actually publishing a book is rather expensive.  I'm paying artists and experts at professional rates to make sure this book is the highest quality it can be, and to ensure as many people as possible end up reading it. Contributing to this project goes directly towards my estimated production costs which include, developmental editing and copy editing ($500), cover art, book design and illustrations ($2,500), book marketing and incentives ($1,000), ebook distribution and formatting ($500).  TJ will have put in at least 5-6 months of work for this book once it's complete (and already has put in 3 months) and I want to be able to compensate her fairly.
Check out the great perks for contributors including the e-Book, the Dusty the Dragon plush, and even custom art by TJ!
Why do we need a stretch goal of $6,100?
It is my and TJ’s hope that you all will be able to have a physical hardcover book in your hands and this can only be possible if we raise the stretch goal of $6,100!
Your contribution will go towards:
Printing costs for the first run of the hardcover book ($1,300), Campaign shipping and fulfillment of orders ($300).
10% of all proceeds over our stretch goal will go directly to supporting the programs at Family Connections!
When will I get the book?
I’ve made great progress on Lighting up the World so far
column2: I am in the process of having the book professionally edited, and TJ is well on her way with completing the illustrations for the story.  My goal is to be finished with the book and e-Book before Christmas and have the hardcover shipped to you by January 2014. This date may be pushed back due to the nature of the publishing process, but my promise is that I will update contributors on my progress and the anticipated ship date.

column1: Gratitude

Thank you so much for reading this far and being part of the creation of this book and community.  When a child and parent sit down together or someone is inspired, it is due to your contribution.  To my family and friends, I cannot thank you enough for your support throughout this process.  All of the amazing things that have already manifested and will result from this simple idea could not have been possible without each and every one of you.

I would also like to personally acknowledge the incredibly talented artists and changemakers who have worked hard to make this project come to life. These people include: TJ Lubrano (positively wonderful illustrator and person), Professor Holly Brady (Stanford professor on Self Publishing, developmental editor and consultant), Jori Pearsall (video producer, advisor, project motivator, all-around awesome guy), Pat Lugo (layout designer), Tina Tam (Education Director, Family Connections), MaryAnne Fleming (Head of the Board of Directors, Family Connections), as well as Vlasta Komorous-King and Adam Skaates (Toy Wonder Engineers!, IDEO), John Kokko (project advisor), Marcus St. Marcus (children’s book storywriter advisor), Amy Bender(amazing friend, motivator, editor), the adorable kids at Family Connections (my inspiration), Knox/Happy(indiegogo stars and cuties), and all my friends at SELP who have been inspiring and supportive. Thank you.
FAQ
If you have any questions at all I'd be happy to answer them!  Please feel free to email lightinguptheworldbooks@gmail.com.
The art pieces you see here are still a work in progress. To stay up to date with the art, do follow our Facebook fan page!
Please pre-order your book on Indiegogo today! Even if you can't spend the cash, it would mean the world if you could share this campaign on Email, Facebook, and Twitter.
Thank you for being here!
","Update #2
Hi Everyone!

TJ and I are excited to let you know that we've reached our e-book goal!!!! We've also raised an additional $600 from dinner fundraising events which means we have $5,100 -  enough for softcover printed books! (I will not be placing the $600 funds into the Indiegogo system to save on the fees).
Thank you so much for your contributions.  Without each and every one of you this could not have been possible!
We still have 13 hours to go so let's keep sharing to get to our hardcover book goal which is just $1000 more!
TJ and Lori
Update
Hi Everyone!

Exciting News!  We are lowering our stretch goal for printed books!  Originally our stretch goal was for 500 hardcover books and now we're aiming to print just 110!  I also found a cheaper printing alternative so we are able to save money!  We are also now no longer doing a Holiday e-book edition (you will still get an e-book but it will not be holiday themed) and placing the money towards printing the book instead, however your customized TJ art original will be holiday themed!
$5100 - Softcovers (just $600 more over the goal and this will cover shipping and printing!)
$6100 - Limited Edition hardcover (just $1100 more and this will cover shipping and printing!) *Hardcovers will not be on sale on the Amazon and is only available now.
Thank you for all your support so far!
My story

Hi, I'm Lori. I’ve been a storyteller all my life.  I began writing stories when I was 3 or 4, before I knew the alphabet by scribbling drawings in my journal.  Since then, I’ve been telling stories to millions of people to build iconic brands like Gap, Old Navy, and Google. Marketing is a form of storytelling that I fell in love with, but it’s always been a way to get closer to doing something that I’ve known I wanted to do - to write a book.  Stories have the power to bring together families and inspire others, which is what I hope my story does for you, a child, or your family in some way.
Why write this book?

Fear often leads people to live comfortable lives instead of pushing them to pursue what they really love.  Working a 9-5 job was comfortable and gave me everything I needed in life. Writing this book however, scared me, and that’s how I knew I had to do it.  If what you’re doing doesn’t scare you, this may be a good place to reevaluate whether you’re pushing yourself enough and if there is true passion there. And so I hope in the process of creating this book, I give the message that it’s okay to dream, to be scared, and to possibly fail.

Growing up, my parents had to work long hours to provide for the basic necessities.  Financial problems became the root of many hostile arguments, and slowly tore at the fabric of our lives.  My dad worked  twelve hour shifts during the night and would sleep throughout the day until he had to go back to work.  He missed out on my life to provide me with one.  Eventually, things collapsed and we lost the home we grew up in as my parents struggled to pay the bills.  Reading became a sort of refuge and way to learn about the world, and to understand what it looked like to have a family full of love and open communication.  I saw images on TV and in books of parents reading to their children, and secretly longed to have this kind of relationship with my own parents.  The image of a child curled up on his or her father or mother’s lap while hearing an exciting and inspiring story is a symbol of the kind of family life that wasn’t possible for me growing up.  Thinking that my book might not only inspire others but possibly bring together families is what motivates me to bring this idea to life.  And one day, when I have a child of my own, I can’t wait to curl up with them and read this story.
What is the book about?

In a kingdom far away, lived people who use to be stars.  After hundreds of years, these people of the stars still have stardust in them which lights them up whenever they do something they love.  The story’s protagonist, a curious princess, discovers that in the process of doing what she loves, she not only lights up, but the world around her does too.

I’ve read this story to hundreds of kids ages 4-11 years old.  Although children as young as 4 can understand the story, I believe it has a timeless message that can be read by all ages.  When I read the Giving Tree as a very young child, I loved it.  When I read it as an adolescent, I loved it.  And when I read it again as an adult, I still loved it.  In fact, each time I read it, it meant something new to me.  I believe “Lighting up the World” will have the same effect.
How is this book unique?
There are a few different reasons that explain why this book is unique including the inspirational nature, the illustrations, and the social aspect in the development process.
Inspirational

Ironically, in the process of making this book, I realized that doing something that lit me up helped reawaken old passions in others as well!  Artists who have been too busy with their day job started drawing again, others were inspired to quit their jobs to pursue something more meaningful, and hopefully the readers who read this will be inspired to do what they love throughout their lives.
Passionate Artist and Art

The illustrations and passion behind the art also make this book unique.  I knew I had found the right illustrator, not only when I saw her beautiful drawings but also when she told me her story.  TJ started her career in HR, but always had a love for art.  Eventually, she was worn down with her job to the point where she was getting sick.  TJ left her comfortable job to pursue a life she loves and has never looked back since.  Today she has garnered over 900 followers of her work and sold hundreds of her paintings some valued at over several hundred dollars!
Socially Created by Kids

This book was developed with the community of readers that I hope to inspire.  While doing the readings to children, I observed what worked and what didn’t (for you tech nerds who are many of my good friends, it’s similar to a product beta).  Unfortunately, many books don’t go through this process but like Guy Kawasaki, I wanted to involve the community that this was created for.  I also even engaged the kids further by having them choose the name of the princess and the color of the dress.  They even contributed illustrations of their own (a few that I will choose to publish)!  The kids that were involved in the making of this book were ages 4-6 and 7-11 and come from disadvantaged homes in San Francisco.  They belong to Family Connections, a non-profit that creates amazing programs for individual development and foster better connections between a parent and child. If you choose, you will be able to donate a book to a child at Family Connections, which I’ll personally deliver when I go back to read the published story to them.
More than just a book, Lighting up the World is about creating a community of people who are doing that - lighting up the world!
Why do we need $4,500?

While writing a book is free, actually publishing a book is rather expensive.  I'm paying artists and experts at professional rates to make sure this book is the highest quality it can be, and to ensure as many people as possible end up reading it. Contributing to this project goes directly towards my estimated production costs which include, developmental editing and copy editing ($500), cover art, book design and illustrations ($2,500), book marketing and incentives ($1,000), ebook distribution and formatting ($500).  TJ will have put in at least 5-6 months of work for this book once it's complete (and already has put in 3 months) and I want to be able to compensate her fairly.
Check out the great perks for contributors including the e-Book, the Dusty the Dragon plush, and even custom art by TJ!

Your contribution will go towards:

The eighties were coming to a fast close in the city of Fort Collins, Colorado. Times were changing slowly and a man with a unique business ideas brings his dream to fruition, quickening the pace toward equality between men and women in our society in his own way.

Dennis Cortese brought the world DEBBIE DUZ DONUTS in the summer of 1989. The shop was far ahead of its time challenging the controversy involved in women's rights to go topless, decades before the ongoing Topless Movement known today. After its open in the summer of 1989, truck drivers and curious patrons from all over the nation swarmed the parking lot to be served by the topless waitresses staffing the donut and coffee bar. Close at their heels were the reporters sent from news stations, starting the seemingly endless coverage of the shop throughout its operation.

To commemorate DEBBIE DUZ DONUTS and its unique existence in the world of business, Cortese is seeking funding to write a book covering the fascinating and controversial history of the topless donut shop.

Overview

This fundraising drive can help The Drunken Odyssey continue its excellence in coverage of Miami Book Fair International, held later this month on the downtown campus of Miami Dade College.

Short Summary

The Drunken Odyssey with John King is a weekly podcast about the writing life. Since June of 2012,  I’ve released a new episode ranging from about an hour to 2 hours, with the occasional epic-length podcast. All 390+ episodes are free to download.

I’ve interviewed many famous writers on this show, including David Sedaris, Cheryl Strayed, Chuck Klosterman, John Waters, Nikki Giovanni, Rick Moody, Tony Hoagland, Greg Proops, Sharon Olds, Irvine Welsh, Martin Amis, Walter Mosley, and many, many others. 

The experience of putting on and releasing this show has been an extraordinary pleasure for me, but I do need some help making the show sustainable in the future. There are regular expenses of producing the show, travel expenses, and upgrades that would really help The Drunken Odyssey be able to keep releasing great content. I am asking m y listeners, new and old, to donate to the show towards these goals.

What We Need &
column2:
What You Get

This year, I’m trying to raise $500 for travel expenses.

Administrative costs: hosting on Wordpress and file hosting on Libsyn.

Equipment upgrades: TDO really needs a new microphone.

Any cash left over will be saved towards future administrative costs. 

The perks are fab! 

If I reach my goal of $500, I'll record a bonus episode for donors.

The Impact

The Drunken Odyssey offers a great value to the literary community. Its interviews are remarkable. The breadth of its scope is impressive
column3:
where else can you listen to novelists, short story writers, poets, journalists, screenwriters, scholars, and artists discuss their process and life’s work? Plus, it’s like an uncensored NPR, so the host and guests (lie Art Spiegelman!) can curse when necessary, or admit when the world happens to be fucking far from a civilized place. 

Risks &
column4:
Challenges

Without some help, I may not be able to travel to Miami for the podcast this year.

Other Ways You Can Help

You can spread the word of this campaign.

You can spread the word of this campaign: 

You can review the show on iTunes.

You can like us on facebook.

Thank you for helping me keep up the good work!

Run Amok Books: Our Story

Run Amok Books is a small independent press located in Princeton, New Jersey. We published our first book in the fall of 2016, and two more in 2017. This year, we are slated to publish 6 books. In a word, we are growing! And that is great news!

As we grow, so does our reputation. Each month, we find an increasing number of worthy submissions in our submissions in-box. True to our mandate, we strive to publish books that deserve to be published and that are routinely overlooked by the mainstream book industry.
Stealing The Scream by Theodore Carter

For an acquisitions editor, there is nothing quite as exciting as opening and e-mail and reading an intriguing book pitch, that one-sentence elevator pitch which, ideally, hooks the reader immediately. Intrigued and hooked is exactly how we felt at the Run Amok office the morning we opened the e-mail from Theodore Carter and read his pitch for Stealing The Scream. So we read on to the short paragraph summary that followed. Who doesn't love an art heist story? A true, unsolved one no less. By this point, we had to read the book for ourselves, which we did in the weeks that followed. Needless to say, we loved it and we snapped it up. Now 10 months later, here we are preparing for a rapidly approaching publication day.
Our Challenge

The challenge for us at Run Amok Books is that while our publication list has expanded with great books like Stealing The Scream, our budget has not. This has left us to find new and innovative ways to find funding, ways like crowdfunding and Indiegogo. So why do we need more funds? The truth is making books in this day and age can be done quite inexpensively with the right software and a little bit of know-how. At Run Amok Books, all the editing, formatting, and much of the design is done in-house by dedicated Run Amok staff, who volunteer countless hours to projects they passionately believe in. In the case of Stealing The Scream, we even enlisted some outside help. We are indebted to Courtney Granner, who graciously and generously donated his time to creating a brilliant cover for the book. So in a word, book production can be done relatively inexpensively (not to be confused with effortlessly) when the right folks are involved. Marketing the book, on the other hand, requires specialized skills and money to pull it off. Oh, we can and do send out countless emails to newspaper and magazine reviewers, and to bloggers and book lovers. But in the end, placing a print or a digital ad costs money. Having our books listed at places like Net Galley costs a lot of money, but it's money well spent, as a listing on Net Galley virtually guarantees that a book will be reviewed/discussed/buzzed by book bloggers, an essential part of the promotional equation. Just to give you a sense of the costs involved, below is a list of the fees involved in a book promotion campaign similar to the one we have planned for Stealing The Scream.
<ul>
• print ad in Foreword Reviews Magazine: $475 - $1000
• digital ad in literary e-zines (such as BookPage): $300 - $450
• Listing on Net Galley book review site: $450 - $700
• Social media campaign (twitter, facebook): $100 - $150
How You Can Help

We are hoping to raise a portion of the marketing/promotional costs for Stealing The Scream through crowdfunding. In order to give books like Theodore's the exposure they deserve, we are asking for public support, for your help. Keep in mind that there are many deserving books, just like Theodore's, out there, written by many talented people: it could be a friend, a family member, the girl that sits beside you in Lit Theory 101, or the guy clicking away on his laptop in your local coffee shop. We'd like to publish and promote as many of these books as possible. In order to do that, we're going to need additional funding. And that is where you come in. Please consider supporting this promotional campaign, and when you do, choose a perk, our way of saying ""Thank You"" for your support.
