Adversity to Advantage: How to Overcome Bullying and Pursue the Path of Entrepreneurship 

This book will explore the stories and psychology of successful entrepreneurs who were bullied in adolescence. Furthermore, it will break down how these negative experiences fueled their fire, taught them valuable life-lessons, and turned them into the strong leaders they are today.

My name is Randy Ginsburg. I am the author of Adversity to Advantage: How to Overcome Bullying and Pursue the Path of Entrepreneurship. I wrote this book because I wanted to learn how to leverage my own experience with childhood bullying, and the experiences of others, to become a better entrepreneur.

My hope is that in reading this book you will discover that overcoming some of the hardest situations in life, like childhood bullying, can be leveraged to achieve both entrepreneurial and professional success. My hope is to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for entrepreneurship. And then ultimately I want you to use this book as a tool to help you embrace the hardships in your life and turn them into prosperous opportunities.

In this book, you'll learn about the psychology of post-traumatic growth and entrepreneurial success:

Tom Ford - Overcame bullying to launch one of the world's largest fashion houses and re-invent himself as a filmmaker. 

Elon Musk - How his familiarity with pain helped him to start PayPal, Tesla, and SpaceX.

Andrew Nikou - How he used his “super-power” to help him beat childhood bullying and go on to found OpenGate Capital, a $5B Global Private Equity Firm.

You will love this book if you enjoy entrepreneurship, business and personal development.

Adversity to Advantage is a non-fiction book that speaks to entrepreneurs and others who are interested in learning about post-traumatic growth and resilience for the first time.

Part 1 (Introduction and Chapters 1-3) In this section I will share with you the basics of post-traumatic growth and resilience, my own story and how my experiences with bullying motivated me to pursue the path of entrepreneurship.

Part 2 (Chapters 4-8) In this section you will hear inspirational stories of some of the world's top founders, what motivated them to pursue entrepreneurship, and how they were able to leverage their experiences with bullying to their advantage.

Part 3 will tie everything together. It will combine the narrative threads of Parts 1 and 2 and help you apply what you have read.

What I Need &
column2:
What You'll Get

This book will be published by New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help defray the publishing costs.  

Money raised will go towards the following:

column1: • The editor who I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in July, 2019
• Cover design - the mockups you see currently are just a placeholder!
• Interior layout (print copy and e-book formats)
• Copy editing
<li>The launch &amp

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
• You will receive a personally signed copy when I publish
• A personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering
• Your name will appear in a special Acknowledgements Section (“with Special Thanks to”)
• Early access to the Introduction and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
• The opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover
• I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share the experience of writing my book

And more...

About the Author

Randy Ginsburg is a senior in the Whitman School of Management at Syracuse University pursuing a degree in Entrepreneurship and Marketing. He will be starting a full-time job with Macy's in their Executive Development Program in July as a Product Development Assistant.

 

After overcoming his own experiences with childhood bullying, Randy focused on his passion of entrepreneurship, successfully starting his first business in high school buying and selling collectible sneakers. He has never looked back, immersing himself in the entrepreneurial ecosystem and seeking to learn more about other successful entrepreneurs who were able to overcome the same hurdles.

In his leisure time, Randy enjoys learning about the music industry, pursuing his entrepreneurial passions, and socializing with friends.

For more information you can connect with Randy at randy.ginsburg7@gmail.com and Randy Ginsburg (Facebook and LinkedIn), @Randy_Ginsburg (Instagram).

Fulfillment &
column2:
Distribution

There are no additional costs associated with shipping my book to you. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to ensure that we get a published copy to you as quickly as possible. We will keep you informed of every key milestone and let you know when your pre-order is expected to ship. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people may not be able to contribute, but there are other ways to help:

column1: • Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #AdversitytoAdvantage and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.
• You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
• Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,

Randy Ginsburg

","Adversity to Advantage: How to Overcome Bullying and Pursue the Path of Entrepreneurship This book will explore the stories and psychology of successful entrepreneurs who were bullied in adolescence. Furthermore, it will break down how these negative experiences fueled their fire, taught them valuable life-lessons, and turned them into the strong leaders they are today.My name is Randy Ginsburg. I am the author of Adversity to Advantage: How to Overcome Bullying and Pursue the Path of Entrepreneurship. I wrote this book because I wanted to learn how to leverage my own experience with childhood bullying, and the experiences of others, to become a better entrepreneur.My hope is that in reading this book you will discover that overcoming some of the hardest situations in life, like childhood bullying, can be leveraged to achieve both entrepreneurial and professional success. My hope is to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for entrepreneurship. And then ultimately I want you to use this book as a tool to help you embrace the hardships in your life and turn them into prosperous opportunities.In this book, you'll learn about the psychology of post-traumatic growth and entrepreneurial success:Tom Ford - Overcame bullying to launch one of the world's largest fashion houses and re-invent himself as a filmmaker. Elon Musk - How his familiarity with pain helped him to start PayPal, Tesla, and SpaceX.Andrew Nikou - How he used his “super-power” to help him beat childhood bullying and go on to found OpenGate Capital, a $5B Global Private Equity Firm.You will love this book if you enjoy entrepreneurship, business and personal development.Adversity to Advantage is a non-fiction book that speaks to entrepreneurs and others who are interested in learning about post-traumatic growth and resilience for the first time.Part 1 (Introduction and Chapters 1-3) In this section I will share with you the basics of post-traumatic growth and resilience, my own story and how my experiences with bullying motivated me to pursue the path of entrepreneurship.Part 2 (Chapters 4-8) In this section you will hear inspirational stories of some of the world's top founders, what motivated them to pursue entrepreneurship, and how they were able to leverage their experiences with bullying to their advantage.Part 3 will tie everything together. It will combine the narrative threads of Parts 1 and 2 and help you apply what you have read.What I Need & What You'll GetThis book will be published by New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help defray the publishing costs.  Money raised will go towards the following:
The editor who I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in July, 2019
Cover design - the mockups you see currently are just a placeholder!
Interior layout (print copy and e-book formats)
Copy editing
The launch & promotional efforts for my book

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
You will receive a personally signed copy when I publish
A personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering
Your name will appear in a special Acknowledgements Section (“with Special Thanks to”)
Early access to the Introduction and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
The opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover
I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share the experience of writing my book

And more...About the AuthorRandy Ginsburg is a senior in the Whitman School of Management at Syracuse University pursuing a degree in Entrepreneurship and Marketing. He will be starting a full-time job with Macy's in their Executive Development Program in July as a Product Development Assistant. After overcoming his own experiences with childhood bullying, Randy focused on his passion of entrepreneurship, successfully starting his first business in high school buying and selling collectible sneakers. He has never looked back, immersing himself in the entrepreneurial ecosystem and seeking to learn more about other successful entrepreneurs who were able to overcome the same hurdles.In his leisure time, Randy enjoys learning about the music industry, pursuing his entrepreneurial passions, and socializing with friends.For more information you can connect with Randy at randy.ginsburg7@gmail.com and Randy Ginsburg (Facebook and LinkedIn), @Randy_Ginsburg (Instagram).Fulfillment & DistributionThere are no additional costs associated with shipping my book to you. GET THE FIRST CHAPTER WITH ANY DONATION!

PC Walker - Pastor.Poet.Preacher

My name is PC Walker. I have been in full time ministry for more than a decade. I have been traveling as a speaker, poet, and teacher for nearly two decades. 

The Book - Beneath Broken Machines:
column5: >Reviving Trust In The Heart Of The Gospel

column1:
Traveling the country speaking for a couple decades, I have seen our propensity to build machines out of our faith. We like to put in the right things in hopes of getting out of it the right product. We become proud of the well-oiled machines of faith we have built. The trouble with well-oiled machines is they do break down. I have sat with a lot of Christians whose machines have broken down, and they have no idea what to do. They missed the heart of Jesus that is to be engaged, encountered, and entangled:

  • This book is for the ones whose lives are broken and bedraggled. 
  • It is for the ones who are smart enough to know how foolish they are, the ones who have tried but been found lacking.
column3: >This book is for the ones who need God's love to be closer and more real.

column1: The Costs and This Campaign
This book comes with a great deal of work and some costs:
<ul>
• My publishing and marketing costs are going to be about $4000
• All the funds raised here will go toward the publishing costs and marketing costs of getting the book out to as many people as possible.
<li><span style=""background-color: initial
column2: >I am very excited to offer some different perks for those who choose to donate to the book project. These are listed in the right hand margin for your perusal.

column1: <li><span style=""background-color: initial
column2: >Starting Friday June 17, I am giving a copy of the first chapter to everyone who donates.

column1: <li><span style=""background-color: initial

• I am convinced God has given me words to write and that He has asked me to ""Go! Tell people My love is for them! Tell them My heart still beats for them beneath all their broken machines.""
  • I really want to see this book go to as many people as possible, especially to those who cannot and have not believed the love affair of the gospel.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • PLEASE GET THE WORD OUT! Share this page. Visit my website, follow me on facebook, instagram, and twitter. Please tell people about this book.
  • SHARE SHARE SHARE! The only way this works is if you are willing to share it with everyone you know. You can share this page and my book page ragamuffinpc.com/book

Lets do this!

Stories of Queer Diaspora:

In March 2012, ten local LGBTQQ youth of color (ages 14-22) applied to take part in an 8-week series of writing workshops. The workshop series, as facilitated by Leah Lakshmi Piepzna-Samarasinha, takes place once a week from April–June in order to cultivate a welcoming space for local im/migrant and 1stgeneration youth to write, reclaim, and proudly articulate their experiences.

I initially created this project as apart of the Creating Queer Community Program in July 2011. That program involved a 3 month grant writing workshop and application process. As a result, 'Stories of Queer Diaspora' was selected in the Fall of 2011 to be apart The 15th Annual National Queer Arts Festival and was awarded $500 by the Queer Cultural Center. That entire $500 award covered the cost of booking our showcase venue, The Mission Cultural Center for Latino Arts.

Since then, I have dedicated the last six months to additional fundraising efforts. I conducted a letter writing campaign (which allowed me to raise $200 to pay for the video editor and flyer design), successfully completed a 4 month Youth Venture program, and have also tried applying to numerous arts grants. I have engaged in all of these efforts while simultaneously organizing logistics for the workshop series, outreaching to youth programs, interviewing and also selecting the youth participants. This, on top of working full time, acting as a mentor to a Oakland migrant youth collective, and also taking community college classes part time has kept me actively engaged throughout the past year.

Overall, I have invested energy into this project because I believe young people deserve mentorship and compensation for their time, development, and artistic growth. So far, I have been paying for the workshop costs out of my own pocket which has included: food, bart tickets for all the youth, and printing costs. Although I have not been successful in receiving too many additional funds since that first grant, I am still optimistic that I will raise the remaining money needed to pay the youth and artists. It is at this point, that I am reaching out, with the hopes that the community can help me cover the rest of the costs of this important series. My initial vision was to be able to compensate these young people and facilitators for their time and art, and I am committed to keeping that promise.
Why I Started This Project

As a 24 year old youth mentor and Queer first generation Colombian arts and cultural worker, I have found there is a major lack of accessible mental and emotional health services for low income youth in the Bay Area. This is especially true for youth of color who, like me, do not have a lot of family support or resources. By creating and inviting other youth to take part in this storytelling project, we center holistic healing and wellness, self-determination, and collective based organizing through art.

Total Amount For Artist Fees and Youth Stipends: $3,200
With Your Donations...
In donating to the cause, you would be directly supporting all of the artists and youth involved in The Stories of Queer Diaspora Series.

If you donate $200 you are a big donor! I will personally facilitate a one hour creative writing workshop for you or your community group and will also send you a personalized poem from our youth artists.
If you donate $100 we will provide you with 2 free tickets to our final showcase and a signed poster.
If you donate $50 we will send you a copy of our limited edition hand made anthology featuring the work of SQD artists, mentors, and youth.
If you donate $25 we will send you 2 limited edition color photographs by La Loba Loca taken during workshop series.
If you donate $10 or more we will list your name and thank you on our facebook account!
Donations, be they small or large, are immensely appreciated!
The Impact

I find it is politically, psychologically, and professionally necessary for youth to develop and apply language based on empowerment rather then internalized shame and silence. This writing workshop series strategically acts as a two month long arts education and paid training program for queer youth of color who have been historically denied access to these types of essential arts, health, and job development services.
<div>
Other Ways You Can Help
Overall, Thank you so much for reading! I sincerely appreciate your consideration and support. If you can not donate at this time please...
<ul>
• Feel free to share this campaign with your friends or local community.
<ul>
• I also would love to invite you to join us at our intergenerational showcase!

Guest Artists include:
* Leah Lakshmi Piepzna-Samarasinha
* Yosimar Reyes
* Yvonne Fly Onakeme Etaghene
* La Loba Loca
* Amir Rabiyah
* Terisa Tinei Siagatonu
* Jean Melesaine
* SQD Youth Artists
Gracias again for your ongoing support!!!

If you donate $10 or more we will list your name and thank you on our facebook account!
Donations, be they small or large, are immensely appreciated!
The Impact

I find it is politically, psychologically, and professionally necessary for youth to develop and apply language based on empowerment rather then internalized shame and silence. This writing workshop series strategically acts as a two month long arts education and paid training program for queer youth of color who have been historically denied access to these types of essential arts, health, and job development services.
Other Ways You Can Help
Overall, Thank you so much for reading! I sincerely appreciate your consideration and support. If you can not donate at this time please...
Feel free to share this campaign with your friends or local community.
I also would love to invite you to join us at our intergenerational showcase!
Guest Artists include:* Leah Lakshmi Piepzna-Samarasinha* Yosimar Reyes* Yvonne Fly Onakeme Etaghene* La Loba Loca* Amir Rabiyah* Terisa Tinei Siagatonu* Jean Melesaine* SQD Youth Artists
Gracias again for your ongoing support!!!

What Is This Project About?

This project is about creating and finishing the novel, The Murders of Lillian Ross.  The book has been researched, outlined, and the beginning chapters have been written and critiqued up to about a 1/3 of the book.  The first third has been edited and critiqued by several professionals.  Those who have critiqued the pages at this point have left feedback that it is one of the most powerful pieces they have ever read and it is a book that needs to be finished.
Why This Book?

My goal with The Murders of Lillian Ross is to create a piece of literature that will inspire, challenge and have a lasting impact on the readers. My goal is to create a book that is worth reading a second time.
What Will the Money be Used For?
The money will be used for several things including:
<ul>
• The completion of the book
• The process of finding an agent and publishing the book.
• In the event that a publisher will not pick up the book, the funds will also go towards self publishing.
What is the Novel About?

The project is a realistic fiction that explores the world of similar pasts and the choices that are made, which affect who we are in the present.  The story takes you through the interviews of Lillian Ross, which are done by Allison McKinnen, a true crime writer.  Allison's past is filled with a dark secret and while she believes that she has overcome the demons that have plagued her, she quickly realizes that she has not come to terms with the events of her past.

This realization comes after spending considerable time with Lillian Ross, who is a woman convicted of murdering two men, her father William Ross and lover, Adam Lorent.  The majority of the story takes place on death row, where Lillian awaits her execution for murder, and is the story of Lillian’s life from her earliest memories of growing up in an affluent household.  But like many, her story is filled with dark secrets that force her to seek her own escape.

Unfortunately, her escapes leads her into a darker world than the one she left behind and by the final conclusion, Lillian succumbs to the grief and pain of both her past and her present. As Lillian recounts her history, Allison’s own story plays out amongst the vibrant detailing of Lillian’s
column2: she realizes that Lillian may not be guilty of the murders she’s been convicted of.  Allison tries to fight her own demons while trying to save Lillian. She becomes convinced that Lillian does not deserve the death penalty for her crime and begins to fight for her freedom.

column1: The book follows three story arcs to explore the two main characters.  Each chapter begins with a look at the trial of Lillian Ross and explores her past and who she was as it is spun by both the defence and the prosecution.  The second is the story between Allison and Lillian. The friendship that builds as they realize they share a similar history and of the struggle that Allison has when she tries to save Lillian.
The final arc is the story that Lillian weaves about her past.  It shows the many different choices that she made and how she allowed her past to control her life.

The three stories come together to explore how  different choices one makes can greatly affect the outcome. It addresses hard subjects such as abuse and suicide and it looks at how  experiences with tragedy and suffering shape the victim.  It looks at how our own choices in life determine whether we succumb to our own grief, or survive our darkest hours.
Will We Receive Updates?
Yes, updates will come throughout the writing process and also through the funding process. I will also share some pages with you as we get into the fundraising.
Thank you to everyone who contributes or gets the word out

Finally, I would like to thank everyone who contributes to the book or shares my project with others to get the word out about it.  Just knowing that people are interested in seeing this book finished will be a wonderful.

Tyler’s family is has to raise money for Tyler to get a service dog.  Tyler is Autistic, and because of his Autism, he is more than a handful at home and at school.  It is nearly impossible to keep an eye on him 24/7.  Tyler is, what we call in the Autism community, a 'runner'.  He has, on many occasions, ran off and hid from  both his family and his teachers at school.
This dog would not only keep Tyler safe, but it would help him in numerous other ways.  Tyler goes days at a time without sleeping at times
column2: the security of this trained dog will help him get the sleep he has been missing for the last 5 years.  This dog will limit Tyler's autistic behaviors and help him communicate.

column1: What We Need &

We have to raise $13,000 in order for Tyler to get this dog from the Organization 4 Paws for Ability.  Every bit of the $13,000 goes to purchasing and training the dog for Tyler.  Every penny counts, and anything you can do to help would be immensely appreciated.  If you donate, we have some special perks to offer you!
The Impact

Autism is a severe developmental disorder that affects the way a child sees and interacts with the rest of the world. It effects sensory, memory, motor and postural control. Social and communication skills may be compromised leading to social isolation both within the family and with other people. Many autistic children, including Tyler, display a tendency to bolt in open spaces making going to a mall or a restaurant almost impossible. Many autistic children also experience difficulty sleeping.

Service dogs have been proven to be an asset for children diagnosed with autism and their families. These dogs provide a social ""bridge"" for children who are often secluded by others because of their behavior or lack of social interaction. These well-trained dogs can also provide comfort as well as calm children who suffer from autism. Autistic children who run away and hide can also be quickly and easily found by assistance dogs that are trained to locate them.
Other Ways You Can Help

If we can just reach out to 13,000 people to donate $1, then Tyler could get this service dog.  PLEASE help us spread the word by sharing our page on Facebook and Twitter to help this adorable little boy!

This is the 2nd edition of Finding Angela Shelton with additional pieces that expound on the series of dreams and how they were premonitions to meeting angels. Literally. The new addition of ""Meet Me at the Fence Post"" explains what happened with the Army of Angels and how they are together creating escape routes and avenues of healing for more survivors.

Summary

I am a journalist, which means I need information. My imagination (though this may not be true of all journalists) is not great. I like to have hard facts on which to base a story, and a solid picture to describe.

I am also someone who is well acquainted with grief. When I was 13, my dad died unexpectedly. Less than a decade later, my 30-year-old sister died unexpectedly. For the vast majority of my life, but primarily as a young adult, I have grappled with grief, walking right up to the edge of the cliff before finding my way back.
Last but not least, I am a mom to a 1-year-old girl and planning to have more kids in the future.

The Last Sunset follows a college-age woman named Grace who blames herself for her sister’s death. The two planned a trip to Alaska, but Grace falls asleep at the wheel and her sister is killed in the crash. Later, she goes on the trip they had planned, but intends to take her own life at the end of it.

Grace marks each sunset as one closer to the end of her story – but every day that goes by shakes her conviction a little more. Through every interaction with the beauty of nature and the trust and love of other people, she learns life isn’t just about what happens to you.

I have tried to make progress on this half-completed novel, but I am blocked in part by incomplete information. I went to Alaska in 2014, a year after my sister’s death, and it was healing to me in a way I never anticipated. I want to capture that feeling. But I wasn’t able to explore much, and I want to be able to take my time and soak in the details.
But I'm running out of time to be able to do this trip as my family grows, and I need help getting there.
Fall in Anchorage

The novel takes place in and around Anchorage, so that's where I'll head. I'm planning on mid- to late September, when fall colors are vibrant. In the book, Grace takes a week-long guided trip through national parks and several towns, but uh, she saved for that for a long time I guess because that ish is pricey.
Here's more of what I would like to do:
<ul>
• Fly into Anchorage ($350-$400)
• Stay at an Airbnb or hotel ($700-$1,300)
• Rent a car ($400-$450)
• Guided kayaking day trip ($250-$300)
• Hiking and culture vibing (Free, theoretically)
• Eat sometimes (?)
My goal is to raise $1,500. I can't offer a whole lot in return, but I will offer these for fun:
<ul>
• Donate $50: I will send a personal thank you card and your very own personalized poem.
• Donate $100: I will name a character after you. First name only to protect the innocent.
• Donate $250 or more: I will include you in the dedication at the beginning of the book.
My Goal

I’ve spent many years writing, mostly in the nonfiction space of journalism. I have found comfort in telling other people’s stories and identifying problems to be solved in the world. But what I’ve yet to do is tell my own story through fiction, and convey the lessons I’ve learned about life, love, grief, and how terrible and wonderful the world can be all at once. I want to write the novel I wanted to read as a struggling young adult.
My Pledge

I've lived under deadlines my entire career, and I work best under pressure to deliver something people are expecting of me. Your contribution = guilt for every day that passes by that my novel isn't finished, which is my best motivator.

As a leap of faith, I'm including a link to the 60 typed pages I have of this novel so far for you to read. Please know it is a rough draft and if you want to ridicule paragraphs of it online, well, that's the risk I took.
Other Ways You Can Help
Encouragement of any kind is always appreciated and helpful.

The Story Behind My Book
Erin is an engineer who experiences a strange glitch in the machine that runs her optimized reality. This error sets her off on a journey of many questions and few answers.

My name is Grace Kwak and I am the author of The Glitch. I wrote this book because as an engineering student and Silicon Valley native, I'd subconsciously tried to “engineer” my entire life in a way that wasn't serving me. What freed me from this mindset was reading non-fiction books such as Trick Mirror by Jia Tolentino and How to Do Nothing by Jenny Odell, which floored me with their insight. The writing in these books is superbly on-the-nose, but it’s also not super accessible to people who aren’t big readers and who aren’t already interested in these kinds of ideas. I wrote this sci-fi novel in order to fill this need for an emotionally moving reading experience that welcomes any reader.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover that sometimes, something has value not in spite of how difficult it is or how much time it takes, but because of it. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to engage with twenty-first century tech culture, late-stage American capitalism, and everyday internalized misogyny.

The Glitch follows an engineer named Erin who lives in a hyper-optimized ""Silicon Valley on steroids"" world. Every day, a voice in her head tells her the best decisions to make, based on advanced data-driven algorithms. This system runs everyone’s lives by collecting, storing, and processing information. It assigns each person a career path where their passions and skills perfectly align, creates fulfilling relationships with their friends and family, and even builds their optimal day-to-day schedule so that they can reach their full potential.

Erin is an intensely cerebral person who is as perceptive and innovative as she is idiosyncratic and whimsical. She is afraid of what she does not know because her knowledge is what makes her valuable and what justifies her existence in this world. So when the system mysteriously begins glitching, she is the first to rush to the scene.

When people fall under a glitch, they become unpredictable and self-sabotaging dangers to society. Erin finds that the new, random nature of people is making the glitch impossible to fix. But then, she glitches herself and wakes up in the present-day world, where she leads a very different life. Now, she attempts to connect the pieces of her former reality with this new one and reckons with its implications regarding meaning, identity, and purpose. It’s not long before she realizes that what she's so desperately searching for, she already has.

You will love this book if you want to learn about the human side of technology, find your place on the spectrum from technophobe to techno-utopian, and grapple with existential dread.

The Glitch speaks to college students studying engineering and professionals in the tech industry who want to question the idea that moving faster, doing more, and constantly striving to improve is always better
column2: maybe the randomness and messiness of the universe can render reality beautiful.

column1: Ultimately, I hope that The Glitch inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into big questions like:
<ul>
• How has technology transformed the way that you perceive your identity?
<li><span style=""letter-spacing: 0px
column2: >What happens when you try to systematize and streamline emotional connections?

column1: • What defines ""progress"" in human history?
I really look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers.
<h3>What We Need &amp
This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
<ul>
<li>
The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2021
<li>
The Cover Design of my book (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
<li>
The Layout Design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats)
<li>
The Copyediting for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
<li>
<strong>The Launch &amp
column2: Promotion Efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this winter

column1: I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
• You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish and a handwritten thank-you note.
• Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”).
• You will receive early access to the Introduction and some excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
• You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
• You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
And much more!
Campaign Goals

Tier 1: Hit $5,500 and the ebook/softcover editions get published (this is the minimum needed)
Tier 2: Hit $6,500 and the book will get a hardcover edition
Tier 3: Hit $8,500 and we’ll get an audiobook edition
About the Author

Grace Kwak is a second-year student at UCLA, studying electrical engineering. Her day-to-day consists of grinding away at circuits and code but even throughout the hustle and bustle, her mind has always stayed with one of her biggest passions, which is writing. She finds that by putting words on paper, she’s able to free herself from the strict schedule of an engineering student and is able to live a different version of herself. When Grace isn’t writing, you can find her listening to angsty music and staring into space.
For more information, you can connect with Grace at gracekwak@ucla.edu and on Instagram @gracekwak.writes.

International Preorders

For international preorders, please do the following:
• Identify the perk that interests you, e.g. 1 or 2 paperbacks
• Select the pink ""Back it"" button to ""Make a contribution"" for the same amount (this choice bypasses the shipping address page)
• Use this form to share your mailing address, so I can calculate the international shipping costs and invoice you for that amount via PayPal/Venmo
<h3>Risks &amp

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone can support, but that doesn't mean you can't get something out of it!
I will reward the top 3 people who refer the most backers at the end of the campaign (30 days). Here's how:

• At the top of the campaign page, you will see the ""share"" buttons. Click on the ""chain"" icon to get a custom link just for you. (Note: don't use the URL in the browser window as it won't work to track referrals and you won't get credit)
• Copy that link and paste it on your social media, email it to a friend, or text a fellow book lover.
• When someone clicks on that link and backs the book, you get 1 entry!

Please use #TheGlitch and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts!
Tag:
Instagram - @gracekwak.writes / @newdegreepress
Facebook - @grace.kwak.7311 / @NewDegreePress 
LinkedIn - @grace-j-kwak / @NewDegreePress

Thank you so much for of all your support.

Love,
Grace

column2: maybe the randomness and messiness of the universe can render reality beautiful.

column1: Ultimately, I hope that The Glitch inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into big questions like:
How has technology transformed the way that you perceive your identity?
What happens when you try to systematize and streamline emotional connections?
What defines ""progress"" in human history?
I really look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers.
What We Need & What You Get
This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2021
The Cover Design of my book (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
The Layout Design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats)
The Copyediting for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this winter
I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish and a handwritten thank-you note.
Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”).
You will receive early access to the Introduction and some excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
And much more!
Campaign Goals

Tier 1: Hit $5,500 and the ebook/softcover editions get published (this is the minimum needed)Tier 2: Hit $6,500 and the book will get a hardcover editionTier 3: Hit $8,500 and we’ll get an audiobook edition
About the Author

Grace Kwak is a second-year student at UCLA, studying electrical engineering. Her day-to-day consists of grinding away at circuits and code but even throughout the hustle and bustle, her mind has always stayed with one of her biggest passions, which is writing. She finds that by putting words on paper, she’s able to free herself from the strict schedule of an engineering student and is able to live a different version of herself. When Grace isn’t writing, you can find her listening to angsty music and staring into space.For more information, you can connect with Grace at gracekwak@ucla.edu and on Instagram @gracekwak.writes.
International PreordersFor international preorders, please do the following:
Identify the perk that interests you, e.g. 1 or 2 paperbacks
Select the pink ""Back it"" button to ""Make a contribution"" for the same amount (this choice bypasses the shipping address page)
Use this form to share your mailing address, so I can calculate the international shipping costs and invoice you for that amount via PayPal/Venmo
Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can HelpNot everyone can support, but that doesn't mean you can't get something out of it!I will reward the top 3 people who refer the most backers at the end of the campaign (30 days). Here's how:

At the top of the campaign page, you will see the ""share"" buttons. Click on the ""chain"" icon to get a custom link just for you. (Note: don't use the URL in the browser window as it won't work to track referrals and you won't get credit)
Copy that link and paste it on your social media, email it to a friend, or text a fellow book lover.
When someone clicks on that link and backs the book, you get 1 entry!

Please use #TheGlitch and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts!Tag:Instagram - @gracekwak.writes / @newdegreepressFacebook - @grace.kwak.7311 / @NewDegreePress LinkedIn - @grace-j-kwak / @NewDegreePressThank you so much for of all your support.Love,Grace",1.0,0,"1 Campaign

column16: >Please take 3 minutes out to watch the video I prepared that answers many if not all of your questions. Then, share it with everyone you know.
column20:
>Hi I'm Stephen Ponder, a pediatric endocrinologist living in Central Texas. It's no coincidence that I became a diabetes doctor and Certified Diabetes Educator given that I was diagnosed with type 1 diabetes on March 1, 1966 when I was 9 yrs old. So, with nearly 50 years as an insider, I have a lot to say about what works and what doesn't for people living with type 1 diabetes on both a personal as well as a professional level.

I have been a pioneer on nearly all of the new diabetes technologies over the years. Nearly a decade ago I tried the first generation continuous glucose monitoring technologies when they first came out and struggled to understand how to make them work for me. More recently, I have had incredible success with the current generation CGM devices due mostly to my own personal trial and error. It has taken me several years to come to the point where I am today and this book is designed to share my secrets to practically eliminating severe high and low blood sugars. Learning how to anticipate blood sugar changes has made it possible for me to live more of a normal life than I ever dreamt possible. I want you to enjoy this same quality of life with me as well as avoiding diabetes complications.

I've been asked many times and in many different ways what Sugar Surfing is about. In reality, it's a ""manual"" form of what is called Fuzzy Logic Theory, applied to the personal control of diabetes. This has existed as a mathematical discipline for many years but has recently gained popularity in diabetes in regards to the control mechanisms used for some artificial pancreas technologies, plus many other device control systems. It's quite exciting.

Sorry to get technical, but it is. You can Google the term Fuzzy Logic and enjoy looking around, plus add the term diabetes to the search. 

Rather than try to program a machine to think like a human being, why not let a human being at least learn some basic Fuzzy Logic principles and do it themselves? Both are options, but I prefer the challenge that applying Fuzzy Logic to diabetes allows me to do: kick diabetes butt on my own terms!

I chose Sugar Surfing for its lighter hearted metaphor effect. Fuzzy Diabetes might aptly describe this condition to many of us who have had it a while, but it didn't resonate quite as well with patients and workshop attendees. Plus dressing up in a fuzzy outfit didn't appeal to me as much as the surfer persona.

Regardless of whether or not you are already using cgm or thinking about it, reading my book will make you a better user of continuous glucose monitoring with less anxiety and better results. You can take a couple of years to figure it out like I did. Or, you can buy my book and hit the ground running.

What We Need &

column1: • I want this campaign to reach at least 400 books at $25 each (plus shipping). I'll know that at least 400 new Sugar Surfers will be on the fast track to living a normal life in spite of the daily challenges living with type 1 diabetes.
• This level will help to achieve my goals to expand my self-funded diabetes education outreach efforts.

• My vision is to expand my conference series beyond Texas and to establish a retreat program for the newly diagnosed as well as those who are in transition or struggling with their control. Buy my book and you'll be helping to bring my face to face training workshops to a city near you.

• Regardless of whether or not I meet my goal, Sugar Surfing - The Book will publish. If we fall short, the illustrations I have planned may not be as pretty as they would be from a professional - meaning I'll just have to do more of the work myself.
The Impact
• More people will finally break through artificial barriers like getting below 7% with their A1c with a lot less low blood sugar events and dangerous long lasting high blood sugar.
<li>Improved quality of life for you and your family
• Avoidance of health complications from poor control
• Fewer people heading to the emergency room for Diabetic Ketoacidosis (My programs consistently lead the country vs. other pediatric programs using this metric).

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't afford to purchase your own copy of Sugar Surfing - The Book, please help me to get the word out to others who can. In return, you might be able to attend one of my free Sugar Surfing workshops that I'm holding in Texas and a few other cities already scheduled. People might also be willing to share their copy with you after they have read through it and taken notes.

Just giving more people a CGM and not spending a dime to teach the patient how to use it seems like a silly way to follow through after all of the millions of $s that went into developing the technology. Let's show them how these advancements should be done in the future.

Ask your local ADA and JDRF chapters to help, too.

I chose to use Indiegogo for this campaign in addition to my own social media sites because they are extremely efficient at helping to get the word out. Use their tools on this site to share your excitement for Sugar Surfing - The Book!

En 15 ans, La Gaillarde est parvenue à s’autofinancer à 94 %, mais elle dépend toujours en partie de subventions et de bourses. À cause des mesures d’austérité du gouvernement actuel, La Gaillarde perd cette année une subvention importante qui lui aurait permis de poursuivre ses activités. La survie de La Gaillarde est donc maintenant en péril.

C’est pourquoi nous faisons appel à vous aujourd’hui! Avec un don, vous pouvez contribuer concrètement à sauver La Gaillarde et sa mission. Ainsi, nous pourrons continuer à sensibiliser les consommateurs et tenter de changer le monde de la mode… un vêtement à la fois!

*Tirage - Avec un don de 20$ ou plus, vous courez la chance de gagner un panier-cadeaux d'une valeur de 340$, contenant un foulard Harricana, une veste Création Encore et un certificat-cadeau Gaillarde de 30$.
column5: >La Gaillarde – un pilier de la mode éthique québécoise!

column1: Ce n’est plus un secret pour
personne : l’industrie de la mode québécoise traverse actuellement une période
de crise. Il est difficile de survivre dans ce domaine très compétitif avec la concurrence grandissante de la mode rapide (<i>fast
fashion). La situation économique actuelle a causé la disparition
de marques comme Jacob et la fermeture d’une trentaine de boutiques de
mode québécoise, risquant l’avenir de nombreux créateurs d’ici. Il est donc
plus essentiel que jamais de soutenir les créateurs locaux et de revoir les

façons de faire. C’est la mission que s’est donnée l'équipe de La Gaillarde. 

Par ses activités de promotion, vente et représentation, La Gaillarde s’est positionnée comme un acteur incontournable dans le domaine de la mode éthique et locale.
La Gaillarde, plus qu’une simple
boutique
La Gaillarde
offre en boutique les collections de vêtements, bijoux et accessoires de plus
de 50 écodesigners québécois en plus d’une grande sélection de vêtements
seconde main et rétro pour homme, femmes et enfants. Notre équipe a pour
mission de promouvoir la réduction et la réutilisation des matières textiles,
en plus de soutenir les écodesigners québécois et d’encourager les passionnés
de mode à repenser leurs habitudes de consommation. www.lagaillarde.ca
« La Gaillarde a toujours su insuffler à son équipe
une vive passion pour leur travail, pour qui la mission de l’organisme est
devenue un véritable mode de vie. La Gaillarde est un incubateur de projets et
d’idées qui priorise le rapport humain plutôt que le profit à tout prix. La
Gaillarde se fait un point d’honneur d’impliquer la participation de son
équipe, des créateurs et des consommateurs dans le développement de sa mission
– tous a son mot à dire! »
- Annie
de Grandmont, directrice, et Elsa Girard, styliste à La
Gaillarde

column5: > « La Gaillarde a été pour moi le début

column1: d'une grande passion pour le ‘fait-main’. C'est en partie grâce à La Gaillarde
que j'ai pu faire grandir mon entreprise et apprendre à évoluer dans mon
processus créatif. Quand peu de boutiques étaient prêtes à embarquer dans mon
aventure, La Gaillarde a été là pour m'aider à valoriser mes produits. J'espère
que plusieurs autres créateurs profiteront aussi de cette chance. »
- Patricia
Jodoin, designer pour Création Encore
La Gaillarde au festival Mode et Design en 2007
Gaspillage
massif de matières textiles, mauvaises conditions des travailleurs, méthodes de
productions néfastes pour l’environnement : l’industrie de la mode est
l’une des plus polluantes dans le monde et la popularité grandissante du fast fashion ne fait qu’empirer la situation. Au Québec,
chaque personne consomme environ 27
kg de vêtements annuellement et, dans son ensemble, la
population jette plus de 100 000 tonnes de matières textiles.
L’équipe
dévouée de La Gaillarde travaille sans relâche afin de sensibiliser les
consommateurs quant aux nombreux impacts environnementaux et sociaux reliés à
l’industrie de la mode.
Quelques-unes de nos réalisations
<ul>
<li>Boutique pionnière
en mode éthique au Québec et une référence reconnue dans le domaine
<li>Plus de huit tonnes de vêtements recyclés chaque année
<li>Sept événements « Mode de vie », des défilés-conférences
qui visent à promouvoir l’achat écologique et local
<li>Premier défilé de mode éthique 100 % pour hommes au Québec, en
septembre 2010
<li>Plus de 50 défilés de mode écologique afin de promouvoir les
écodesigners québécois
<li>Promotion de la diversité corporelle lors de ces nombreux défilés
<li>Soutien à plus de 120 écodesigners au cours des 15 dernières
années
• Lancement du concours Marque Gaillarde, en 2014, qui vise à contribuer à l’émergence
d’une relève en mode éthique
<li>Accueil d’une centaine de bénévoles, stagiaires et jeunes en
réinsertion à l’emploi
<li>Lauréate
de quatre prix en développement durable.

« La Gaillarde, c’est le foyer de ma famille
d’éco-designer. C’est LA place de référence pas seulement à Montréal, mais au
Québec. C’est surtout, depuis 15 ans, une équipe géniale, généreuse et
particulièrement à son affaire. Pourquoi donc pensez-vous que j’y fais mes
défilés depuis 7 ans ? »
- Musky, designer pour Musky Création
« Ce qui rend La Gaillarde si unique, c’est
l’ambiance chaleureuse et la passion de l’équipe que l’on ressent dès que l’on
met les pieds en boutique. J’aime magasiner ici car j’ai confiance et je sais
que je pourrai obtenir de bons conseils et un avis honnête. C’est rare que je
repart les mains vides !!»
- Camille
Trudelle, cliente à La Gaillarde
Un gros
merci de la part des Gaillardes !

UPDATE #1: Your Generosity, Our Gratitude, and a New Fundraising Goal: In under two weeks, your generosity has carried us beyond our original goal. We love your for this. $6,000 will sustain Blunderbuss for an entire year. Reaching our stretch goal of $8,000 would allow us to grow into a bigger, better Blunderbuss.
It
would allow us to expand our reach and publish more frequently, to
build up our commentary and reportage, and to experiment with new forms
of multimedia storytelling. To those of you who have already
donated, our appreciation is deeper than you know. But if you haven't
had the chance to chip in, your help is still important. The remaining

three weeks of our fundraiser could take Blunderbuss to the next level. Help us get there by spreading the word or contributing, and we'll love you forever.
___________________

What is Blunderbuss Magazine?
For two years now, Blunderbuss Magazine
has provided an internet home for essays, fiction, poetry, comics, art,
and other aesthetic shrapnel. Despite our shoestring budget, the

publication has grown into something that we're really proud of. YES! Magazine has praised us as one of the best things to come out of Occupy Wall Street. Harvard University's Nieman Journalism Lab lauded us for ""synthesizing the best of the classic liberal arts canon with a
deliriously diverse range of literary, philosophical, and historic
sources, all for the purpose of shining light on present-day political

and intellectual problems."" The Best of the Net Anthology honored a poem we published with inclusion in its 2014 edition. We even discovered a way to merge literature and karaoke.

Why is Blunderbuss raising money?
Whatever
we've managed to do thus far is thanks to our contributors. It's a
truism worth noting that if you don't have people writing for your
publication, there is no publication. We've had the good fortune to
publish over 200 original pieces from more than 100 different writers
&amp
column2: artists. By turns, they've produced work that is poignant, lush, moving, provocative, courageous, hilarious, and insightful. They've taken us to the Tribal Areas of Pakistan, to punk houses in Memphis, to South Dakota's Pine Ridge Indian Reservation, and to a funeral for their past selves.

column1: Through their vibrant, personal work, these contributors have insisted
on the visceral importance of claiming and documenting humanity in a
world that's often grotesquely inhumane. And until now, they've done so

for free.

We think it's high time they got paid.

So
far, all of Blunderbuss' expenses have been paid out of the pockets of
its editors. We've been happy to pool together the scraps of our grad
school stipends and bartending tips to keep this project afloat, but
unfortunately that pool is barely deep enough to cover the basic costs
of keeping the site online, filing non-profit paper work, and the other
little bureaucratic expenses that peck away at the pocketbooks of little
magazines. This means that we simply haven't possessed the resources to

pay for content.

You can help us change that. If you've
enjoyed the work we've run over the years, if you hope to see even more
of it in the future, if you want to live in a world where writers &amp
artists are paid for their labor, if you think creative work is work
worthy of compensation, and/or if you just want some of our cool swag,
please consider kicking a few tax-deductible dollars in our direction.

Whatever you can give, we promise you that our gratitude is immense.

We
are aiming to raise at least $6,000. If you help us get there, we will be able
to ensure that every writer &amp
Blunderbuss over the next year will get a paycheck. Any amount over our
goal will allow us to pay more contributors more money. Thanks
for reading. Thanks for considering a donation. And if you do donate,
the hugest thanks of all. You're helping put cash in the pockets of
artists, and that's pretty damn cool of you.
What can I do to help?

Donate! And take home some of our awesome perks! Seriously, whatever you can afford will be massively appreciated. You can also help spread the word by linking to our campaign (http://igg.me/at/blunderbussmag) on Facebook or Twitter.

Blunderbuss is a non-profit organization with 501(c)3 status.

Short Summary

The book opens with our protagonist, April Fields, moving to England after the death of her father, a famous race car driver. April is quickly thrown into the world of university, studying, friends and alcohol. April soon meets her new neighbour, Rachel Carter, and the two form a close friendship.

After a drunk kiss between the two women, April struggles to come to terms with her sexuality, having never thought of women in such a way. The two embark on a confusing journey to discover their feelings and try to find a way to be together.

The book attempts to deal with discovering your sexuality and coming out to friends and family in an uplifting way. I read a lot of coming out novels in my teens and feel they are a real comfort to people struggling with their sexuality.
<h3>What We Need &amp
I am looking £2000 to cover the costs of a good editor who can help my book reach its full potential. Along with raising money for publishing and designs.
Get involved and receives snippets of the book, previews of book cover designs and Q&
if the goal isn’t met I will still use what I’ve raised on a good editor!
The Impact

I want to publish this book to help people like myself who struggled to come out. Books like these are a comfort to be able to relate to characters, competing with all of the heterosexual novels out there.
Other Ways You Can Help
If you can afford to help or even if you can’t, I would love a share of my campaign!

In 2013 Douglas Lloyd started Vedder Press which is a third party publisher of Pathfinder and D&
column2: D 5e. In his spare time he has written short stories, a comic book and contributed to larger companies’ RPG projects. The purpose of this campaign is to pay for cover and interior artwork for a short first level Pathfinder adventure called ""Never Getting Out of Jail"". For a number of years people have asked about follow up RPG adventures that were created for other companies. The answer was ""I hope so"" or ""my publisher plans to"", nothing was ever published. We hope to publish a first level adventure that people play tested and wanted to see in print. If you have some spare cash and would like to contribute that would be appreciated.

column1: We only need $250 to pay for the cover artwork and interior black and white art. Accordingly a partial funding level has been selected in the event that this campaign does not meet the minimum $500 funding level required by Indegogo. We will be adding an authors PDF copy of an out of print Pathfinder RPG adventure set in the same town that Douglas wrote a few years ago when this campaign reaches 50% funding.
Risks &

Although we have never done a funding campaign a draft outline of the adventure has been completed and play tested the only challenge still outstanding is creating some old school black and white dungeon maps. We have already contacted artists who have sent us draft pictures.
Other Ways You Can Help
Feel free to tell your gamer friends about this Indegogo campaign.

Story of My Book

Why Listen? The Value of Intergenerational Storytelling in Today’s Changing World

The world is changing in big ways — from technological advancements, to new concepts of cryptocurrencies, to drastically shifting ideals and beliefs with the rise of Millenials and Gen Z. With all these things going on, what do older generations have to offer? What value do their experiences have? Why do we continue to tell stories, and why do we listen?

My name is Andy Kelleher and I am the author of Why Listen? I wrote this book because I wanted to share my grandfather’s stories in a way that is relevant to modern issues. My aim is to make the case for the value of intergenerational storytelling in today’s changing world.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover why we as humans tell stories in the first place, and why we feel the need to listen. In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for opening conversations with people of different backgrounds than ourselves. And then ultimately I want you to see this book as a tool to help you facilitate these conversations in your own lives and help build bridges between generational gaps.
In this book, you'll explore the connections between modern issues and my own personal quest to investigate my grandfather's past:
<ul>
• What does a Harlem neighborhood involved in a high-stakes hostage situation have to do with the debates raging over the memorialization of Confederate monuments?
• How does the story of my grandfather saving a woman from attempted suicide relate to the Anti-Vaxx movement?
• How can we use the story of my grandmother’s passing to talk about grief in the age of social media?

You will love this book if you are a storyteller yourself, are an avid listener to the stories of others, or are curious about how and why we tell stories from a biological, sociological, and psychological perspective.

Why Listen? is a non-fiction book that speaks to both younger and older audiences who are looking at the idea of storytelling in an in-depth way for the first time.
The Book - Why Listen?

The book is written in 3 Parts....

Part I contains the Introduction + Chapters I-IV. This part explores the concept of storytelling by considering the value of the content of stories themselves. Here, I explore how stories give new meanings to old events, update our understanding of the world around us, and can even shape social norms. For example, I explore how hearing the story of my grandfather responding to a hostage situation in a particular apartment complex gives new context to that same neighborhood for me half a decade later. I then explore this idea in the context of a modern issue: the fight to remove Confederate statues in light of new historical understandings.

Part II contains Chapters V-VIII. This part examines stories, not by their content, but by the interactions through which these stories are told. Here, I explore storytelling as a way to connect people together. By sharing our memories and experiences with others, we develop connections through shared understandings of events. I use the example of my grandfather saving a woman who jumped in front of a train to talk about how we judge not only the characters in stories, but the storytellers themselves. So how does this concept relate to how we form judgments of others in the internet age? Of our celebrities and politicians today?

Part III contains Chapters IX-XII. The final part of this book explores how stories define our legacies. This section examines storytelling as a vehicle of transmitting our own experiences onto others. By using our experiences to impact others, we can use stories to live on. This is essential to how we understand our own stories and connect them to the stories of human history. We explore this idea through the tragic death of my grandmother, Kay, and how her story continues to affect my grandfather’s behavior decades after she has passed.
<h2>What I Need &amp
This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
<ul>
• The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2019
• The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
• The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
• The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
<li>The Launch &amp
column2: Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this December

column1: When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a Spanish translation. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 250 copies of my book, I will publish an audiobook.
I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
<ul>
• You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
• A personalized, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
• Your name will appear in a Special Acknowledgements section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
• Early access to the Introduction of my book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
• The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
• I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share the experiences of writing my book
• And more...
About the Author

Andy Kelleher received his B.S.E. in Biomedical Engineering at Duke University and is currently studying the brain chemistry of opioid addiction at the National Institutes of Health as a post-baccalaureate research fellow. He has so far published a paper of his previous research in Nature Scientific Reports, and he hopes to attend medical school after two gap years. Aside from his studies, he is a budding creative writer with a passion for exploring the art of storytelling in creative ways.

His initial inspiration for the book came after visiting his grandfather, who lives with his Aunt Kathy, her husband John Farley, their daughter Isabelle, and their beloved dog, Duke. After a series of days spent “BSing” with Grandpa, eating at the local diners and listening to his cop stories, Andy decided to document in detail several stories that exemplified his grandfather’s character. After chronicling his own personal journey with discovering his grandfather’s past, accidentally paying for a subscription to Newspapers.com to look up old articles, and connecting with many of his grandfather’s closest friends, he decided to explore the topic of why this journey was even worth exploring in the first place.

If you had knocked on the door to his dorm room late at night during the week, you may have seen him in a dark room with a lamp on looking at black and white photos of his grandfather, or on Google Maps trying to find the right rock wall or the right building where a particular story took place. He would have likely turned around and pulled you in to show you what he had found, and whether you were interested or not, he probably would have read you one of his stories about Grandpa. But the people who did just that for him ended up being his closest friends, and he is forever grateful to them.

And just like with all stories, Andy’s story is the product of those within them. To the people who encouraged him, critiqued his work, or to those who simply listened to him, they are all contributors to this work. But the person most central, of course, is Grandpa John C. Kelleher himself. Their friendship continues to inspire the creation of this book and its campaign.

For more information you can connect with Andy at ackelleher17@gmail.com and on Facebook or Instagram (@andy_kelleher).
<h2>Risks &amp

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Instagram, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #WhyListen and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Andy Kelleher

BolaBlanca es una historia dura y directa que nos invita a encontrarnos con nosotros mismos.

column2: >Todos fueron a un concierto. Nadia, fue para demostrarse algo así misma. Tatiana, siempre es el alma de la fiesta y ella se lo pidió a Julián, que no pudo resistirse. Carmelo, no sabemos por qué fue y a Serafín nadie lo invitó. Irene solo buscaba una noche de desahogo. Lorenzo, bueno, ese es un tío con suerte y Yago iba con él. Tanis ya estaba dentro y Leo ni siquiera llegó a entrar. Todos se dejarán algo en el club BolaBlanca.
>Sus miedos, sus debilidades, sus viejas rencillas, su suerte, sus vidas.

column1: ¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una joven editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el emplear una campaña preventa para valorar la aceptación y viabilidad de cada título.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.
Hoy te presentamos a Perseus Roig.

column2: >Las historias aún no narradas están ocultas en el absurdo de la vida cotidiana. Cuando se las encuentra, el impulso de interpretarlas y después, contárselas a otros, surge no tanto del deseo, como de la necesidad. Así lo cree Perseus Roig, zaragozano nacido en los convulsos años setenta cuya semilla literaria germinó entre la fantasía, el terror, el humor más irreverente y la ciencia ficción, abonados todos con interminables horas de juegos de rol y muchos cómics. Bascula entre esos géneros y suspira por el día en que sea capaz de terminar una novela policíaca, su meta más preciada y, hasta ahora, más inalcanzable. No obstante, su trabajo como educador de menores, le ha hecho entender que la vida es un camino adoquinado con decisiones erróneas y, si se tiene suerte, con rectificaciones. Y, como padre, sabe que nada hay más fascinante que la creatividad de una niña que va creciendo: una fábula para dormir que sueña con ser novela.

column1: ¿Por qué?
Y por aquí una muestra de lo que encontraréis en sus páginas:

«―Resulta difícil encontrar algo que contar ―siguió ella―. Creo que fue el principal problema. Mi vida tampoco ha sido demasiado interesante, ¿sabes?
     ―Eso lo dudo mucho ―contestó Julián.
     ―¿Lo dudas?
     ―Lo dudo ―confirmó, cerrando los ojos mientras hablaba―. Eres una tía de veintitantos años que acude sola a un concierto de unos tíos que casi le triplican la edad y que se pone a bailar pogo en solitario al fondo del concierto... Desde que te vi, supe que había una historia interesante detrás de eso.
     Ahora fue Nadia quien se quedó sin saber qué decir. Solo giró la cabeza y, en plena oscuridad, miró hacia donde él estaba. Era una sombra indistinguible del resto de las sombras, pero aun así, su mente lo dibujó a la perfección. La silueta del tipo gordito, de cabellos desordenados y rasposa barba, la silueta del tipo que ha cumplido los cuarenta preguntándose adónde había ido todo su tiempo»
¿Cómo?
Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 880€
column2: esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cincuenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

column1: <ul>
• Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
• Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
• Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.
Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán como ayuda para sacar adelante esta primera edición de BolaBlanca que saldría después a la venta.
Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona a la autora, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Perseus Roig vea publicada su obra.
Gracias por vuestro tiempo.
","¿Qué?
BolaBlanca es una historia dura y directa que nos invita a encontrarnos con nosotros mismos.

Todos fueron a un concierto. Nadia, fue para demostrarse algo así misma. Tatiana, siempre es el alma de la fiesta y ella se lo pidió a Julián, que no pudo resistirse. Carmelo, no sabemos por qué fue y a Serafín nadie lo invitó. Irene solo buscaba una noche de desahogo. Lorenzo, bueno, ese es un tío con suerte y Yago iba con él. Tanis ya estaba dentro y Leo ni siquiera llegó a entrar. Todos se dejarán algo en el club BolaBlanca.
Sus miedos, sus debilidades, sus viejas rencillas, su suerte, sus vidas.
¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una joven editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el emplear una campaña preventa para valorar la aceptación y viabilidad de cada título.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.
Hoy te presentamos a Perseus Roig.

Las historias aún no narradas están ocultas en el absurdo de la vida cotidiana. Cuando se las encuentra, el impulso de interpretarlas y después, contárselas a otros, surge no tanto del deseo, como de la necesidad. Así lo cree Perseus Roig, zaragozano nacido en los convulsos años setenta cuya semilla literaria germinó entre la fantasía, el terror, el humor más irreverente y la ciencia ficción, abonados todos con interminables horas de juegos de rol y muchos cómics. Bascula entre esos géneros y suspira por el día en que sea capaz de terminar una novela policíaca, su meta más preciada y, hasta ahora, más inalcanzable. No obstante, su trabajo como educador de menores, le ha hecho entender que la vida es un camino adoquinado con decisiones erróneas y, si se tiene suerte, con rectificaciones. Y, como padre, sabe que nada hay más fascinante que la creatividad de una niña que va creciendo: una fábula para dormir que sueña con ser novela.
¿Por qué?
Y por aquí una muestra de lo que encontraréis en sus páginas:

«―Resulta difícil encontrar algo que contar ―siguió ella―. Creo que fue el principal problema. Mi vida tampoco ha sido demasiado interesante, ¿sabes?     ―Eso lo dudo mucho ―contestó Julián.     ―¿Lo dudas?     ―Lo dudo ―confirmó, cerrando los ojos mientras hablaba―. Eres una tía de veintitantos años que acude sola a un concierto de unos tíos que casi le triplican la edad y que se pone a bailar pogo en solitario al fondo del concierto... Desde que te vi, supe que había una historia interesante detrás de eso.     Ahora fue Nadia quien se quedó sin saber qué decir. Solo giró la cabeza y, en plena oscuridad, miró hacia donde él estaba. Era una sombra indistinguible del resto de las sombras, pero aun así, su mente lo dibujó a la perfección. La silueta del tipo gordito, de cabellos desordenados y rasposa barba, la silueta del tipo que ha cumplido los cuarenta preguntándose adónde había ido todo su tiempo»
¿Cómo?
Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 880€

column2:
Noble.

 

The book

Codex Enigmatum is an immersive and richly illustrated puzzle book, filled with a diverse mix of unique and interrelated brain teasers, riddles and conundrums. It features many one-of-a-kind puzzles designed specifically for this book as well as unconventional twists on well-known puzzle types.

Each puzzle solution yields a key to unlock future puzzles. In order to unveil the secrets of the codex, you will need to quest your way through over 60 varied and eccentric enigmas requiring a combination of lateral thinking, logical deduction, spatial reasoning and pattern recognition.

Are you up to the challenge?

The often very unconventional puzzles (each consisting of a two-page spread) require a unique approach and no two are alike. Each enigma is illustrated and the illustrations (rather than supporting text) offer subtle clues as to how the challenge should be approached.

Hints are provided to ensure you won’t get permanently stuck mid-way through your quest.

Planning

The book has undergone final play testing and is nearly print ready. Shipping is planned to start end of January/early February 2019.

 Specifications

Book type: Paperback, perfect bound

Book dimensions: 6"" x 9""

Pages: 140+

Puzzles: 60+

Shipping 

Rewards bound for the EU, US and Canada will ship from within the respective countries. No extra customs charges!

We provide the ice breaker to start the often avoided or taboo talk parents need to have with children: ABOUT money, personal finance and broader economic principals that can rely on the rest of their lives!

This book explains why children are NEVER TOO YOUNG to start leaning the essential life skills  Oh, that all of us could have practiced these skills earlier.

Maybe, we could have avoided some financial mistakes along the way.

The book is in two parts that will be packaged, distributed, and sold together. 

YNTY is the product of over 20 years in teaching high school students how to manage and protect their money. My observation is that by the time students get to their JR and Senior years they are capable of learning about MONEY but they are simply not prepared in the basics of saving and investing.  

I believe this is a book that can help teach the importance of saving and investing early.

YNTY starts with the fundamentals:
• What is money and why should we care about managing and protecting it.

• What MONEY can and can’t do and the dangers of not understanding the role it plays in our in every day decision making. Also covered are planing and budgeting, financial markets and the role capitalism plays in our economy.
• How to save and invest by weighting time value, opportunity costs and needs v wants.
• How parents can help kids can actually invest. How to set up and track  a virtual investment portfolio including fundamentals.
• Concepts of risk and money protection, using actual fraud cases,  biblical and other folk stories about what fraud is and how to avoid it.

Book One is the Training Guide for the mentor, hopefully the parent or grandparent, but any mentor will do very nicely.

Book Two is the student’s work book. I have set it up as an illustrated book that is also suitable for use as regular or digital coloring book. There are 130 illustrated pages in the coloring work book. This layout seems to me to be helpful in explaining often difficult concepts to teach.
